story:
Hello!

Hi, my name is Montserrat Cuellar Mestas. I’m an 18 year old Mexican girl learning the craft of acting, singing and dancing. I lived in the UK when I was little, I studied primary school there and that’s when I fell in love with the theatre and performing. I moved back to Mexico and I lived in Colima where I did high school. This fall 2014 I was admitted into the BFA Musical Theatre program at Santa Fe University of Art and Design in Santa Fe, New Mexico USA. I was awarded a partial scholarship for Performing Arts achievements. I’m currently doing my second semester at this college.

I need more financial resources to cover my tuition and housing, so I launched this campaign to be able to continue my education in order to pursue my dreams.
With the support of the people who can collaborate for my campaign, not only will I be able to continue studying and graduate from College, but I will become an artist that returns to her community and shares her knowledge and experiences, but above all I will be an example of tenacity and success.

What I need and what you get

I need to raise enough money to keep training and you can make that possible! 

The yearly cost of tuition and housing is $ 45,266.00 USD

The Performing Arts Achievement Scholarship is $12,399.00 USD

The difference to cover the yearly cost is $32,867.00 X 4 years is $131,468.00

My family has currently payed $11,600.00

To finish this school year I need: $ 21,267.00 USD

My parents are working hard on several jobs and projects to earn enough money to cover this years costs, but I need to find another way to be able to meet all the payments.    Most of the scholarships available for college students in the US require the applicants to be legal residents of the country, so I have not been able to participate in a lot of other opportunities.

It doesn’t matter the amount of money you can donate, honestly, every little helps. I have exclusive rewards for  everyone that supports my campaign, discover them on the right.  Also, please keep in mind that these are just a few ideas I came up with, but if you’re interested in another particular reward in return just message me and we can decide on something; I’m open to other possibilities.

All the funds raised through this campaign will go directly to the payment of my College tuition, even if the final goal is not reached, I will work hard to continue my excellent academic standing at this institution. I’m positive I will be able to sort it out and graduate in 2018.


Why help me?

The success of this campaign will allow me to have a quality training in the performing arts, I will be prepared to work professionally.

I also want to return to my community in Colima, México to teach, train, and inspire other young talents.  México has a lot of talent but there isn't enough support for cultural activities. 

If you help me, you will have my unconditional gratitude and I can  give you my word I will take advantage of every opportunity I will be able to experience throughout my education. I can keep you updated on how college life goes and my development as an artist and student of life.


Risks and challenges

Yes, I need a lot of money and that sounds risky but I’m sure it’s possible to raise it all or at least most of it.    For my campaign to be successful I need the support from you.   My plan is to monitor at least once a day the updates on the campaign and thank every single donor. 

How can you help me?

It's simple, spread the word and/or donate (hopefully both haha!). I would really appreciate it if you could donate something for my cause, I believe I have a lot of potential if I get a good foundation in the craft of the performing arts. If you really can't donate any amount, that's fine, I understand but you can still help me out. Let other people know about my story; share it with your friends, family or even businessmen.

Thank you so much for reading.

Now, lets make this happen!


Hola!

Me llamo Montserrat Cuellar Mestas y soy mexicana. Cuando era pequeña me fui a vivir a Inglaterra en donde inicié la escuela primaria y me enamoré del teatro la danza y el canto, regresé a México y viví en Colima en donde continué mis estudios de secundaria y bachillerato. Fui admitida para cursar la Licenciatura de Bellas Artes con especialidad en Teatro Musical en la Universidad de Arte y Diseño de Santa Fe, Nuevo México, Estados Unidos, en donde obtuve también una beca de excelencia académica y méritos artísticos.  Actualmente estoy cursando el segundo semestre de esta hermosa carrera que me apasiona.  

Necesito fondos adicionales para cubrir las cuotas de colegiatura y vivienda, por lo que me he dado a la tarea de lanzar esta campaña para poder seguir entrenando para lograr mis sueños.

Con el apoyo de las personas que puedan colaborar con mi campaña lograré no solamente pagar las cuotas de la Universidad y concluir mis estudios, sino que además me convertiré en una artista que regresará a su comunidad a compartir mis conocimientos y experiencias adquiridas, y sobre todo seré un ejemplo de tenacidad y logros.

Lo que necesito y lo que obtienes

El costo anual es de USD 45,266.00

La Beca Universitaria es por USD 12,399.00

La diferencia por cubrir  anual es de USD 32,867.00 X 4 AÑOS USD 131,468.00

Mi familia ha pagado hasta el momento USD 11,600.00

Para concluir este año escolar necesito: USD 21,267.00

Tengo recompensas exclusivas para todos los colaboradores que apoyen mi campaña,  descúbrelas!

Los fondos que se recauden a través de esta campaña irán directamente al pago de la Universidad, aun si no se lograra la meta completa, trabajaré para continuar con la excelencia académica que llevo en mis cursos. 

¿Por qué ayudarme?

El éxito de esta campaña me permitirá concluir mis estudios y posteriormente regresar a mi comunidad para compartir mi experiencia y animar a otros jóvenes para que sigan sus sueños.

El proyecto es valioso porque soy una joven tomando acción con una meta específica y clara. Sé lo que quiero lograr y estoy aprendiendo cómo llegar ahí.

Para lograr la meta de la campaña es necesario que muchas personas colaboren, me daré a la tarea de difundirlo a las personas que conozco, además de pedirles que pasen la voz para lograr una mayor cobertura.

Riesgos y desafíos

Lanzar esta campaña representa un desafío, pero estoy segura que será exitosa. Mi plan es monitorear por lo menos una vez al día para hacer el seguimiento y agradecer a cada uno de mis colaboradores.

¿Cómo puedes ayudarme?

Muchas gracias por tu atención. Quisiera pedirte que apoyes mi campaña de la manera en que tú puedas, ya sea colaborando y/o compartiendo mi historia con otras personas que conozcas que puedan ayudarme. Reitero mi más sincero agradecimiento.

Fui admitida para cursar la Licenciatura de Bellas Artes con especialidad en Teatro Musical en la Universidad de Arte y Diseño de Santa Fe, Nuevo México, Estados Unidos, en donde obtuve también una beca de excelencia académica y méritos artísticos.  Actualmente estoy cursando el segundo semestre de esta hermosa carrera que me apasiona.  Necesito fondos adicionales para cubrir las cuotas de colegiatura y vivienda, por lo que me he dado a la tarea de lanzar esta campaña para poder seguir entrenando para lograr mis sueños.
Con el apoyo de las personas que puedan colaborar con mi campaña lograré no solamente pagar las cuotas de la Universidad y concluir mis estudios, sino que además me convertiré en una artista que regresará a su comunidad a compartir mis conocimientos y experiencias adquiridas, y sobre todo seré un ejemplo de tenacidad y logros.

Lo que necesito y lo que obtienes


El costo anual es de USD 45,266.00
La Beca Universitaria es por USD 12,399.00
La diferencia por cubrir  anual es de USD 32,867.00 X 4 AÑOS USD 131,468.00
Mi familia ha pagado hasta el momento USD 11,600.00
Para concluir este año escolar necesito: USD 21,267.00
Tengo recompensas exclusivas para todos los colaboradores que apoyen mi campaña,  descúbrelas!
Los fondos que se recauden a través de esta campaña irán directamente al pago de la Universidad, aun si no se lograra la meta completa, trabajaré para continuar con la excelencia académica que llevo en mis cursos. 

¿Por qué ayudarme?
El éxito de esta campaña me permitirá concluir mis estudios y posteriormente regresar a mi comunidad para compartir mi experiencia y animar a otros jóvenes para que sigan sus sueños.
El proyecto es valioso porque soy una joven tomando acción con una meta específica y clara. Sé lo que quiero lograr y estoy aprendiendo cómo llegar ahí.

Para lograr la meta de la campaña es necesario que muchas personas colaboren, me daré a la tarea de difundirlo a las personas que conozco, además de pedirles que pasen la voz para lograr una mayor cobertura.

Riesgos y desafíos
Lanzar esta campaña representa un desafío, pero estoy segura que será exitosa. Mi plan es monitorear por lo menos una vez al día para hacer el seguimiento y agradecer a cada uno de mis colaboradores.

¿Cómo puedes ayudarme?
Muchas gracias por tu atención. Quisiera pedirte que apoyes mi campaña de la manera en que tú puedas, ya sea colaborando y/o compartiendo mi historia con otras personas que conozcas que puedan ayudarme. Reitero mi más sincero agradecimiento.

story:
Bref résumé

Finissante au baccalauréat en communication marketing, j'ai appris que je faisais partie des 75 chanceux admis à la MSc en Marketing Management à la ESADE (Barcelone). Cette université, classée 4e meilleure Business School en Europe en 2014, est des plus ouvertes sur le monde et donne des possibilités incroyables aux étudiants souhaitant faire une carrière à l'international. 

Ce projet est réellement important pour moi puisqu'il est la preuve qu'avec un peu de volonté, tout est possible. Je souhaite pouvoir inspirer les gens qui m'entourent à croire en leurs capacités et à mener à bien les projets qui leur tiennent à coeur.  Considérant que je suis l'une des premières personnes de la ville de Québec à aller étudier à cette université, j'ai l'impression d'avoir l'opportunité de montrer à tous que les seules barrières qui nous empêchent de faire des grandes choses sont celles que l'on s'impose soi-même. Rien n'est trop beau ni trop grand!

Mon objectif de total est de 40 000$ soit le montant relié aux frais de scolarité, mais comme je suis une personne réaliste, 2500$ me paraît être un montant atteignable par le biais d'INDIEGOGO. Cet argent servira à réserver ma place au sein de la cohorte 2015-2016.


L'impact

En soi, même le processus de sélection m'a permis de me dépasser et repousser mes limites, en lesquelles bien des fois je dois admettre avoir douté; alors, imaginez ce que des études dans cette université peuvent m'apporter! Cette maîtrise d'une durée d'un an m'offrira un monde de possibilités en terme de carrières. La qualité de l'éducation et la réputation de l'université me donneront également la chance de développer des compétences qui me permettront de me démarquer sur le marché du travail en vue de faire partie de l'élite dans mon domaine. 

Risques et défis

Il est important de mentionner que trouver cet énorme montant d'argent en à peine un mois s'avérera certainement difficile, mais maintenant que j'ai la confirmation qu'avec de la persévérance il n'y a rien de trop beau, je crois que je peux y arriver avec votre aide.


Conclusion

Si vous n'êtes pas en mesure de m'aider financièrement, sachez que vous pouvez faire toute la différence en partageant cette campagne auprès de votre entourage.

Enfin, le simple fait que vous soyez ici à lire mes mots me touche énormément. 

À tous, un grand MERCI!

story:
Prism Education Center is a non-profit organization located in Fayetteville, Arkansas. We opened our doors as an after school program in January 2012 to 10 students and a handful of dedicated volunteers. By May 2012, we offered both a summer program and a preschool program. Soon after, on August 20th, 2012, our private school opened with 25 students grades K-7th. A year later, in August 2013, we expanded to a second location which became home to our 3rd-9th grade students. But there was still room in our hearts for more, so in October 2013 we opened the doors to another 60 preschool students at a third campus. Despite our rapid rate of growth, the following foundations have not changed:

  • a strong school culture
  • a strong corps of teachers
  • a values-based education system that focuses on the whole child
  • a standard of academic excellence
  • a system of extensive support for our students

It is with this strong foundation that we endeavor to move into our next phase of growth and development. From the beginning, our vision has been to have all our students on one campus for the purpose of promoting community and service to one another. We believe it is time to make that vision a reality. 

Prism has secured property in Fayetteville and will be moving into the building phase this spring. The greatest challenge to reaching our goal is that of funding our physical building. 

  • We need an initial $200,000 for the contract phase of funding our building. 
  • If we do not reach our full goal, we can still build our building, but will be limited in size. This affects the number of children who have access to our program
  • If we raise more than this, we can move forward with our second phase of development.
Your contribution will have a great impact on students and families in Fayetteville, and beyond. As our Mission states, Prism is committed to developing children of knowledge, insight, integrity, and wisdom who will impact every sphere of society by expressing and representing a standard of excellence; which after only three years in existence, is already being proven within the walls of Prism Education Center, and within the local community. You can donate with confidence knowing that 100% of your donation will go directly toward the building fund.

Prism started with no significant source of funding but has operated by a spirit of sacrifice. However, now we are in a position where we are losing our buildings, and in response to that challenge, we are moving forward with our plans for securing a building that will sustain us well into the future. 

  • We had a great start to our campaign with a $100,000.00 donation! 
  • We have a strategic 3-Phase plan that will enable us to securely move forward without biting off more than we can chew, and ensure stability for our program for years to come.

If you are compelled to support Prism Education Center, but cannot do so financially, here are some other ways you can help:

  • Encourage your friends and family members to give to our campaign!
  • Share our campaign on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter using the Indiegogo share tools!

We appreciate your partnership!

story:
Silver Anniversary Art Auction | COUNCIL OAK MONTESSORI SCHOOL

­­­­­­­­


THE EVENT

The annual art auction will be held on Saturday, April 11th, 2015 at the Ridge Country Club, 10522 S. California, Chicago, IL 60655 from 6:00 pm – 10:00 pm. We hope you will join us to celebrate 25 years of Montessori education!

The annual Art Auction raises money for the Council Oak Scholarship Fund to help students receive the best education possible while reducing some monetary stress for the families. Festivities include drinks, generous hors d’oeuvres, live music, dollar drops, two silent auctions, and a rousing live auction with a comedic auctioneer.

Tickets are $25 in advance and $30 at the door. Tickets can be purchased at http://bit.ly/ArtAuction2015 or by mailing in a check to 11030 South Longwood Drive, Chicago, IL 60643.


COUNCIL OAK MONTESSORI SCHOOL BACKGROUND

This non-profit school was started 25 years ago based on the teachings of Maria Montessori’s philosophy and has endeavored to offer a classic and authentic Montessori program for children ages 3 to 15.

According to Montessori “A child’s work is to create the person he/she will become.” In order to accomplish the task of self-construction, children need freedom to engage in purposeful movement, exploration, and discovery of the physical and social world, and a program which is geared to their natural stages of development and sensitive periods for learning.

A Montessori classroom provides the kind of freedom the child needs within a structured environment, to develop a sense of order and purpose. The essence of the Montessori teacher’s job is to direct the child to those materials and activities he or she needs to learn. The teacher’s method and the organization of the environment ultimately aids the child in developing two most important characteristics: self-motivation and self-discipline.

For more information go to: http://counciloakmontessori.org/


OUR GOALS FOR THE AUCTION

We are hoping to raise $20,000 of profit for the student scholarship fund in order to ease the financial burden of private schooling. The average tuition cost for a student at Council Oak Montessori School is $7,300. Every year Council Oak Montessori School gives out around $20,000 in scholarships while receiving $0 of government funding! Since it is an accredited 501c3 non-profit school all money raised goes directly to supporting the students. This means that your participation will allow the school to give out more scholarships than we were able to before.


THE IMPACT

For many families, private education is a struggle. But it is an exceptionallyvaluablestruggle carried on in the best interest of those families’ most precious possessions, their own children. The struggle makes sense because the first ten to fifteen years of education (from pre-school through eighth grade) are the period in life in which every penny invested in a child’s education has its greatest effect. Study after study show the irreplaceable impact of early life experiences in later academic success and happiness.

A Montessori education is an extraordinarily valuable investment for any parent. The return on this investment is a happy, capable child equipped with unique skills which are critical for genuine success in a global society. This is the kind of young person that secondary schools and universities search for. Not only do graduates of Montessori schools have a solid starting point in education, but they also are confident people who leave the school with a deep rooted self-confidence.

Last year the Art Auction was able to support four students with scholarships from the $16,000 profit that was made from the event. Every small contribution that you could make matters.


RISKS & OBSTACLES

Our biggest hurdle for the event is to get the word out and get people to the auction. With limited funding for advertisements, we rely most on word-of-mouth from our parents and connections that we have via Facebook. In order to overcome this hurdle, we have brought on an event planner who has worked with multiple non-profits. Save the date, invitations, and advertising are costly so it is imperative that we can spread the word quickly and efficiently through many face-to-face interactions. 


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

·  Send donations to Council Oak Montessori School at 11030 South Longwood Drive, Chicago, IL 60643. Every dollar matters.

·  Donate silent auction items. These can be homemade meals, event tickets, paintings, sculptures, puzzles, tablets, gift certificates, lessons or classes—Get creative!

·  Volunteer to help with the days leading up to or on the night of the event. If you are interested, contact Sara Ther at sara.ther@counciloakmontessori.org.

·  Help spread the word about the Art Auction on Saturday, April 1th, 2015 at the Ridge Country Club, 10522 S. California, Chicago, IL 60655 from 6:00 pm – 10:00 pm.

April 1th, 2015 at the Ridge Country Club, 10522 S. California, Chicago, IL
60655 from 6:00 pm – 10:00 pm.

story:
Summary

Can you help send us to learn about a volcano in Costa Rica?  We are a group of students and teachers from Ben Franklin High School in Baltimore City raising money to tour Costa Rica.  We are working hard towards this incredible opportunity, but we need your support! 

What We Need & What You Get

We have currently raised the money for our airfare, but we want to take advantage of the unique learning opportunities once we arrive in Costa Rica!  By donating, you will be directly contributing towards a student's hike in the Arenal Volcano National Park.  We are hoping that we can raise enough so that all of our students can go on this educational tour.  If we fall short of our goal, the money will go towards a different activity to learn about the environment in Costa Rica.

The Impact

This trip to Costa Rica is the first trip under A Bridge Abroad, an organization that was started so that more Baltimore City students can have the opportunity to travel internationally.

A Bridge Abroad knows that the benefits of travel are innumerable.  When students are able to experience the world, they start to view it differently—with genuine compassion and curiosity.  Unfortunately, students from Baltimore City are not often afforded these life-changing experiences such as international travel.  By donating to this campaign, you're helping to change this!

Challenges

Due to a very recent setback outside of our control, we are a little behind in fundraising.  However, we have made plans to put us back on track to reach our funding goals.  This will be the second international trip the teachers have organized, and we are confident that we will be successful. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate whatever you can do to support our cause!  Here's some additional ways to help:

     Share our cause with a friend
    Attend any of our fundraising events
    Volunteer :)


    Thank You!!

story:
What We Need & What You Get


We need your contribution to raise $20,000.00 in order to buy new mats and promote fair and affordable Jiu-Jitsu competition for children in the state of Texas.

If we get the money we need by the end of May, our first Kids state tournament will be held in August 2015. All the future tournaments info will be published at Texas Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation Website

We are offering $8,145.00 in perks. 

According to your contribution level, you will get :

- The BJJ curriculum for children, it a box set with 5 DVDs, each one of them divided in 4 different teaching levels.It's destined to instructors and students alike

- The BJJ Games and Drills, a box set with 2 DVDs, containing several games to make the Jiu-Jitsu children class more interesting and desirable in any martial art studio. Also made with the instructors and students in mind.

- Jiu-Jitsu Private class.

- Membership for children.

- Membership for adults.

- Retailers packages,etc.


The impact


“From a small seed a mighty trunk may grow”

-Aeschylus

This is a unique opportunity for you to make a short-term contribution that will provide an exponential return in the future and help sustain and enrich our most vital assets.  Importantly, when properly nurtured, this asset has the power to literally change the world.  The asset that I’m referring to is our children. 

Unfortunately, many of our traditional institutions are failing to provide the necessary foundation and requisite life lessons for adulthood.  Rather than passively accepting the status quo, I chose to take direct action and work towards a solution using one of the most powerful teaching methods that exists today.  The method that I’m referring to is Brazilian Jiu-jitsu.  Through my academy, videos and Texas Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation, I’ve witnessed a positive transformation in my young students as they embrace the “gentle art” of Jiu-jitsu and the life-lessons that this martial art imparts.  The results and success stories that I’ve witnessed have far exceeded all of my expectations. 

It’s now time with to take the successes to an even larger stage and I need your help!

My goal is to improve cooperation state-wide and promote the image of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, as not only a safe and effective sport, but a vehicle and foundation for children to lead successful lives.

In support of this goal, we are going to promote a series of “one-of-a-kind” jiu-jitsu tournaments in the state of Texas, which will be unlike any other tournament in the world!  And yes, there is an essential tie-in to children.

We need your help to purchase new mats and other complementary equipment to help set the plan in motion.

I cannot think of a more positive environment for a child to experience  than a BJJ studio. Most parents turn to martial arts to teach their kids discipline. Discipline is only one of the positive aspect of martial arts. 

BJJ attracts people of different ages, backgrounds, and professions. But despite the diversity, every single one is there for one reason: to get better at BJJ. In today’s society the workforce is more diverse than ever. It is important for kids to see people of different ages, races, and educational backgrounds working together.

In every BJJ gym you will see students who are older receiving instruction from younger students. There are men teaching classes to women and women teaching classes to men.Unlike the corporate culture of some companies, in BJJ differences are not an issue. Children learn the importance of taking instruction and feedback from different people.

My name is Joao Crus and I am the head of The Texas Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation. The Texas Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation is an affiliation of Jiu-Jitsu schools across Texas promoting sportsmanship and cooperation in the sport of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. Its mission is to improve cooperation state-wide and promote the image of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu as a safe and effective sport. We hope you will join us in this goal.

Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is the fastest growing martial art in the world.  Given the rapid growth, we want to ensure  and promote fair and affordable tournaments in the state of Texas.

We need your help to purchase new mats and other complementary equipment.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please help us by getting the word out about this campaign.
story_txt:
What We Need & What You Get

We need your contribution to raise $20,000.00 in order to buy new mats and promote fair and affordable Jiu-Jitsu competition for children in the state of Texas.
If we get the money we need by the end of May, our first Kids state tournament will be held in August 2015. All the future tournaments info will be published at Texas Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation Website
We are offering $8,145.00 in perks. 
According to your contribution level, you will get :
- The BJJ curriculum for children, it a box set with 5 DVDs, each one of them divided in 4 different teaching levels.It's destined to instructors and students alike
- The BJJ Games and Drills, a box set with 2 DVDs, containing several games to make the Jiu-Jitsu children class more interesting and desirable in any martial art studio. Also made with the instructors and students in mind.
- Jiu-Jitsu Private class.
- Membership for children.
- Membership for adults.
- Retailers packages,etc.



The impact

“From a small seed a mighty trunk may grow”
-Aeschylus
This is a unique opportunity for you to make a short-term contribution that will provide an exponential return in the future and help sustain and enrich our most vital assets.  Importantly, when properly nurtured, this asset has the power to literally change the world.  The asset that I’m referring to is our children. 
Unfortunately, many of our traditional institutions are failing to provide the necessary foundation and requisite life lessons for adulthood.  Rather than passively accepting the status quo, I chose to take direct action and work towards a solution using one of the most powerful teaching methods that exists today.  The method that I’m referring to is Brazilian Jiu-jitsu.  Through my academy, videos and Texas Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation, I’ve witnessed a positive transformation in my young students as they embrace the “gentle art” of Jiu-jitsu and the life-lessons that this martial art imparts.  The results and success stories that I’ve witnessed have far exceeded all of my expectations. 
It’s now time with to take the successes to an even larger stage and I need your help!
My goal is to improve cooperation state-wide and promote the image of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, as not only a safe and effective sport, but a vehicle and foundation for children to lead successful lives.
In support of this goal, we are going to promote a series of “one-of-a-kind” jiu-jitsu tournaments in the state of Texas, which will be unlike any other tournament in the world!  And yes, there is an essential tie-in to children.
We need your help to purchase new mats and other complementary equipment to help set the plan in motion.
I cannot think of a more positive environment for a child to experience  than a BJJ studio. Most parents turn to martial arts to teach their kids discipline. Discipline is only one of the positive aspect of martial arts. 
BJJ attracts people of different ages, backgrounds, and professions. But despite the diversity, every single one is there for one reason: to get better at BJJ. In today’s society the workforce is more diverse than ever. It is important for kids to see people of different ages, races, and educational backgrounds working together.
In every BJJ gym you will see students who are older receiving instruction from younger students. There are men teaching classes to women and women teaching classes to men.Unlike the corporate culture of some companies, in BJJ differences are not an issue. Children learn the importance of taking instruction and feedback from different people.
My name is Joao Crus and I am the head of The Texas Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation. The Texas Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation is an affiliation of Jiu-Jitsu schools across Texas promoting sportsmanship and cooperation in the sport of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. Its mission is to improve cooperation state-wide and promote the image of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu as a safe and effective sport. We hope you will join us in this goal.
Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is the fastest growing martial art in the world.  Given the rapid growth, we want to ensure  and promote fair and affordable tournaments in the state of Texas.
We need your help to purchase new mats and other complementary equipment.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, please help us by getting the word out about this campaign.

story:
This summer, I will be boarding a plane to Pemba, Mozambique to attend an intensive missionary training program. For ten weeks I will spend mornings in class, learning from Iris Ministries staff and missionaries who come to teach from all around the world. During the afternoons I will be doing outreach in Pemba, Mozambique. I will also be spending a few weekends on outreach to the "bush-bush" which are rural villages further out from major cities. At the end of this 10-week program, I hope to do an extended outreach program.

I've spent the last year discerning where my life path is leading and I am so excited that it has pointed me to this school to spend some intentional times discerning the ins-and-outs of the mission field. I have spent the past few years becoming an anti-racist organizer here in New Orleans, and in the process it has become so clear to me important justice work is. I am excited to continue this process of  growing that I am currently in midst of and explore how I can accountably work in missions. 

As many of you know, I have my hustles and I have my paychecks, so in order to actually afford this school I will need the support of friends and family.

My costs will be around $6,000 dollars which will cover: tuition, airfare, buying clean water for the summer, groceries, supplies, and other living expenses.

I have never raised support before, so I am lacking in knowledge and contacts, so any guidance or support you can provide, individually, congregationally or prayerfully would be cherished.

story:
PAROLEINSEGNO: la nuova APP MOBILE che permetterà  di digitare una frase in italiano e visualizzare una clip video della traduzione in LINGUA DEI SEGNI ITALIANA (LIS).

    PAROLEINSEGNO nasce dalle difficoltà comunicative di genitori udenti di bambini sordi ed è parte integrante di un ampio progetto ad alta valenza sociale denominato  "Conoscere la Sordità",  volto a sensibilizzare la comunità alle problematiche del mondo dei sordi; inoltre, si prefigge, ove possibile, di contribuire anche economicamente all'attività di coloro che si dedicano quotidianamente al miglioramento delle condizioni di vita di ragazzi sordi o con  altre patologie invalidanti la comunicazione.

    L’impossibilità di accedere in maniera funzionale alle informazioni acustiche conduce inevitabilmente a un isolamento uditivo-linguistico che si traduce in “isolamento comunicativo”. Diventa quindi indispensabile, negli anni cruciali per l’acquisizione del linguaggio, che l’ambiente sociale nel quale il bambino sordo si trova a vivere abbia gli strumenti adeguati per condividere con lui tutte le informazioni necessarie.

    Si tratta di integrare le diverse possibilità per portare il bambino sordo o incapace di comunicare ad inserirsi meglio nella società, ad avere maggiore sicurezza e a sentirsi partecipe delle varie situazioni sociali.

    Il progetto Paroleinsegno, presentato dalla Fondazione dei Club Lions del Distretto 108 Ta3, è ideato e coordinato da FILMART STUDIO con il partner tecnologico GAS (Global Automation System), ed è una della attività sociali di eccellenza del Service "Conoscere la sordità" del L. C. - “Padova E.C. Piscopia" per l'anno 2015/2016.


    LE AZIONI DEL SERVICE

    A) incontri formativi sulle problematiche della sordità:

    E' stata realizzata recentemente una serata sul tema della LIS con relatori (Dott.ssa Francesca Peressotti della Facoltà di Psicologia dell'Università di Padova e  Dott. Gabriele Caia - sordo -  docente di LIS all'Università di Ca' Foscari, in occasione della quale è stato presentato ufficialmente il progetto PAROLEINSEGNO.

    Inoltre:

  • Conferenza "Impariamo la LIS" - Lingua dei Segni   (1 dicembre 2015)
  • Conferenza "Incontriamo il Mondo dei sordi"  (2 febbraio 2016)
  • Un convegno scientifico dal  titolo "Sordità: lingua dei segni, impianto cocleare e riabilitazione linguistica"  il 5 aprile 2016, organizzato insieme al Dipartimento di Psicologia dello Sviluppo dell'Università di Padova.

       B) divulgazione della LIS:

  • incontri tra gli studenti di alcune scuole del territorio e dei giovani sordi dell'ISISS Magarotto per delle lezioni di LIS.
  • produzione di strumenti multimediali per l'apprendimento della LIS da parte di genitori udenti di bambini sordi, attraverso la realizzazione del progetto PAROLEINSEGNO.

Il progetto PAROLEINSEGNO nasce dalla consapevolezza che il genitore del bambino con bisogni speciali incontra innumerevoli difficoltà nel poter frequentare corsi di Lingua dei Segni Italiana e vuole offrire un percorso formativo-didattico appositamente strutturato.

LE AZIONI DI PAROLEINSEGNO

1.   La produzione di un DIZIONARIO DI FRASI IN LIS

2.   Lo sviluppo di una  DEMO DI APP MOBILE INNOVATIVA  che avrà lo scopo                    principale di illustrarne la funzionalità per attirare nuovi investitori per                            sviluppare il successivo punto 3

3.  La ricerca di un algoritmo necessario allo sviluppo di un prototipo di  APP                     MOBILE che traduca in modo immediato frasi della lingua italiana in Lingua dei           Segni

TARGET E OBIETTIVI DELLA CAMPAGNA

Questa campagna di crowdfunding vuole creare i presupposti economici per la produzione di un PROTOTIPO dell'App PAROLEINSEGNO.

PAROLEINSEGNO si rivolgerà prioritariamente a genitori e famigliari di bambini con disturbi della comunicazione verbale siano essi sordi o con altre patologie, ma fornisce un valido supporto anche a docenti, insegnanti di sostegno, educatori, riabilitatori e allenatori di attività sportive, che lavorano a stretto contatto con questi bambini e che non hanno una formazione specifica.

CHI SARANNO I BENEFICIARI DI PAROLEINSEGNO

·famiglie di bambini sordi: in Italia ogni mese nascono fra i 50 e i 100 bambini sordi. 25.000 sotto i 10 anni hanno disturbi comunicativi per deficit uditivi, 7-8000 necessitano ogni anno di sostegno scolastico

·famiglie di bambini con altre patologie: bambini con patologie inficianti le capacità comunicative e di apprendimento (autismo, sindrome di down, patologie neurologiche)

·genitori di bambini udenti che desiderino iniziare una comunicazione precoce con i propri figli a partire già dai primi mesi di vita (vedi Baby Sign Language)

Beneficiari indiretti (12-15 mila)

·personale scolastico/medico

·la comunità

ORIGINALITA' DEL PROGETTO

La possibilità di fruire questo materiale su Smartphone e tablet consentirà al genitore e a tutte le figure in relazione col bambino, di gestire situazioni comunicative in ogni momento della giornata.
La nuova APP permetterà  infatti di digitare una frase in italiano e visualizzare una clip video della traduzione in LIS.  La frase potrà essere scelta da un insieme di frasi catalogate per argomento o essere scritta o pronunciata in italiano.
La realizzazione dell'App PAROLEINSEGNO si basa su due assunti: che esista un database di clip “base” in LIS e che si definisca un algoritmo che analizzi una normale frase in italiano e produca una clip finale che sia una sequenza di clip presenti nel database.

IMPATTO SOCIALE

Facilitare la comunicazione con bambini con disturbi della comunicazione verbale significa permettere lo sviluppo di autonomie e abilità relazionali, comunicative e di apprendimento. Tutto questo con ricadute positive sulla qualità della vita degli stessi bambini e del contesto in cui sono inseriti.

I PERK DI PAROLEINSEGNO

Lo sviluppo di questo progetto e il relativo impegno del nostro team nei confronti dei funder, sarà commisurato alla quantità di donazioni ricevute.

Il presupposto economico per produrre il prototipo finale di APP è il raggiungimento del goal della campagna: Euro 15.000.

Tuttavia, nei confronti di tutti i funder che crederanno nel valore innovativo e sociale di PAROLEINSEGNO, il team di lavoro garantisce comunque ringraziamenti, strumenti didattici concreti  e credit, a prescindere dal successo della campagna.

Nello specifico:

Da 0 a 7.000 Euro: non ci saranno i presupposti per lo sviluppo del prototipo  ma i soldi raccolti andranno a sostegno del Service “Conoscere la Sordità” che offrirà ulteriori strumenti per una migliore integrazione delle persone sorde, certi che questa si potrà realizzare a partire da una maggiore conoscenza delle loro problematiche e della loro lingua da parte del mondo udente.

Da 7.000 a 10.000 Euro: anche in questo caso non ci sono ancora  i presupposti per lo sviluppo del prototipo  ma verrà prodotto un dizionario di  100 frasi  in LIS (clip video).

Da 10.000 a 15.000 Euro: produzione di un dizionario di 300 frasi  in LIS (clip video) suddivise per categorie.

Da 15.000 Euro: saremo in grado di realizzare il prototipo dell'App PAROLEINSEGNO, per poter poi passare allo studio dell'algoritmo che permette di tradurre una frase dall'italiano alla LIS.

LA RETE

All'ideazione e sviluppo del progetto hanno partecipato attivamente diverse Associazioni Onlus nazionali ed Istituti Scientifici accreditati che operano da anni nel campo della sordità.

Oltre all'ISTITUTO TECNICO COMMERCIALE PER SORDI ISISS MAGAROTTO DI PADOVA, scuola specializzata per ragazzi sordi che da oltre 60 anni è un punto di riferimento d'eccellenza per molti giovani sordi italiani, e al CENTRO MEDICO DI FONIATRIA “CROATTO” DI PADOVA,  che da oltre mezzo secolo si occupa di prevenzione, diagnosi, terapia (medica e chirurgica) e riabilitazione logopedica delle patologie della voce, della parola, del linguaggio e dell’udito, è stata istituita una rete associativa che collabora attivamente al progetto e che metterà a disposizione le proprie competenze per la sua veicolazione e promozione.

Si ringrazia per la collaborazione FABLAB - VENEZIA

story:
FAQ

Q:Was wondering if an Android app will be released for this product? Please let me know. Thanks!
A:It can not only fit for iOS ,but also for Android.
Q:I wanted to know if I ship it to a Canadian address with the Early bird if shipping is included? Please let me know. Thanks!
A:Yes,of course.

Q:Doe this unit measure weight?

A:Yes. It is very actuate. It measures weight, BMI and water weight also. Weight yourself 1st thing in the morning before you eat or drink anything for best results. Just enter your age, height, female/male etc. Very easy to use and to store info automatically.
Q:Why does it need to know your age?Does it use it for other caculations?
A:The explanation is that the percentages are figured by the use of two formulas, one of which is an algorithm that is universally recognized and used by the FDA as well. It used input such as age, height, weight, gender, activity, etc., to calculate what your percentage of body fat is and when used along with the much simpler formula that is based only on weight to height ratios it can make the numbers much more accurate. The most accurate numbers come from the water displacement tanks used by pro sports and bigger health facilities, but these scales we buy at such reasonable prices cannot get that accurate. So, by using these 2 formulas in harmony with the electrical signal impedance (which I am sure measures differently, on average, depending on your age), these scales can get as close as possible for us. I hope this additional information to my original answer helps you somewhat to understand why it asks for age.

story:
Short Summary

With the help of many sponsors debate training of school students is well underway in Palestine, and it will expand even without this campaign. A sponsor has agreed to fund a team to the World Schools Debating Championship in Singapore in July-August 2015. The five student team was selected in February. More training will happen in April and June. 

BUT, we do not want them to arrive in Singapore never having been in international competition. Thus, this campaign is designed to raise money to send all team members and their teacher to the World Schools Debate Academy in Slovenia in late June. There they will learn from the world's best trainers as well as meet and compete against students from over 18 countries. That way they will be able to represent Palestine better and also learn to be teachers and leaders when they return to Palestine. 

What We Need

Here are the details:

  • We need a total of $7000 to make this happen.
  • Airfare 6 x $650, plus $2040 tuition, housing, meals, plus $1270 for visas and travel to Amman, Jordan, where they can catch their flights.
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, we will send as many students as possible. If we exceed pur goal we will send additional students. 
  • All funds will be handled by Za in Proti (ZIP), the national debate program of Slovenia, home of world champion debaters, and veterans of handling complex initiatives like major European Union youth grants. ZIP is administering the debate training students will attend in Slovenia, the World Schools Debate Academy. http://debateacademy.net/Debate_Academy/WSDA_Sl...
  • Every donor will receive a handsome "Palestine Debates" gift to commemorate their support. Cost of gifts will not come from these donations. 

The Impact

Making sure that these very bright and articulate students get this crucial training will have many beneficial effects.

  • They help to demonstrate the competence and excellence of Palestinians in a major international forum.
  • They will receive instruction that will allow them to be peer trainers and spread debating to more and more Palestinian youths. .
  • They will serve as a springboard to future expansion of debating in Palestine in existing programs with the support of the World Debate Institute USA, Za in Proti Slovenia and Singapore debating community.
  • The organizers of this effort have done successful debate outreach programs in over 40 nations already. Now, Palestine!

Challenges

It is hard for Palestinian youth to engage with the world on a level playing field given their political and physical isolation behind walls and barriers. We can break down these barriers!

  • Training so far has shown these students (over 60 of them) to be very bright and extremely articulate. They are determined and hard working. 
  • The five students that have been selected for the international team have been judged to be very competitive and able to represent Palestine by a group of experienced debate trainers who have already won world championships. 
  • They are opening up the Internet gates of information to learn about the major issues of the world and prepare to debate them. Skilled trainers are helping them learn how to educate themselves. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Talk it up, Let like minded people know about this amazing opportunity. 
  • Use your social media presence to expand the audience for this appeal.
  • Tell people not just to complain about the absence of Palestine in the global discussion, actually do something about it.

story: 123456

5/27 Child Restraints Save Kids Lives campaign official launch

Check updates for more details

Thanks to a generous grant, this is now a matching campaign where all donations will be matched dollar-for-dollar! Doubling the impact.


5/6 HuaQiao Foundation has just made a $10,000 donation; A big thank you to the Rotary Club of Shanghai President, Frank Yih!

Each year in China, 18,500 children are killed in traffic accidents, the leading cause of death to children under 14; ONE CHILD EVERY 28 MINUTES! By comparison, in the United Kingdom, 48 children were killed in traffic accidents in 2013, less than the number of kids killed in China in ONE DAY.

Child safety seat usage rates in China are less than 5%, compared to 95% in the European Union and a similar rate in the United States.

Child safety seats (child restraints) can reduce the risk of fatal injuries by up to 71%

May 4-10 is UN Global Road Safety Week, make an contribution today and help us save kids lives.

Let's get kids in child safety seats and save lives! 


 


Who We Are

Inspired by Consumer Reports, MingJian is an NGO started on World Consumer Rights Day (March 15, 2010) by an American and Chinese husband and wife (James Feldkamp and Jessie Qiu) living in Shanghai. Our purpose is to provide an independent expert reference to safe, quality products and empower consumers in China. 


Our Contribution and Commitment

Together with ICRT member consumer organizations and motor clubs in 22 countries, MingJian has been testing child safety seats since 2012, testing nearly 150 models to-date. In addition to international models, we recently subjected 100 samples of Chinese models to the same comprehensive safety tests in Europe. Although test results are usually only available to paid subscribers, as part of this campaign we will make all child safety seat test results available FREE to all consumers in China accessible on our website at www. mingjian.cn .

Additionally, we commit ourselves to applying our experience in child safety, child restraint testing and expertise in child restraint installation inspection (James Feldkamp is certified by TRL Child Safety Centre and Good Egg Safety in the UK for child safety seat fitting) to the cause of Child Road Safety in China and saving kids lives. 

Campaign Goals

In order to ensure that children are safety secured in child restraints, the following three objectives need to be met:

1) INTENT TO USE: Educate parents in China about the benefits of child safety seats and consequences of non-use.

2) SAFE MODEL SELECTION: Help parents select safe, reliable child restraints suited for their child and vehicle.

3) PROPER INSTALLATION: Provide training on proper child restraint installation

Why We Need Your Help

We are passionate about child safety in China and want to share with parents across China information that can keep their kids safe on the road. With your support we can reach thousands, perhaps hundreds of thousands or even millions of parents and save kids lives. 

With your donations we will:

1) Host consumer events to promote child safety seat use with:

a) Video presentation of the benefits of child safety seats and consequences of non-use, highlights from crash test footage

b) Interactive sled demonstration. 80% of parents in China believe that infants are safer held in the arms of an adult than secured in a child safety seat. We will hire a demonstration sled where parents can experience trying to hold an infant in a simulated crash.

c) Online access to child safety seat test results, video guides, and tutorials accessible for attendees throughout the event and during the campaign.

d) Free inspections of child safety seat installations. A NHTSA study concluded that 3 on every 4 child safety seats are improperly installed. We will offer free vehicle inspections of child safety seat installation as well as installation training with different vehicles and types of child safety seats.

In support of the consumer events, the following activities will increase exposure and amplify the impact:

2) Media event just before June 1 International Children's Day we will release the latest test results of 32 models of child safety seats and make test results of all child safety seat models freely available to all consumers in China.

3) Create a series of video shorts (similar to the video clip at the top of this campaign used effectively in Europe) to vividly show the importance of child safety seat use and consequences of non-use. Additional videos will made to demonstrate properly installation of different types of child safety seats and tips to ensure your child is properly secured. In addition to an online video campaign, we hope to broadcast these videos in taxis and on TV public service announcements.

4) Create pamphlets explaining the importance of child safety seats, how to select a safe model, and how to install properly with QR code links to the free child safety seat reviews, buying guides, as well as installation videos. The pamphlets will be distributed to parents in community centers, maternity and children hospitals, nursery and primary schools, and handed out in gas stations.

5) Social media campaign encouraging consumers to share the videos with friends and spread the word about the importance of child safety seats.

Impact of your contribution 

Here are some examples of how your donation will contribute to the campaign

  • $20 - print 100 pamphlets 
  • $50 - print 250 pamphlets 
  • $100 - car rental for one vehicle installation demo
  • $200 - purchase child safety seat for installation demo
  • $1,000 - pamphlet design and layout for printing
  • $3,000 - seat belt sled rental for demo
  • $5,000 - production of video shorts
  • $15,000 - full cost of a consumer event

Our $50,000 goal will provide funding for a full consumer campaign (videos, pamphlets, social media, media event) with consumer events in Shanghai and Beijing.

Every additional $15,000 funds raised will permit us to hold an additional consumer event in another city or district. 

$50,000 - full campaign and a consumer event in Shanghai and another in Beijing

$65,000 - full campaign and 3 consumer events

$95,000 - full campaign and 5 consumer events

...

$170,000 - full campaign and 10 consumer events

Throughout the campaign we will provide regular updates on the events and numbers of consumers reached.

Thank you for your support in keeping kids safe on the road in China!

$5,000 - production of video shorts
$15,000 - full cost of a consumer event

Every additional $15,000 funds raised will permit us to hold an additional consumer event in another city or district. 
$50,000 - full campaign and a consumer event in Shanghai and another in Beijing
$65,000 - full campaign and 3 consumer events
$95,000 - full campaign and 5 consumer events

story:
Our favorite moments are the ones when kids are reading on their own or fiddling with batteries and wires and trying to build something.

Raising the innovators and leaders of the future means helping kids love to learn and giving them lots of ways to invent and explore -- fail and challenge themselves -- and discover the world around them. We want them to read voraciously, learn math so that it comes naturally, and pursue science and history not only to understand how things work but to invent and discover things on their own!

As educators and parents we buy workbooks and scour the Internet (and Pinterest) for enrichment ideas. But so often, ideas that look great on the web don't work, we can't tell if our students understand the latest hot new novel, and who has 100 Popsicle sticks or 3-volt LED lights hanging around the house?

Boost in a Box delivers academic enrichment right to your door. We test all of the boxes at our learning center to make sure they provide maximum learning, challenge, and joy! Every necessary component (we strive to use household materials, but seriously, what normal household contains all of these things?) comes in the box. Every book has been vetted by our students, hand-picked for your child, and comes with materials that not only make it more interesting, but easy for you to check for understanding. Every math activity not only provides practice, but a little bit of fun. And, our Daily Boost injects a tiny (not more than a minute or two) academic boost into your everyday lives EVERY DAY.

This is fun, hands-on, rigorous academic enrichment -- and it involves no scrambling, stress, or pleading from parents. Kids want to do these projects as soon as they see them. (And parents, we want to challenge the kids, but we give you cheat sheets and videos in case you get stuck!)

Boost in a Box would be an amazing boost for your K-6* child. Supplement school, add education to summer, feed nascent interests, and expand your kids' horizons. 

Boost in a Box would be an incredible gift for any child you love.  Wouldn't your grandkids, nieces or nephews, or family friends LOVE getting a box of hands-on activities in the mail every month (and wouldn't their parents be grateful that it's not another toy?). It's the gift that keeps on giving!

Boost in a Box is a gift to any child, but it is an especially phenomenal gift for low-income children in under-resourced communities, many of whom have very little access to learning that's fun. As with everything that EdBoost does, Boost in a Box profits will go to serving low-income students. Moreover, for EVERY Boost in a Box you purchase, we'll donate a hands-on activity to a low-income child. You can also donate a complete Boost in a Box, or a summer's worth of Boosts in Boxes, to a low-income child.  (And, EdBoost is a 501(c)(3) so donations are tax-deductible!  We'll send you a receipt!) Research shows that every summer low-income kids, who have kept up during the school year, fall behind their more advantaged peers.  Delivering a Boost in a Box to those students can add joy to their summer and help them keep up academically.

Please help us as we build Boost in a Box, which we will hope will enrich and develop our future leaders, innovators, and world-changers. Buy something for your kids, do some good. Donate, do some good. No matter what you do, you'll  be making the world a smarter place. And, as we say at EdBoost: smarter kids, better world. 

*For now, Boost in a Box is for kids in grades K-6.  Once you sign up, we'll send you a questionnaire so we can tailor boxes to the child who will be receiving the boxes.

No matter how you contribute (with a subscription for your family, a gift to a friend, or a donation) you'll be helping kids learn!

We need at least $20,000 to get off the ground; we want $60,000 to put out enough donations to evaluate how much the boxes improve students' lives and learning this summer. 

Exactly what is in a Boost in a Box?

A typical Boost in a Box contains:

  • An English/Language Arts activity OR a Math activity
  • A hands on Science OR hands on History/Culture activity
  • A month's worth of Daily Boost activities
  • A log in for the student's www.boostinabox.org website account

*Note: unless otherwise requested, monthly subscribers will receive alternating activities: English/Language Arts one month and Math the next, hands-on Science activities one month and hands-on History/Culture activities the next. 

**Also note: The Boostravaganza Box contains activities for all four subjects (English/Language Arts, Math, Science, and History/Culture).

English/Language Arts Activities include a hand-picked book (based on students' responses to our online survey), background information about the book (such as maps, a historical timeline, or information about phenomena in the book), book activities (such as site word cards, puzzles, writing assignments and activities, or comprehension questions), a hands-on game or activity that relates to the book, and a chapter-by-chapter summary sheet for parents.

Math activities are chosen for students based upon their answers to questions on their online survey (and performance on any other online quizzes on our website).  Activities include practice packets (and answer keys), and a hands-on math challenge or a math game that encourages practice and mastery (each game has several versions, some that are easy, others that are more challenging, some to play against others, as well as some to play against yourself or a timer).

Hands-on Science and History/Culture activities include a set of instruction/observation cards that guides students through several investigations, experiments, and challenges, all of the materials needed for all activities, space to record observations and write up results (like a lab notebook), and ideas for future exploration. Science areas include engineering, physics, biology, and chemistry.  History/Cultural projects include art techniques, geography, artifact creation/discovery, textiles, mummies, bridge building, and much more.

Your first Boost in a Box includes a magnetic Daily Boost holder and a month of Daily Boost cards.  Each subsequent box includes a new month of Daily Boost cards. Hang them on your frig or somewhere where they are easy to see and do a quick activity (we keep them under 2 minutes!) to boost your kids daily.

www.boostinabox.org contains ideas for more exploration, book recommendations, quizzes (on which students can earn points and receive expansion packs for their kits), hundreds of practice packets for download, videos to guide students (and parents) through math and science problems, areas for students to post their own book reviews, stories, poems, and more.

Every time you get a box, you and/or your child can log in to review it.  Tell us what you liked best, and what didn't work as well, and next month we can customize the box even more!

At EdBoost, we know kids learn best by solving problems themselves.

At EdBoost, we ask a lot of questions. Whether students are struggling with an unfamiliar math problem, a new vocabulary word, or science homework, we start with questions: how do you think you could set that up?  What words do you know that are similar?  Have you ever tried dropping two differently shaped objects to see how fast they fall?

It's always faster to tell kids the answer. It's always cleaner when we walk them through problems step-by-step and they dutifully follow our cues. But, when we do that, we need to do it again the next day, because problems solved by others are quickly forgotten.

We try to make concepts real, present, hands-on, and experiential.  And we try to let students field problems as they come up.  That's how they learn. Don't get how chainmail works and utterly bored with your unit on fuedalism?  Let's make chainmail. See how hard it was to wrap that paperclip around a pencil? Imagine doing it thousands of times. Now hook those loops together and let your life depend on it.  Appreciate chainmail a bit more?

We follow the same guidelines in science. Although everyone loves a slick, snap-together kit, we try to avoid them. One of the biggest problems we see in our students is that they don't know how anything works. When their phones don't work or a computer won't turn on, they don't even think to check the cords. They sit befuddled. How can we expect our students to create the future when they can't trouble-shoot the present.  Building a kit requires a student to be able to follow directions. Building something from scratch, from materials that are not magical or special, teaches children HOW things work. (Trust us, make a motor with wire, safety pins, cardboard, and a  magnet, and you earn every rotation.  Ask this kid how a motor works: we promise, he can tell you!) Kids who understand how things work, and how to make things better, will make the world a better place. 

At EdBoost, our most joyous moments are the ones when kids "get it."  Our biggest smiles come when they rummage through our junk drawers to expand on their creations. 

The problem is, not every child can come to EdBoost. 

Boost in a Box brings EdBoost to anyone! 

For many families, Boost in a Box will be the end of summer boredom and guilt. No more kids complaining about having nothing to do. No more parents feeling guilty (either because they didn't buy any workbooks or for making their kids DO the workbooks they did buy!). Kids want to learn and explore with Boost in a Box. Boost in the Box parents will know that their kids are challenging themselves and exploring areas and ideas they've never worked with before.

And, because every Boost in a Box activity comes with background information (for students and parents!), students work through a lot of the materials independently. If they get stuck, it's easy for parents to jump in, figure out what's going on (or peek at the answers!) and provide a little bit of help.

For lower-income families, Boost in a Box not only busts boredom, but brings a hard-to-access world of learning right to their doors. When you live in an under-resourced community, it can be hard to get to the library (never mind figuring out when it's open!). It can be frustrating to struggle to attend a low-cost summer program only to learn that it's just glorified baby-sitting. It's hard to keep up your school skills with few books and materials in the house. It's hard to love learning when your school days are fixated on test prep. 

At EdBoost, we work with kids from all backgrounds and every kind of family. We work with gifted kids and kids with learning difficulties. We strive to make the brilliant kids more brilliant and help kids who struggle catch up and find their learning groove. 

Boost in a Box not only aspires to show students WHY they should do well in school, but to give them the tools to succeed in school. Learning can be hard work. Boost in a Box makes that work fun -- and gives tangible rewards that help students understand why they need to work hard in the first place. 

The stuff that keeps us up at night

Summer is the time when most kids get the boredom bug.  Summer is also the time when so many low-income kids fall behind in school (and each summer adds up!).

We want to spread Boost in a Box far and wide, but we know that it can be hard to imagine exactly what you'll get each month until you see your kids actually open the box and engage.  We hope the video above gives you some sense of the kind of excitement kids get from Boost in a Box activities -- and we deeply hope that many families will give us a try and let us fill their home with fun and inquisitive learning activities!

Not only do we want lots of kids to have Boost in a Box, we want to make sure that the kids who need it most can get it.  We really want to provide a summer's worth of boxes to 400 low-income students. Your donations can make that happen! If we can serve 400 kids, not only can we dramatically improve their summers, but we'll have enough students that we can evaluate whether these boxes make a difference in their lives -- which would help us serve even more kids in the future.

Please help us get those boxes in the mail by donating, referring, and linking!!

How will we know if the boxes work?

We will ask every Boost in a Box recipient to give us feedback, not only to personalize every box we send out, but also to help us make sure that the boxes are great (and keep getting greater)!
For donation boxes, we will be conducting a small, randomized, pilot evaluation, to see if the boxes improve students' learning, motivation, and curiosity over the summer. EdBoost is always committed to evaluating its programs and improving them. Boost in a Box is no exception. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can donate or subscribe. We would love strong word of mouth! Please post this campaign to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and talk it up!

For every subscriber/donor you refer, we'll donate another hands-on Boost Activity. At the end of the campaign, we'll let you know how many little lives you just enriched! Please spread the word and provide a BOOST not only to kids you know but the kids who need it most.


Some Boost in a Box order details: If you purchase a box, please look out for an email from us.  We'll send a link so that the child (or the child's parent) can fill out a questionnaire and customize his or her box.  If the box is a gift, we will send you a form to fill out so that we can get the questionnaire to the recipient (or gather some basic info from you so we can surprise the child with the first box). 

If you donate, please watch our Facebook page and Instagram for photos of kids enjoying their boxes and activities!  Also, keep an eye out for your contribution receipt for your taxes next year!
