This is fun, hands-on, rigorous academic enrichment -- and it involves no scrambling, stress, or pleading from parents. Kids want to do these projects as soon as they see them. (And parents, we want to challenge the kids, but we give you cheat sheets and videos in case you get stuck!)
Boost in a Box would be an amazing boost for your K-6* child. Supplement school, add education to summer, feed nascent interests, and expand your kids' horizons. 
Boost in a Box would be an incredible gift for any child you love.  Wouldn't your grandkids, nieces or nephews, or family friends LOVE getting a box of hands-on activities in the mail every month (and wouldn't their parents be grateful that it's not another toy?). It's the gift that keeps on giving!
Boost in a Box is a gift to any child, but it is an especially phenomenal gift for low-income children in under-resourced communities, many of whom have very little access to learning that's fun. As with everything that EdBoost does, Boost in a Box profits will go to serving low-income students. Moreover, for EVERY Boost in a Box you purchase, we'll donate a hands-on activity to a low-income child. You can also donate a complete Boost in a Box, or a summer's worth of Boosts in Boxes, to a low-income child.  (And, EdBoost is a 501(c)(3) so donations are tax-deductible!  We'll send you a receipt!) Research shows that every summer low-income kids, who have kept up during the school year, fall behind their more advantaged peers.  Delivering a Boost in a Box to those students can add joy to their summer and help them keep up academically.
Please help us as we build Boost in a Box, which we will hope will enrich and develop our future leaders, innovators, and world-changers. Buy something for your kids, do some good. Donate, do some good. No matter what you do, you'll  be making the world a smarter place. And, as we say at EdBoost: smarter kids, better world. 
*For now, Boost in a Box is for kids in grades K-6.  Once you sign up, we'll send you a questionnaire so we can tailor boxes to the child who will be receiving the boxes.
No matter how you contribute (with a subscription for your family, a gift to a friend, or a donation) you'll be helping kids learn!


We need at least $20,000 to get off the ground; we want $60,000 to put out enough donations to evaluate how much the boxes improve students' lives and learning this summer. 

Exactly what is in a Boost in a Box?

A typical Boost in a Box contains:


An English/Language Arts activity OR a Math activity
A hands on Science OR hands on History/Culture activity
A month's worth of Daily Boost activities
A log in for the student's www.boostinabox.org website account

*Note: unless otherwise requested, monthly subscribers will receive alternating activities: English/Language Arts one month and Math the next, hands-on Science activities one month and hands-on History/Culture activities the next. 
**Also note: The Boostravaganza Box contains activities for all four subjects (English/Language Arts, Math, Science, and History/Culture).
English/Language Arts Activities include a hand-picked book (based on students' responses to our online survey), background information about the book (such as maps, a historical timeline, or information about phenomena in the book), book activities (such as site word cards, puzzles, writing assignments and activities, or comprehension questions), a hands-on game or activity that relates to the book, and a chapter-by-chapter summary sheet for parents.
Math activities are chosen for students based upon their answers to questions on their online survey (and performance on any other online quizzes on our website).  Activities include practice packets (and answer keys), and a hands-on math challenge or a math game that encourages practice and mastery (each game has several versions, some that are easy, others that are more challenging, some to play against others, as well as some to play against yourself or a timer).
Hands-on Science and History/Culture activities include a set of instruction/observation cards that guides students through several investigations, experiments, and challenges, all of the materials needed for all activities, space to record observations and write up results (like a lab notebook), and ideas for future exploration. Science areas include engineering, physics, biology, and chemistry.  History/Cultural projects include art techniques, geography, artifact creation/discovery, textiles, mummies, bridge building, and much more.
Your first Boost in a Box includes a magnetic Daily Boost holder and a month of Daily Boost cards.  Each subsequent box includes a new month of Daily Boost cards. Hang them on your frig or somewhere where they are easy to see and do a quick activity (we keep them under 2 minutes!) to boost your kids daily.
www.boostinabox.org contains ideas for more exploration, book recommendations, quizzes (on which students can earn points and receive expansion packs for their kits), hundreds of practice packets for download, videos to guide students (and parents) through math and science problems, areas for students to post their own book reviews, stories, poems, and more.
Every time you get a box, you and/or your child can log in to review it.  Tell us what you liked best, and what didn't work as well, and next month we can customize the box even more!
At EdBoost, we know kids learn best by solving problems themselves.

At EdBoost, we ask a lot of questions. Whether students are struggling with an unfamiliar math problem, a new vocabulary word, or science homework, we start with questions: how do you think you could set that up?  What words do you know that are similar?  Have you ever tried dropping two differently shaped objects to see how fast they fall?
It's always faster to tell kids the answer. It's always cleaner when we walk them through problems step-by-step and they dutifully follow our cues. But, when we do that, we need to do it again the next day, because problems solved by others are quickly forgotten.
We try to make concepts real, present, hands-on, and experiential.  And we try to let students field problems as they come up.  That's how they learn. Don't get how chainmail works and utterly bored with your unit on fuedalism?  Let's make chainmail. See how hard it was to wrap that paperclip around a pencil? Imagine doing it thousands of times. Now hook those loops together and let your life depend on it.  Appreciate chainmail a bit more?


We follow the same guidelines in science. Although everyone loves a slick, snap-together kit, we try to avoid them. One of the biggest problems we see in our students is that they don't know how anything works. When their phones don't work or a computer won't turn on, they don't even think to check the cords. They sit befuddled. How can we expect our students to create the future when they can't trouble-shoot the present.  Building a kit requires a student to be able to follow directions. Building something from scratch, from materials that are not magical or special, teaches children HOW things work. (Trust us, make a motor with wire, safety pins, cardboard, and a  magnet, and you earn every rotation.  Ask this kid how a motor works: we promise, he can tell you!) Kids who understand how things work, and how to make things better, will make the world a better place. 
At EdBoost, our most joyous moments are the ones when kids "get it."  Our biggest smiles come when they rummage through our junk drawers to expand on their creations. 
The problem is, not every child can come to EdBoost. 




Boost in a Box brings EdBoost to anyone! 

For many families, Boost in a Box will be the end of summer boredom and guilt. No more kids complaining about having nothing to do. No more parents feeling guilty (either because they didn't buy any workbooks or for making their kids DO the workbooks they did buy!). Kids want to learn and explore with Boost in a Box. Boost in the Box parents will know that their kids are challenging themselves and exploring areas and ideas they've never worked with before.
And, because every Boost in a Box activity comes with background information (for students and parents!), students work through a lot of the materials independently. If they get stuck, it's easy for parents to jump in, figure out what's going on (or peek at the answers!) and provide a little bit of help.

For lower-income families, Boost in a Box not only busts boredom, but brings a hard-to-access world of learning right to their doors. When you live in an under-resourced community, it can be hard to get to the library (never mind figuring out when it's open!). It can be frustrating to struggle to attend a low-cost summer program only to learn that it's just glorified baby-sitting. It's hard to keep up your school skills with few books and materials in the house. It's hard to love learning when your school days are fixated on test prep. 

At EdBoost, we work with kids from all backgrounds and every kind of family. We work with gifted kids and kids with learning difficulties. We strive to make the brilliant kids more brilliant and help kids who struggle catch up and find their learning groove. 



Boost in a Box not only aspires to show students WHY they should do well in school, but to give them the tools to succeed in school. Learning can be hard work. Boost in a Box makes that work fun -- and gives tangible rewards that help students understand why they need to work hard in the first place. 
The stuff that keeps us up at night



Summer is the time when most kids get the boredom bug.  Summer is also the time when so many low-income kids fall behind in school (and each summer adds up!).
We want to spread Boost in a Box far and wide, but we know that it can be hard to imagine exactly what you'll get each month until you see your kids actually open the box and engage.  We hope the video above gives you some sense of the kind of excitement kids get from Boost in a Box activities -- and we deeply hope that many families will give us a try and let us fill their home with fun and inquisitive learning activities!
Not only do we want lots of kids to have Boost in a Box, we want to make sure that the kids who need it most can get it.  We really want to provide a summer's worth of boxes to 400 low-income students. Your donations can make that happen! If we can serve 400 kids, not only can we dramatically improve their summers, but we'll have enough students that we can evaluate whether these boxes make a difference in their lives -- which would help us serve even more kids in the future.

Please help us get those boxes in the mail by donating, referring, and linking!!
How will we know if the boxes work?

We will ask every Boost in a Box recipient to give us feedback, not only to personalize every box we send out, but also to help us make sure that the boxes are great (and keep getting greater)!
For donation boxes, we will be conducting a small, randomized, pilot evaluation, to see if the boxes improve students' learning, motivation, and curiosity over the summer. EdBoost is always committed to evaluating its programs and improving them. Boost in a Box is no exception.  
 
Other Ways You Can Help 
We know that not everyone can donate or subscribe. We would love strong word of mouth! Please post this campaign to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and talk it up!
For every subscriber/donor you refer, we'll donate another hands-on Boost Activity. At the end of the campaign, we'll let you know how many little lives you just enriched! Please spread the word and provide a BOOST not only to kids you know but the kids who need it most.

Some Boost in a Box order details: If you purchase a box, please look out for an email from us.  We'll send a link so that the child (or the child's parent) can fill out a questionnaire and customize his or her box.  If the box is a gift, we will send you a form to fill out so that we can get the questionnaire to the recipient (or gather some basic info from you so we can surprise the child with the first box). 
If you donate, please watch our Facebook page and Instagram for photos of kids enjoying their boxes and activities!  Also, keep an eye out for your contribution receipt for your taxes next year!

story:
Dear friends,

I am looking for some support to cover the tuition fees for my M.Mus. course in Ethnomusicology at the School of Oriental and African Studies in London. I was offered unconditional admission to this course which starts September 2015.

Music and foreign cultures have always been my passion. I have learned Indian classical music since 1995 and have performed with my instrument in Germany, the U.K., France, Italy, Hungary, India (see above ;-) and Indonesia so far. I have been awarded an ICCR scholarship to study at university in India in 2010 and will finish my M.A. in Instrumental Music at Rabindra Bharati University in Kolkata this summer. So far, I have learned the five Indian languages Bengali, Hindi, Urdu, Tamil and Sanskrit.

At SOAS in London, I would like to learn about Central Asian music and Persian language. I believe that music and literature are important and powerful media of intercultural exchange that can contribute to the mutual understanding of peoples. I firmly believe that the study of foreign cultures is also essential to gain insight in the roots of cultural conflicts and to find solutions to them.

I am especially interested in the study of different forms of Sufi music and poetry, which are an expression of a moderate and tolerant interpretation of Islam that promotes the peaceful coexistence of world religions.

I am not able to cover my study fees of 10,000 EUR at SOAS in the U.K. on my own. I am a German citizen who has pursued his higher education in India and am therefore ineligible for many scholarships or exchange programs. These mostly focus either on persons having studied in Germany (the Germany-to-U.K. scholarship programs) or Indian citizens having studied and lived in India (the India-to-UK scholarship programs). Additionally, my chosen subject of study ethnomusicology is a rare and quite exotic one which does not receive much support from any public or private funding organisations.

Because I am tied up with the preparations for my final M.A. exams in India, I am also not able to raise any substantial amount by doing a job here at the moment.

The lack of funding opportunities puts me in a difficult spot. This why I chose Indiegogo.com as a platform to attempt raising a part of my study fees. Please support me and contribute if you can. It would help me to come a step closer to my dream of further studies in Ethnomusicology in the U.K.

I am grateful for any help you can give me.

Christian

story:
Thank you for taking a look at our project to help kids and families get healthier while (virtually) traveling our planet!

We are Jan and Liz Hunter, the founders, operators and production crew of Bike-O-Vision indoor cycling. That’s right, there are only two of us! 

We’ve put our heart and soul into this endeavor and forged forward by financing it all ourselves.  Now we’re looking for a boost to take it all to the next level- and for a great cause - kids!

We need to raise funds to promote this program and get it into more schools.

WHY?   1.)   Health:  Childhood obesity has more than doubled in children and quadrupled in adolescents in the past 30 years.  Obesity is the result of “caloric imbalance”—too few calories expended for the amount of calories consumed. (Source:  Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)

2.)   Education:  Fewer adults are traveling with children.  (Source:  US Travel Association).  Less than half of all Americans have ever been to another country.  (Source:  Bootsnall.com).  When kids see the world on Bike-O-Vision videos, preconceived falsehoods drop away and a better sense of cultures and geography emerge:  fun cycling + geography + integrated learning = better understanding.

Bike-O-Vision Cycling videos promote Health + Education in a fun and integrated way, and it's an activity that both kids and adults already enjoy.  And studies easily prove that exercise is an simple answer to these seriously epidemic problems.

New research on middle-school kids explores the link between riding and brainpower - and argues for adding more exercise into the lesson plans.  Exercise affects how you feel... can improve test scores to get better grades, helps you sleep soundly... can put you in a better mood... and very likely eliminate ADHD.  (Source:  John J. Ratey, MD & Harvard Professor/ Bicycling.com)

Exercise also helps you manage your weight... makes your body stronger and healthier...  can make it less likely that you'll get diseases like diabetes, high blood pressure, and some kinds of cancer.  (Source:  WebMD.com)

Our initial campaign target is $24,000 in 35 days.

So far, marketing and operational costs have limited our expansion.  Even then, we have managed to produce over 48 high definition biking, hiking and rowing videos.  So every contribution will be helping many more people experience Bike-O-Vision.

We are proud of our success stories!  Please take one minute to read through a few here:  www.bike-o-vision.com/wins.html   Comments like these continue to make this adventure always rewarding!

Your contributions are instrumental in our short term goal of bringing even more of the world to children, families and other exercising viewers and help more people achieve their health and weight goals!  

Near-future goal:
Our main focus this autumn will be an integrated-curriculum cycling program for schools across the nation and we want to include as many interesting geographical destinations as possible.  When you help kids and families connect to places around the world it increases their awareness, reality and understanding that we are all in this together! 

Long Term plan:
We plan on offering all previous destinations in 4k definition and continuing to upgrade and expand.  Whether they’re students, veterans, fitness clubs, rehabilitation patients, we want EVERYONE to benefit from cardiovascular exercise using our motivating imagery of some of the best places on our beautiful planet!  And as time goes on, we hope to offer more and more exotic destinations.

The Challenge:  What we have endeavored to achieve here is huge:  there are just so many amazing places in the world to show.  And yet we’ve gotten off to a great start perfecting the forward-motion format by responding to customer feedback and continuing to evolve with the latest video technology.  Can we produce 16 more videos this year alone?  With your help, absolutely!  Then we can get these videos to more and more viewers!

Funding objectives: 

$6,000 or 25%:  Promotional campaign, which will utilize direct mailings, Constant Contact, Google Adwords and social media.

$6,000 or 25%:  Equipment upgrade from our 2010-model cameras and editing equipment to 2015 standards. 

$12,000 or 50%:  Production funding for exciting new locations in North America, Europe, South America, Africa or Asia.  The itineraries will depend on the amount of funds raised.  You can easily imagine the high costs of transportation, lodging, rental vehicles, insurance, gas and all associated costs with foreign travel.  By the time all is accounted for, we are basically working for less than minimum wage, but the end result is well-worth the effort!  It's a passionate purpose!  The 2013 & 2014 trips allowed us to produce seventeen new videos in eight countries.  With your help, our goal is to produce 16 more titles by the end of 2015!

Other ways to contribute:  Please feel free to spread the word about this wonderful way for kids and adults to see the world.  Thousands of folks use Bike-O-Vision in fitness clubs and homes when weather is not suitable for cycling.  We mention safety here too because of a sadly large number of cyclists struck by motorists on the road each year.  In fact, some of our clients are cyclists, or other athletes recovering from accidents.  They are thankful to have a more visually stimulating motivation to workout and we’re so glad to be able to help.

So any way you want to tell your friends about us would be great:  facebook, email, tweets... it's all appreciated.  Thanks so much again for your interest! 

Here is a link to our website with many sample videos:  www.bike-o-vision.com

Go Indiegogo!

Jan and Liz Hunter
admin@bike-o-vision.com

story:
Je commencerais par une courte présentation, mon nom est Jean François Betis, j’ai 56 ans et je suis ici pour vous présenter mon rêve le plus cher, c’est un projet qui me tiens à coeur, la mise en place d’un centre pour les jeunes déscolarisés ou non scolarisés en Côte d’Ivoire. Je suis originaire de la Côte d’ivoire, j’ai aussi vécu en France et présentement au Canada.

Mon expérience dans ce domaine
     Mes domaines d’expertises
               ⇸ Mécanique automobile.
               ⇸ Hydraulique villageoise.
               ⇸ L’enseignement.
               ⇸ Installation thermique et sanitaire.
J’ai été formateur en milieu rural pour l’eau potable mais aussi enseignant en mécanique automobile et par la suite responsable d`un centre technique  quand je résidais encore dans mon pays de naissance.
J’ai aussi réalisé des outils agricole, des appareils pour le bâtiment, une pompe pour les forages et puits, ensuite breveter un outil pour l`entretien de certain type de pompe pour l`eau potable en milieu rural.

J`ai plus de quinze années d’expérience en milieu rural et dans le domaine de la créativité.
                                           _______________ 1990 _______________
Demande du brevet d`un outil pour l`entretien des pompes sur forage concernant l`eau potable.

                                         _____________ 1993-2002 ______________
Formation des jeunes en mécanique automobile et réalisation d’outils agricole. Réalisation des outils pour la construction, réparation des mini tracteurs agricole et réparation des pompes pour l`eau potable dans les villages suivi de sensibilisation

                             


                                           _______________ 2005 _______________
Réalisation d’une pompe à main avec la contribution de Monsieur Davene à Epernay (FRANCE). Cette pompe a été installée sur un forage de 50 mètres de profondeur dans village environ 40 kilomètre d`Abidjan (Côte d’Ivoire) pour des essais.

Le projet
Toute cette expérience me permettrait de créer ce projet mais pour me permettre de démarrer il me faut de l’aide. Je tiens donc à vous présenter mon projet qui consiste à créer un centre en Côte d’ivoire qui permettrais aux jeunes déscolarisés ou non scolarisé d’avoir accès à une formation, à fin d’acquérir des connaissances pratique en mécanique automobile, menuiserie, plomberie, électricité, fabrication de matériaux pour la construction, élevage, agriculture… pour leur donner de l’espoir en l’avenir, de l’autonomie et leur permettre de retrouver la paix et la joie de vivre.

Je souhaite leur permettre de se prendre en charge et être responsable, avoir du respect envers les autres. Ce projet permettra aussi d’éviter l`exode rural et assurer l’avenir agricole de la Côte d’Ivoire.

Analyse financière
⇨ Pour la prise en charge des jeunes (l’hébergement et soins) pour les 6 premier mois.
⇨ L’achat d`outil et machine de seconde main (Tour, Fraiseuse, Tour à bois, Raboteuse a bois, Perceuse sensitive, Meule, Poste à souder, Scie mécanique, Alésage de cylindre, Rectifieuse de culasse et vilebrequin, Scie chantournée, Chalumeau, des étaux, des établis, des caisses à outils etc…).
⇨ L’achat de matière d`œuvre.
⇨ Pour l’électricité (alimentation de postes à souder etc…)
⇨ Un à deux forages pour l`eau
Tous ces outils permettront de commencer le projet et en venir à bout.

Dans les débuts nous souhaitons accueillir entre 15  - 20 personnes maximum.

Pourquoi contribuer?
De nos jours, personne ne se soucies de ces jeunes qui ont surement un fort potentiel. C’est eux qui feront l’avenir de la Côte d’Ivoire, notre devoir est de les préparer. Vous pouvez contribuer à cela et leur donner un avenir plus sûr.

Le centre de formation
✚ Le recrutement des élèves est ouvert à tout le monde. Les plus démunis sont prioritaires. Ils n’auront pas d’argent à débourser, des règles strictes devront être respectées.
✚ Durant la semaine il aura un à deux jours consacrés aux travaux champêtres et
✚ La formation sera basée sur la pratique. Par exemple, dans le cours de mécanique automobile, les jeunes travailleront sur une voiture accidentée ou en panne et à la fin, cette dernière devra être fonctionnelle et capable d`être vendu en respectant les documents administratifs.

Je suis convaincu a 100% que le projet sera une réussite pour l`avenir de ces jeunes et permettra le développement de la région.

Et si les objectifs ne sont pas complètement atteints ?
Les fonds seront mis à la disposition des plus démunie afin que les enfants du village puissent être scolarisés et si possible créer un petit commerce pour les concernés.

Quel est l’impact du projet?
 Il sera une grande action des contributeurs envers ces jeunes démunis, afin de leur permettre d’avoir un avenir réussi sur le plan du travail et de pouvoir se prendre en charge. Ensuite ça sera à leur tour de contribuer à la formation des générations future et surtout le développement de la région.

Je suis entièrement convaincu que ce projet sera une réussite total pour les jeunes de la région ils attendent que le projet démarre, c`est leur seul espoir.
Vu les différentes réalisations que le centre pourra réaliser chaque année, les contributeurs seront invités pour la visite du centre, ils seront hébergés gratuitement durant tout leur séjour, ensuite ils auront la possibilité de voir la réalité du projet, partager avec les jeunes du centre et découvrir la région.

Risques et défis
Je pense être en mesure de relever le défi par mon sérieux et la volonté qui m’habite, je souhaite de tout cœur aider mon prochain. Je possède plus de 50 hectares de terre, je suis convaincu que les jeunes n’attendent qu’un coup de pousse.
Ce projet permettra de diminuer la délinquance et pousser les jeunes à être responsables.
Si d’éventuels problèmes surviennent je compte les régler avec calme, trouver des solutions et avec le soutiens de mes proches.
Le respect total des conditions de recrutement sera important pour éviter tous problèmes avec les jeunes. Il y aura un règlement clair et strict. Chaque jeune sera responsable de ses actes envers son prochain et le Centre. Il aura un suivi rigoureux des jeunes.
 
Conclusion
J’ai réfléchit et constitué pendant plusieurs années ce projet, j’arrive à un moment de ma vie où je me dis qu’il serait temps de le mettre sur pied. Tout est planifié, il manque les fond pour venir à bout, c’est pourquoi je vous demande votre aide.
Mon pays, la Côte d’Ivoire, à énormément de ressources cachée, il faut les faire connaitre au monde et perpétuer la tradition en formant ces jeunes. Il faut aussi les aider à avoir un avenir meilleur, leur apprendre à s’entraider et leur permettre de réaliser qu’ils sont capable de réaliser beaucoup de choses, que rien n’est encore perdu pour eux.
Je compte aller jusqu’au bout et votre aide me serait précieuse.

Contact :   jeanfrancois.betis@gmail.com
story_txt: Je commencerais par une courte présentation, mon nom est Jean François Betis, j’ai 56 ans et je suis ici pour vous présenter mon rêve le plus cher, c’est un projet qui me tiens à coeur, la mise en place d’un centre pour les jeunes déscolarisés ou non scolarisés en Côte d’Ivoire. Je suis originaire de la Côte d’ivoire, j’ai aussi vécu en France et présentement au Canada. Mon expérience dans ce domaine     Mes domaines d’expertises                ⇸ Mécanique automobile.               ⇸ Hydraulique villageoise.               ⇸ L’enseignement.               ⇸ Installation thermique et sanitaire.J’ai été formateur en milieu rural pour l’eau potable mais aussi enseignant en mécanique automobile et par la suite responsable d`un centre technique  quand je résidais encore dans mon pays de naissance.J’ai aussi réalisé des outils agricole, des appareils pour le bâtiment, une pompe pour les forages et puits, ensuite breveter un outil pour l`entretien de certain type de pompe pour l`eau potable en milieu rural.J`ai plus de quinze années d’expérience en milieu rural et dans le domaine de la créativité.                                           _______________ 1990 _______________Demande du brevet d`un outil pour l`entretien des pompes sur forage concernant l`eau potable.                                         _____________ 1993-2002 ______________Formation des jeunes en mécanique automobile et réalisation d’outils agricole. Réalisation des outils pour la construction, réparation des mini tracteurs agricole et réparation des pompes pour l`eau potable dans les villages suivi de sensibilisation                                                                         _______________ 2005 _______________Réalisation d’une pompe à main avec la contribution de Monsieur Davene à Epernay (FRANCE). Cette pompe a été installée sur un forage de 50 mètres de profondeur dans village environ 40 kilomètre d`Abidjan (Côte d’Ivoire) pour des essais.Le projetToute cette expérience me permettrait de créer ce projet mais pour me permettre de démarrer il me faut de l’aide. Je tiens donc à vous présenter mon projet qui consiste à créer un centre en Côte d’ivoire qui permettrais aux jeunes déscolarisés ou non scolarisé d’avoir accès à une formation, à fin d’acquérir des connaissances pratique en mécanique automobile, menuiserie, plomberie, électricité, fabrication de matériaux pour la construction, élevage, agriculture… pour leur donner de l’espoir en l’avenir, de l’autonomie et leur permettre de retrouver la paix et la joie de vivre.Je souhaite leur permettre de se prendre en charge et être responsable, avoir du respect envers les autres. Ce projet permettra aussi d’éviter l`exode rural et assurer l’avenir agricole de la Côte d’Ivoire.Analyse financière⇨ Pour la prise en charge des jeunes (l’hébergement et soins) pour les 6 premier mois.⇨ L’achat d`outil et machine de seconde main (Tour, Fraiseuse, Tour à bois, Raboteuse a bois, Perceuse sensitive, Meule, Poste à souder, Scie mécanique, Alésage de cylindre, Rectifieuse de culasse et vilebrequin, Scie chantournée, Chalumeau, des étaux, des établis, des caisses à outils etc…).⇨ L’achat de matière d`œuvre.⇨ Pour l’électricité (alimentation de postes à souder etc…)⇨ Un à deux forages pour l`eauTous ces outils permettront de commencer le projet et en venir à bout.Dans les débuts nous souhaitons accueillir entre 15  - 20 personnes maximum.Pourquoi contribuer? De nos jours, personne ne se soucies de ces jeunes qui ont surement un fort potentiel. C’est eux qui feront l’avenir de la Côte d’Ivoire, notre devoir est de les préparer. Vous pouvez contribuer à cela et leur donner un avenir plus sûr. Le centre de formation✚ Le recrutement des élèves est ouvert à tout le monde. Les plus démunis sont prioritaires. Ils n’auront pas d’argent à débourser, des règles strictes devront être respectées.✚ Durant la semaine il aura un à deux jours consacrés aux travaux champêtres et ✚ La formation sera basée sur la pratique. Par exemple, dans le cours de mécanique automobile, les jeunes travailleront sur une voiture accidentée ou en panne et à la fin, cette dernière devra être fonctionnelle et capable d`être vendu en respectant les documents administratifs.Je suis convaincu a 100% que le projet sera une réussite pour l`avenir de ces jeunes et permettra le développement de la région.Et si les objectifs ne sont pas complètement atteints ?Les fonds seront mis à la disposition des plus démunie afin que les enfants du village puissent être scolarisés et si possible créer un petit commerce pour les concernés.Quel est l’impact du projet? Il sera une grande action des contributeurs envers ces jeunes démunis, afin de leur permettre d’avoir un avenir réussi sur le plan du travail et de pouvoir se prendre en charge. Je possède plus de 50 hectares de terre, je suis convaincu que les jeunes n’attendent qu’un coup de pousse.Ce projet permettra de diminuer la délinquance et pousser les jeunes à être responsables. Si d’éventuels problèmes surviennent je compte les régler avec calme, trouver des solutions et avec le soutiens de mes proches.Le respect total des conditions de recrutement sera important pour éviter tous problèmes avec les jeunes. Il y aura un règlement clair et strict. Chaque jeune sera responsable de ses actes envers son prochain et le Centre. Il aura un suivi rigoureux des jeunes.  ConclusionJ’ai réfléchit et constitué pendant plusieurs années ce projet, j’arrive à un moment de ma vie où je me dis qu’il serait temps de le mettre sur pied. Tout est planifié, il manque les fond pour venir à bout, c’est pourquoi je vous demande votre aide.Mon pays, la Côte d’Ivoire, à énormément de ressources cachée, il faut les faire connaitre au monde et perpétuer la tradition en formant ces jeunes. story:
Through sharing our processes we believe we can create an online coworking space to learn faster, inspire one another and facilitate and environment of collaboration.

  • As a freelance video editor, I came up with the idea of Watch Me Work while learning Adobe Illustrator. After learning the basics, I wanted the ability to simply observe an expert's process. This need led me to create Watch Me Work.
  • This idea is important as it allows individuals to easily work virtually with another person in the room and allows for learning on both sides of the stream.
  • By supporting this campaign, we will change the way work gets done and learning and collaboration occurs across the internet.
  • Check out Watch Me Work here!

We're seeking $20,000 to pay for 2 part time developers throughout 2015. This will allow us to build the features we need to support the community including:

  • customizable profiles,
  • a notification system when new streams go live,
  • integration of open broadcaster software into our interface
  • integration of mobile streaming platforms including Meerkat and Periscope

If we don't meet our goal, we can still use the funds to build the most immediate features but we won't be able to build everything!

We have an incredible opportunity to change the the way individuals connect, collaborate and work online.

  • So far, we've created over 700 hours of live streaming video collaborations, allowing streamers to share their insights and process with other users and we're growing at an increased rate!
  • We also have over 150 WMW members who are just getting started.
  • We plan on continuing our growth from 30 current weekly streamers to 100 by June 30th and to 1000 by the end of 2015!

The risks we face revolve around continuing to self-fund. So far we've been building the WMW community out of pocket and that will eventually run out.

  • We can avoid this through your help. Our site doesn't take a lot to run but we do need to raise funds to continue to build features and grow the community.
  • The other risk we face is spreading the word. The WMW community can only grow if people share what we're doing.

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Share our story through social media and consider starting to stream your work!

"Online streaming is a compelling technology for education. It's exciting to see the trail Watch Me Work is forging in this space."

- Rob Walling, Founder Drip and Micropreneur.com

"At Startup Riot, Watch Me Work proved that people are interested in a new way to learn from one another.  I can't wait to see Watch Me Work gain more traction and widespread adoption."

- Sanjay Parekh, Founder, Startup Riot

"Online streaming is a compelling mode for education and it's exciting to see how Watch Me Work is using streaming to facilitate learning and collaboration."

- Andrew Weinreich, Founder, Andrew's Roadmaps

story:
The money raised is to cover the balance due cost of $1600. Tuition, $600. NCUSA student day fee, $2700. for food/lodging, and $900. for transportation to and from North Carolina for the 4 week program. My daughter Gryffin, is only 13 and is already currently teaching under Certified ABT Master Teacher, Mrs. Cecilia Fisher, while studying and preparing to take the Level 5, ABT Certification test in the fall. This invitation to the ABT summer series is a giant professional and educational step in helping her to reach that goal. As a loving and supportive single mom, in addition to other work, I teach/choreograph 7-10 hrs. a week to cover the cost of Gryffins' dance education. I was able to pay the non refundable $800 deposit to secure her spot, but with the recent death of my mom in March, the funeral costs prohibited me from the ability to procure the balance and afford her this well earned and deserved opportunity. I plan to provide/post photos, video shorts and updates throughout the entire program up to, and including the final show presentation, so you can take part in her progress and ultimate success!

With your kindness and support, together, we can help her achieve her goal and realize her dream. Bless you, and thank you for your consideration.❤️

story:
Short Summary

We are trying to raise money to help the people of Nepal who are going through tough times. This earthquake has done a lot of damage and we feel it is right for us to do our best to help them at this time of need.

What We Need

This Funding will be dedicated to help the people who were greatly affected by this earthquake in Nepal. We are hoping to raise at least 15000 USD to donate and if were are able to raise enough we will personally travel out there  to Nepal and help rebuild any damages, provide food and water, clothing's and other important necessities that the victims need.

The Impact

Our project is valuable to the contributor because we are helping people who are in desperate need and would make a large impact to these peoples lives. This is our first project of this sort and we are looking forward to doing more projects that will impact peoples lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, Please spread the word. Tell family, friends, and neighbors! Thanks for helping. #MissionNepal. LET GET IT TRENDING!!

story:
We need to do better:
  • High-school math programs are not preparing students for college
  • Math helps develop critical reasoning and logical skills essential to everyday situations
  • Algebra is a basic building block for any education and career in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) Fields
  • United States students rank 24th in mathematics skills when compared to international competition
  • 40% of 17 year olds do not have the math skills to hold a basic production job at a manufacturing company 
Register for the trial module of 'Developmental Algebra' 
to see our solution in action

Our Plan

intellADAPT plans to leverage our breakthrough Adaptive 2.0 Learning Technology to develop an additional 9 STEM Digital Courses, the first being 'Algebra for Anyone'.  This Adaptive 2.0 Digital Course will provide the essential building blocks of High-school and early College level Algebra.  To provide the highest quality digital courses we will continue to partner with top-tier universities, high-schools, and individual educators.  These digital courses will be free and open to anyone that is interested in STEM.  Additionally, these courses can be implemented by individual schools or entire districts, that don’t currently offer STEM courses.

List of STEM Adaptive 2.0 Digital Courses

  • Physics - Completed August 2014

  • Developmental Algebra - In production

  • Computer Programming  - In production

  • Statistics

  • Calculus

  • Chemistry

  • Biology

  • Computer Science

  • Environmental Science

  • Psychology

Why We Need Open STEM Education

Only 54% of public schools offer at least 4 AP Programs - this puts those graduates at a severe disadvantage when applying to prestigious universities

Shortage of qualified STEM graduates - many STEM positions remain vacant or are outsourced damaging the US economy

Growing competency gap - many individuals are grossly unskilled preventing them from getting a job in an increasingly competitive world

Low rate of minority students pursuing STEM Education - while many students have an interest in STEM many school districts, particularly in economically distressed areas, do not offer quality STEM education

Nearly 50% of students have expressed interest in STEM majors or occupations

The interest is there, however, many campaigns have focused solely on inspiring interest in STEM without addressing the lack of access to quality STEM Education.

We have made it our mission to provide open access to quality STEM Education.  By providing free, fundamental digital STEM courses talented students can realize their dream job in a STEM field regardless of their schedule, geographical location, or socio-economic status.

Increasing the STEM talent pool is our best bet to reinvigorate American industry, close the growing competency gap, and move towards a more egalitarian higher education admissions process.  

STEM is not just for those pursuing a STEM career

STEM courses in general are immensely beneficial to any student, regardless of their intent to pursue a STEM career.  STEM courses augment skills that are applicable in any career or academic path such as critical thinking, problem solving, and logical reasoning.  By exposing every student to at least 1 STEM course will provide them with invaluable skills key to realizing their own dreams.

Mastering Fundamentals of Physics

Our first Adaptive 2.0 Digital Course, ‘Mastering Fundamentals of Physics’ went live August 2014.  This is the first of 10 STEM oriented digital courses that we hope to develop.  Production of ‘Mastering Fundamentals of Physics’ was overseen and taught by Dr. Nish Sonwalkar in close relationship with University of Massachusetts Boston.  High-schools around the country have already implemented this digital course as part of a blended learning approach to preparing their students for the Physics B/C Advanced Placement Tests.

REGISTER HERE

Breakdown of Costs Per Course

Technical Services  

 Graphical User Interface Template  $3,000

 Content conversion (xHTML, HTML5, CSS)    $7,000

 Video Asset  development (Video lectures and scripts)  $10,000

 Animation and Simulations (Javascript, Action)  $10,000

Technical Services Sub-Total  $30,000

Professional Services  

 Project Management    $5,000

 Content Creation and assessment    $10,000

 Adaptive Instructional Design  $5,000

 Assembly and Test  $2,000

 Quality Assurance  $6,000

 Deployment on Cloud  $2,000

Professional Services Sub-Total      $30,000

Total Estimated Development Cost Per Course    $60,000

Beyond Money - how you can help

Whether you are able to donate financially to our campaign or not, you can provide us the the support we need to expand access to quality STEM Education in the United States and beyond.

Additional ways you can help:

  • Encourage young minds to consider a career in STEM

  • If you’re an educator, consider implementing our courses as part of a blended learning approach

  • Register for our Physics Course HERE

  • Spread the word about #AlgebraForAnyone on Twitter or by email.

  • Stay connected: Follow intellADAPT on Facebook and Twitter to stay up-to-date on the #OpenSTEMOpenDoors campaign

Disclosure:

This campaign is in no way sponsored or endorsed by the College Board or its affiliates.  The Advanced Placement (AP) tests and their respective trademarks are property of the College Board.  intellADAPT, the sponsor of this campaign, makes no claims thereto.


“Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.” - Nelson Mandela


*Statistics from the ACT National Condition of STEM 2013 Report

 Adaptive Instructional Design  $5,000
 Assembly and Test  $2,000
 Quality Assurance  $6,000
 Deployment on Cloud  $2,000
Professional Services Sub-Total      $30,000

Total Estimated Development Cost Per Course    $60,000

Beyond Money - how you can help
Whether you are able to donate financially to our campaign or not, you can provide us the the support we need to expand access to quality STEM Education in the United States and beyond.
Additional ways you can help:

Encourage young minds to consider a career in STEM
If you’re an educator, consider implementing our courses as part of a blended learning approach
Register for our Physics Course HERE
Spread the word about #AlgebraForAnyone on Twitter or by email.
Stay connected: Follow intellADAPT on Facebook and Twitter to stay up-to-date on the #OpenSTEMOpenDoors campaign

Disclosure:
This campaign is in no way sponsored or endorsed by the College Board or its affiliates.  The Advanced Placement (AP) tests and their respective trademarks are property of the College Board.  intellADAPT, the sponsor of this campaign, makes no claims thereto.
“Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.” - Nelson Mandela
*Statistics from the ACT National Condition of STEM 2013 Report

story:
Why your Contribution is important and urgent?

Nepal was hit by 7.9 RC earthquake and claimed huge loss of human life and the property on 25th April 2015. Till now the death toll has increased to 6500 (1 May 2015) and there are high chances of increasing up to 10,000. 8 millions of people are affected and 125,000 houses are destroyed by the earthquake. People are injured, lost their belongings, lost their loved ones & are homeless. They are in urgent need of Rescue, Relief and Aid. It has already been a week after the massive earthquake, the rescue team and the relief are not able to reach many remote areas, where the victims are desperately in need of Rescue, Relief and Aid.  

Your little contribution can save many lives of earthquake victim in Nepal. Donate Now, Whatever you can. Even a single dollar counts!

What your contribution will be used for?

The earthquake has left hundred of thousands homeless. They are staying out in the open sky and are in desperate need of Food, Tent, Medicine & Drinking Water. The funds will be used to buy medicine, food, tents & drinking water. So, please share this with your friends, family, relatives and the people you know and request to contribute some amount whatever they can for the relief of victims of earthquake in Nepal. Donate now, SAVE a life of Victim of earthquake in Nepal.

Short Summary

This idea came in my mind when I saw news over the News Channels after the massive earthquake hit Nepal on 25th April 2015. There have been many funds and donations coming into Nepal and are only focused into Kathmandu. Many countries has donated millions of Dollars in aid and unaccounted rescue work in Nepal. Most of them are only focused into Kathmandu valley only. There has been many other places in Nepal where the Massive Earthquake had destroyed millions of dollars of property and took 1000's of human lives. Many volunteer are working in this field of rescue and distribution of aids to affected people of Gorkha, Sindhupalchok, Nuwakot, Lamjung, Rasuwa, Sagarmatha, Mustang, Sloukhumbu, Ramechap, Dolakha, Nuwakot and many other remote villages, but due to the insufficient funds and resources volunteers are not able to provide sufficient reliefs and aids to the people of most affected areas. So, to help those people who are mostly affected into remote areas, this camping is very important. Please donate whatever you can to this humanitarian campaign. Your single Dollar helps to give some relief to the victims. To give something to needy people is the best work to do in a life.   

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need as much as of donation to provide aids to the victims of the Earthquake in Nepal. Mostly to the people outside Kathmandu Valley, where no action has been taken to provide the relief and aid to the affected people of that area. We need as much as of donations to buy Food, Medicine, Tents, Water, Power Supplies to operate communication equipment and many more. These funds will directly go to the people in need i.e. Victim of Earthquake. Millions of dollar has been brought into Nepal but they are not released to the Victims to outside than Kathmandu valley. 
  • Youth volunteers have been operating in the affected areas, but due to the limit source to support, they are not able to keep the effective operation into the areas.
  • If you are interested to work as a volunteer and do something for the victims of the earthquake, please feel free to reach me via p.shrestha@outlook.com if you cannot come in the area but have interest to do something then you can help us by donating whatever you can. These funds will directly go to the victims of the Earthquake.

The Impact

This camping is very very important because the Victim of the Earthquake outside Kathmandu valley have not received any reliefs or aids from the Government of Nepal. Youths are stepping forward to provide aids, reliefs and rescue works. They are in need of supplies (Food, Medicine, Tents, Water, Power Supplies to operate communication equipment and many more) and support. Each day things are going worse, people are not getting the food, water and tents and medical treatments for the injured ones. 10,000's of people are affected by the massive earthquake (7.9 RC) and 5,000 of lives have been loosed. Your single dollar can help to SAVE many lives of the victims of Earthquake in Nepal. Donate today for the humanitarian cause.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate that do not means you have not shown any humanitarian grounds for the affected victim of Earthquake in Nepal you can help us to reach our goals by sharing this message to your friends, family, coworkers and many other people. If you have any questions and ideas or want to do something to the victims as a volunteer then please reach me via p.shrestha@outlook.com or you can reach me on my personal mobile number +977 98020 78935 l +977 98181 41291 (both number are on Viber). 

PS: I don't own the video, it belongs to the YouTube Channel owners. It has covered many stories and the facts of the earthquake.

story:
What We Are All About

GOLF is my passion. It is my goal to see more women and girls be exposed to the game of golf.  

In order to see my passion materialize, I have established The Maulana Dotch Golf Classic, a one-day golf tournament hosted Friday, April 21, 2017, at the Cedar Crest Golf Course in Dallas, Texas. This tournament is an opportunity to raise funds for Scholarship money for graduating seniors from the Cedar Crest junior program and the Center of Empowerment. 

As the 1st African American woman in Texas and 2nd African American woman in America to earn my Class A, PGA Membership and become a certified LPGA Teaching Professional, I strive to be an example for girls to fulfill their dreams as a golfer and/or PGA or LPGA Member. 

As the Head Golf Professional at Cedar Crest Golf Course, my goal is to bring golfers and golf enthusiast together to support this effort with the common bond of golf.  The field will be completely comprised of men and women from all backgrounds, industries and all skill levels of golf.  The Maulana Dotch Golf Classic invites everyone to a day of fun, networking and raising funds for this worthy cause.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need your help!

This is a great opportunity for you to support an exceptionally worthy cause.  I would invite you to be stakeholders in this community where young lives are challenge daily.  Your sponsorship of this program offers them an opportunity to participate in golf and opens doors beyond measure. 

For a $100 donation you will receive the same Swag Bag the golfer's participating will get. This bag will be full of goodies and gift from our sponsor. 

 

The Impact

In 2016 more than 120 people participated in the Maulana Dotch Golf Classic at Cedar Crest Golf Course in Dallas, Texas.  Full of excitement from beginning to end, the atmosphere was awe-inspiring and welcoming along with lots of activities and surprises on the course.

It was a wonderful sight to see all of the golfers, participants and sponsors.  Not only were the winners awarded prizes, but four graduating junior golfers received college scholarship monies totaling $2,000. 

Help us give even more this year!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Help us by getting the word out and telling your friends and family to donate

Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other social media sites

story:
The teachers at The Prosper Valley School in Pomfret, Vermont need your help to spark the imaginations of our young scientists, technology whizzes, engineers, artists and mathematicians. We would like to design and build a "STEAM Roller"--a large cart on wheels stocked with tools and materials for woodworking, electronics, photography, fiber arts and any sort of academically-related creative project.

TPVS is working collaboratively with the Montshire Museum on this mobile "makerspace" project. The Montshire Museum is one of seven national “hubs” for a Google grant-funded initiative focused on maker education. In Fall 2016, TPVS was selected as one of nine NH/VT schools to participate in the Google initiative. TPVS receives $1000 from Google toward building the infrastructure for an in-house “maker” program. Google also provides us with safety goggles, aprons and other equipment. 

The focus of this campaign is to raise $2000 for the design, construction and outfitting of the STEAM Roller.  The funds will be directed toward the purchase of building materials for the cart itself, tools, supplies and educational resources for STEAM project ideas.  The TPVS teachers will proceed to develop projects that address the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS) for each grade level.  Once the fundraising is complete, construction of the STEAM Roller will take place during the 2017-18 academic year with the assistance of students.

story:
Introducing Tudex

 

Tudex is an online market place for students, parents and tutors to connect with one another instantly. We provide convenience of both the tutor and the student to connect choosing their availability, location and price range.

 

With our easy to use mobile app and website, students and parents can now find their perfect academic mentor within minutes at their fingertips!

We are extremely passionate about this campaign for many reasons.

Our vision is to assist and mentor students of all ages and academic levels to reach their full potential by providing them one-on-one education with the most talented tutors across Australia without the exuberant costs.

The backers of this campaign will allow Tudex to expand its operations throughout other capital cities within Australia and assist with ongoing development costs. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $100,000. Funds raised will go towards different operational costs such as further app development and features, additional cloud space which will enable us to store more data along with marketing costs so we can spread the word! 

We are offering perks that include credits for sessions and Tudex accessories and apparel.

Tudex is committed to changing the way we access tutors at a lower cost without having to compromise on quality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even though some of you may not be able to assist financially, there are many other ways you can assist us:

Please like and share this campaign and spread the word as much as possible!

Don't forget that Indiegogo also has share tools available!

Additional Information

Tudex is a free app to download in the Apple and Google Play stores.

Please check out our website for further information. If you have any additional questions about our campaign we would love to hear from you! feel free to email us at info@tudex.com.au

Thank you,

Team Tudex :)

story:
The workshop SEMILLEROS ARTÍSTICOS is composed of a team of friends: Diego (Colombian musician), Ana (Uruguayan artist), Vicky (artisan and Colombian artist, member of the Nemcatacoa  Fundation), Edgar (Colombian filmmaker and director of the Leteo Association) and Catherine (French musician and director of SEMILLEROS ARTÍSTICOS). Seeing the needs in rural regions of Colombia, we feel the call to help and impact on the integral development of children through the Arts.

One condition to be part of the team “SEMILLEROS ARTÍSTICOS” is:
Passion for arts and conviction of its unquestionable impact on the children's lives.

 

Thanks to contributors, in 2007, 2008 and 2009, with the collabotation of the LETEO Association (leteo.org), and during the first semester of 2017, with the collaboration of NEMCATACOA Fundation, we could realize our dream: to develop the workshop "SEMILLEROS ARTÍSTICOS", in the Municipality of Madrid, and in the village of Hatillo, both in the Department of Cundinamarca, Colombia.

This was a wonderful experience where we could check the impact on the participating children:

  • they developed skills to solve unexpected situations
  • they continually practiced respect, teamwork, solidarity and patience
  • they progressed in everything related to language and ability to communicate
  • they improved their socialization, their self-control
  • they understood better their role in the community
  • they discovered talents for their future life projects.

Follow our experiences here: 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPUMFtqpKJ3omB...

https://www.facebook.com/semillerosartisticos/?...

 

The children in the rural regions of Colombia begin their lives with a disadvantage, as seen in the lack of their health, nutrition and education. For them a quality health system, a good and balanced diet, as well as a full and comprehensive education, continue to be privileges.

We know that providing the children with tools will give them access better living conditions when they are adults, this means, giving them education, health and nutrition and also access to sporting and artistic activities.

 

Now, we have a new opportunity to continue developping the workshop during 2018 , thanks to the Nemcatacoa Foundation, which seeks to impact the population of Guatavita (department of Cundinamarca, Colombia) and its villages, and has included us in its mission and vision.

In the villages of Hatillo and Montecillo which are located 4 and 5 Km from the municipality of Guativita, there are approximately 50 children between the ages of 6 and 12 who have no opportunity to benefit from either artistic or sports activities.

With your help, the “SEMILLEROS ARTÍSTICOS” program will fill this huge gap, creating a framework of harmonious, supportive, stimulating and sensitive coexistence that will offer the children of Hatillo and Montecillo villages with the following activities:

At the Hatillo school: we will continue with the weekly workshop of plastic arts and music during the school hours for a group of 25 girls and boys between the ages of 6 and 10.

At the farm “Oasis de Montecillo”:

  • The bio-construction of 3 classrooms in the form of a geodesic dome to receive the children that will be built and decorated with the help of the children and the workshop teachers.
  • Five weekly workshops of artistic activities (drama, physical expression, music, audio visual and plastic arts) for two (2) groups of children between the ages of 6 and 12.

 

USD $13,000 that will be used in the following manner:

Corresponding fees for Human resources (144 hours), transportation costs to the villages for the five (5) workshops during (6) months, fees for a coordinator and an administrator (in compliance to the local legal requirements), and,  assistant.

Purchase of the equipment necessary to attend the children in a safe and comfortable manner. Rest of the expenses will be for maintenance.

The children and the families, according our experience will benefit as follow:

  • Conduct of coexistence towards harmony, tolerance and solidarity, contributing to the construction of peace.
  • Children that will increase their communicative and creation skills improve teamwork and collective recognition, develop self-esteem and self-confidence.
  • A positive and visible impact on the future generation which we are trying to influence.

story:
The Desire to Inspire Foundation is dedicated to doing things that uplift one significant life at a time. We collaborate with partners globally to provide communities in need with basic necessities, as well as vocational and educational opportunities.

We have a plan and we need your help.

SOME CONTEXT

Many of us are lifelong readers – we learned to read as our parents turned the pages of colorful books with memorable rhymes and pictures. We went on to read cereal boxes and “chapter books” and got hooked on phonics (or not, depending on where and when you went to school). We learned that reading is fundamental or that reading can save your life. And we learned to cherish a book or a bookshelf full of books. We like having our personal library and knowing our prized tomes are waiting for us when we get the urge to dig into them.

What if your personal library was just a dream? What if you didn’t have even one book to call your own?

In Ghana, Africa, where the poverty level is extreme (though improving, according to UNICEF), it is very likely that people will live their entire lives struggling to manage their basic needs and stay as healthy as possible. Owning a book? Not on the radar, perhaps, more likely a dream.

Imagine the joy a specially gifted book could bring. Imagine this book with a beautiful cover and stories and quotes about love and hope, trust and care, adventure and bravery – and many other topics that are universally understood to be uplifting and even noble. Now imagine this book becoming a person’s prized possession – from toddler to wise elder – such that it becomes fragile and worn with delighted use.

Let’s put that special book into the hands of as many children in Ghana as we can.  We are choosing Ghana for the first round of this program because I am going to Ghana for my second humanitarian trip in November. Our next round may be an underserved population in the USA (i.e., foster kids or abused kids in shelters) or another international community in need, or both.

It was the honor of a lifetime to go to Ghana the first time. I got to know these children and their families. I know the book we are contemplating will bring solace and pleasure. The book will also spark inspiration, curiosity, determination and untold joy.

I recently wrote a book called BE… which is a celebration of seven words that define a life, change a life, improve a life, save a life: genuine, loving, strong, grateful, inspired, kind, happy. These words will form the backbone of our beautiful collaboration – Book of Hope and Love.

#sevenwords

MORE ABOUT THE BOOK

As this campaign progresses, so does the content of the book. Why? Because the people who support this campaign will provide the content. We will edit the content, create the cover and have the books published and sent to Africa for distribution by our team. We will also have books to distribute during my trip in March of 2018.

The cover you see above is a placeholder cover. We are contemplating a contest for the cover design; we will update you on that in a couple weeks. 

WHAT WE NEED

We have crunched some numbers and figure $5,000 will get us off to a good start. We need the money to cover the following:

  • Editing the book
  • Laying out the book
  • Cover design – contest and implementation
  • Printing of the books (at least 1000 to start)
  • Shipping the books to Africa

Thank you for your support!

With love and gratitude,

Dawn
story_txt:
The Desire to Inspire Foundation is dedicated to doing things that uplift one significant life at a time. We collaborate with partners globally to provide communities in need with basic necessities, as well as vocational and educational opportunities.We have a plan and we need your help.SOME CONTEXTMany of us are lifelong readers – we learned to read as our parents turned the pages of colorful books with memorable rhymes and pictures. We went on to read cereal boxes and “chapter books” and got hooked on phonics (or not, depending on where and when you went to school). We learned that reading is fundamental or that reading can save your life. And we learned to cherish a book or a bookshelf full of books. We like having our personal library and knowing our prized tomes are waiting for us when we get the urge to dig into them.What if your personal library was just a dream? What if you didn’t have even one book to call your own?In Ghana, Africa, where the poverty level is extreme (though improving, according to UNICEF), it is very likely that people will live their entire lives struggling to manage their basic needs and stay as healthy as possible. Owning a book? Not on the radar, perhaps, more likely a dream.Imagine the joy a specially gifted book could bring. Imagine this book with a beautiful cover and stories and quotes about love and hope, trust and care, adventure and bravery – and many other topics that are universally understood to be uplifting and even noble. Now imagine this book becoming a person’s prized possession – from toddler to wise elder – such that it becomes fragile and worn with delighted use.Let’s put that special book into the hands of as many children in Ghana as we can.  We are choosing Ghana for the first round of this program because I am going to Ghana for my second humanitarian trip in November. Our next round may be an underserved population in the USA (i.e., foster kids or abused kids in shelters) or another international community in need, or both.It was the honor of a lifetime to go to Ghana the first time. I got to know these children and their families. I know the book we are contemplating will bring solace and pleasure. The book will also spark inspiration, curiosity, determination and untold joy.I recently wrote a book called BE… which is a celebration of seven words that define a life, change a life, improve a life, save a life: genuine, loving, strong, grateful, inspired, kind, happy. These words will form the backbone of our beautiful collaboration – Book of Hope and Love.#sevenwordsMORE ABOUT THE BOOK As this campaign progresses, so does the content of the book. Why? Because the people who support this campaign will provide the content. We will edit the content, create the cover and have the books published and sent to Africa for distribution by our team. We will also have books to distribute during my trip in March of 2018.The cover you see above is a placeholder cover. We are contemplating a contest for the cover design; we will update you on that in a couple weeks. WHAT WE NEED We have crunched some numbers and figure $5,000 will get us off to a good start. We need the money to cover the following:
Editing the book
Laying out the book
Cover design – contest and implementation
Printing of the books (at least 1000 to start)
Shipping the books to Africa
Thank you for your support!With love and gratitude,Dawn

story:
PLEASE SEE THE GALLERY FOR IMAGES

History

Joseph Melvin Madeo was born February 2, 1985, in San Francisco, CA. He grew up in Sequim, WA. A gifted artist from a young age, Joe had his first art show in elementary school. After graduating from Sequim High School, he attended The Art Institute of Seattle with the help of several scholarships. He was awarded best portfolio of his graduating class.

Joe followed his heart & dreams and moved to New York where he went on to become a jack of all trades, finding success in fashion design, custom bike building, carpentry, and most notably fine art. A true optimist and visionary, Joe set his mind to something and did it. His positive attitude and mischievous demeanor remained even up to the very end of his life. Joe passed away March 20, 2014 after a 4 year battle with cancer. Joe made the most of his short time on earth. Those of us lucky enough to have know Joe will always remember him and his amazing talent.

In his memory, I am organizing (with the blessing of Joe's family and loved ones) a memorial scholarship campaign. The money raised will be used for the sole purpose of awarding scholarships to students from an arts school in Bronx, New York.  I am the Principal there.  If you would like to learn more about the school, please see www.ccbxhsm.org.

It is our hope that we will raise enough money so that the scholarship can live on indefinitely and become self supporting.  Until then there will be an annual drive.

Depending on the amount raised, scholarships will be awarded in a range of $500 to $1,500.  These will be awarded to candidates that meet the following criteria:

Enrolled in a 4 year college for the 2016-2017 school year

Have a GPA of 2.0 or higher

Have  demonstrated financial need*

Complete an application and essay that describes the impact of the arts on their lives.

*Students who are within reach of college but are less than $5,000 away from enrollment are given preference

PLEASE SEE THE GALLERY FOR IMAGES OF PRINTS!

 

What We Need & What You Get

WE NEED YOUR MONEY TO KEEP THE ARTS ALIVE!

The Impact

Help a New York City art student attend college! Every year, my school has students who are less than $5,000 away from college.  Yes, I've had students not go to college for as little as $1,500.  Isn't it worth helping?

Risks & Challenges

The only risks and challenges are collecting enough money.

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN if you contribute, and even if you cannot. You can help us TREMENDOUSLY by posting a link to this scholarship drive on your Facebook page, on your Twitter, and all of your social media!

story:
Who we are

The Halifax Music Co-Op is a fiery, young not-for-profit determined to make ensemble music accessible to everybody in Halifax. We offer subsidized lessons, pay-what-you-can membership, outstanding concert experiences and opportunities for people of all ages and skill levels to play music together in our ensembles. 

We need your help

Exciting things are ahead for the HMC. But we need your support to make it all possible.

It costs us approx. $475 per member, per term, to fund our operations: paying our talented staff and faculty, subsidizing lessons for those in financial need, organizing concerts for players of all skill levels and building new community outreach activities. While ticket sales and membership fees cover some of those costs, we need support from community members like you to help bring our vision of accessible, affordable music education and performance to life. 

We've got some great, exciting perks for donating to our cause — join our music revolution!

What we do with your donations

The HMC began as the brainchild of our executive and music director, John Bogardus. Five years later, we've come a long way. Your support will help us continue our work, including:

  • Welcoming 200 students per term.
  • Offered subsidized lessons ($10/hr) to those in need. (Nearly half our members make less than $25K per year.)
  • Offering a library of more than 100 instruments, with free loans for our members
  • Hosting concerts of our community-based ensembles that have attracted more than 30,000 guests
  • Built a permanent space for the HMC for our rehearsals, performances and staff

What's next? Revitalizing our community outreach activities and programming, continuing to build our ensembles and ensuring our staff are properly resourced to make it all possible.

Your support goes a long way

  • $11 is one staff hour of work to support our members.
  • $25 covers a lesson for someone in need of financial assistance.
  • $100-$200 allows us to fix one of the instruments in our 100-instrument library — available for all members to access.
  • $200 allows us to capture our HMC members’ performances as a recording.
  • $300 buys lumber and supplies to continue renovations that improve the HMC space.
  • $1500 covers our in-house photocopiers for four months, providing sheet music to all our performers.
  • $2500 pays our jazz director for a month’s worth of work with our members.

While your donation is not tax deductible, your dollars make an immediate impact on our organization in supporting the growth of music education in our community. In donating, we have curated a number of special items based on the donation amount so you can get a taste of what is to come with the HMC, leaving you hungry for more!

Other ways you can help

  • Help us spread the word about the campaign! Share this link on your social media accounts and tell your friends!
  • Attend one of our shows! The fall lineup will be announced soon — we'll update with details. 
  • Visit our website if you're interested in learning more about the HMC
