story:
Descripción en Español Abajo →

Follow me in:  my ColombianToOxford profiles in Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter

Why I'm doing this campaign!

I’ve always dreamed of studying at a great university, and this year I was accepted (see my Letter of Offer) in the MSc of Neuroscience  at the University of Oxford ; I’m super happy :D ! . Oxford is ranked as one of the best universities in the world . This program will enable me to fully explore and study the brain through various focuses, from single neurons to higher cognitive functions which define intelligence. The program will also prepare me for my future research endeavors in a PhD.

As a foreign student not from UK/EU, the tuition fees at Oxford are three times higher! And they total USD $27,000 (£21,000). Add to this the high cost of living expenses at Oxford, and the program greatly surpasses my financial capacity.

I have not been awarded any of the scholarships of Oxford, and as a recently graduated middle class Colombian engineer, it is truly out of my reach to cover the cost of this masters. I’ve applied for a loan to cover part of the tuition, and in this crowdfunding campaign I’m kindly asking you to help me raise USD $18,000 to cover part of the remaining costs, and to invest in the future of someone committed with the study of Neurosciences and Artificial Intelligence :).

 

Who am I ?

I’m David Alvarez and I graduated as an engineer at the end of last year (2016). Because of my high academic performance I was selected as the first beneficiary of an exchange scholarship for doing a research project (my thesis) in Switzerland. I was able to publish this work  in an international IEEE conference. I also obtained the highest final GPA in the Engineering faculty and because of this I was distinguished at my graduation ceremony.

I’m passionate about the “study of intelligence” from different perspectives such as Neurosciences, Artificial Intelligence and Probability Theory. I enjoy playing the piano (see my waltz and pop piano interpretations) and accordion (see me playing waltz and Vallenato). I’m a “soft” vegetarian: In my everyday life, I don’t eat meat, but when I go to new places or meet new people, I love trying new things so I’m open to eating anything in these particular situations.

 

What will I use the money for:

All the money I raise will go towards paying a part of the USD $27,000 (£21,000) for the tuition fee, and for covering the living expenses which are of minimum USD $15500 (£12,000).

If I raise more than the established goal, I will use this funds to pay Indiegogo’s platform fees and credit card fees.

If I do not meet the funding goal (or I am to far from it), I will use all the funds to study Neurosciences in another Master’s in which I have been accepted, at EPFL (Computer Sciences with a minor in Neurosciences) or University of Edinburgh (Informatics with focus in Neural Computation)

 

How you can Help and Rewards:

You can help me either by donating to my campaign, or by sharing it in Facebook, Twitter, Instagram , by email, talking with your friends, family and colleagues … everywhere ! :)

You can also find me in my ColombianToOxford profiles in Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter sharing post with the hashtag #ColombianToOxford.

Rewards → Thank you very much for your donation, they bring me one step closer to my dream. To thank you, you can choose the rewards shown on the right side of this web page

 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Español:

Por qué estoy haciendo esta campaña!

Siempre soñé con estudiar en una universidad excelente, y este año fui aceptado (mira mi Carta de Aceptación) en la Maestría en Neurociencia en la Universidad de Oxford; estoy super feliz :D ! . Oxford es catalogada como una de las mejores universidades del mundo. Esta maestría me permitirá explorar y estudiar el Cerebro a través de diferentes enfoques, desde neuronas individuales hasta funciones cognitivas superiores las cuales definen la inteligencia. El programa de maestría también me permitirá prepararme como investigador para un futuro doctorado (PhD).

Como estudiante extranjero no perteneciente al Reino Unido/ Unión Europea, el costo de la matricula en Oxford es tres veces mayor!, costando USD $27,000 (£21,000) . Si se le suma a este valor los altos costos de manutención en Oxford, los costos totales superan ampliamente mi capacidad financiera.

No me han otorgado ninguna de las becas disponibles en Oxford, y como un Colombiano recientemente graduado de clase media, los costos de esta maestría se encuentran fuera de mi alcance. He aplicado a un préstamo el cual me ayudará a cubrir parte de los costos de la matrícula, y en esta campaña de recolección de fondos te estoy amablemente pidiendo que me ayudes a recolectar USD $18,000 para cubrir los costos restantes, y a invertir en el futuro de alguien comprometido con el estudio de las Neurociencias y la Inteligencia Artificial :).

Quien soy ?

Soy David Alvarez y me gradué como ingeniero a finales del año pasado (2016). Por mi alto desempeño académico fui seleccionado como el primer beneficiario de una beca de intercambio para realizar un proyecto de investigación (mi tesis) en Suiza. Publique este trabajo en una conferencia internacional de la IEEE. De igual forma, también obtuve el Promedio Ponderado Acumulado mas alto de la facultad de Ingeniería y por esto, fui distinguido en mi ceremonia de graduación.

Tengo una gran pasión por el “estudio de la inteligencia” desde diferentes perspectivas, como la Neurociencia, la Inteligencia Artificial y la Teoría de la probabilidad. Disfruto tocar piano (puedes ver mis interpretaciones de vals y pop) y acordeón (mira mis videos de vals y Vallenato). Soy un vegetariano moderado: En mi día a día no consumo carne, sin embargo cuando voy a un nuevo lugar o conozco nuevas personas, me encanta probar nuevas cosas y por eso en estas situaciones en específico soy abierto a comer cualquier cosa.

 

A que destinare los fondos:

Todo el dinero que recaude lo usare para pagar los costos de matricula que son de USD $27,000 (£21,000) y para cubrir los costos de manutención que como mínimo son de USD $15500 (£12,000).

Si llego a recoger mas dinero que el objetivo establecido, usare el excedente de fondos para pagar el costo de la plataforma de Indiegogo y los costos provenientes de las transferencias por Tarjeta de Crédito.

Si no logro alcanzar el objetivo de donaciones (o quedo muy lejos de este), utilizare los fondos para estudiar Neurociencias en otra Maestría en la cual ya he sido aceptador,  en EPFL (Ciencias de la Computación con especialización en Neurociencias) o la Universidad de Edinburgh (Informatica con enfasis en Computación Neuronal)

 

Premios y como me puedes ayudar:

Puedes ayudarme bien sea donando a mi campaña, o compartiendo la en Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, por email, hablando con tus amigos, familiares y colegas …. por todos lados !

Tambien me puedes encontrar en mi pagina de ColombianToOxford en Facebook, Instagram, y Twitter compartiendo post con el hashtag #ColombianToOxford.

Premios → Muchas gracias por tu donación, tu ayuda me lleva cada vez mas cerca a cumplir mi sueño. En agradecimiento, puedes elegir los premios que se encuentran al costado izquierdo de esta pagina

story:
About the Chicago Ghost Conference

For 8 years, the Chicago Ghost Conference has brought together students, teachers, historians, artists, writers, philosophers, folklorists, scientists, inventors and others with one purpose: to share ideas about what happens to the human personality after physical death, and to study the potential of the human mind, both during life and after we die. 
Our past speakers have included:
Jeff Belanger: Host of PBS' The Hauntings of New England, founder of GhostVillage.com and writer for the Travel Channel's "Ghost Adventures."
Josh Gates: Adventurer and television host.
Andy Openlander: Designer of "radios to the dead."
Ursula Bielski: Chicago cemetery historian and ghostlorist
Marian Cheatham: Young adult novelist and Eastland Disaster historian
Deb and Tony Pickman: owners of the enigmatic "Sallie House"
Robert Murch: Ouija board historian
Lorraine Warren: world renowned American paranormal investigator
Adam Selzer: Chicago historian and geneaologist
Len Miller and J.C. Rositas: Gary, Indiana historians and researchers.
Jeff Mudgett: Author of "Bloodstains," a book about his lineage to serial killer H.H. Holmes
Scott Markus: Author of "Voices from the Chicago Grave" and documentarian of the Lacrosse Drownings.
Mary Sutherland: Chronicler of the Burlington, Wisconsin Energy Vortex
Dave Schrader: Host of Darkness Radio and author of "The Other Side: A Teen's Guide to Ghost Hunting."
Stephen Braude: Philosopher and professor emeritus of the University of Maryland.
Dan Melone: Archaeologist specializing in Native America culture.
 
This year we are excited to welcome Rosemary Ellen Guiley, encyclopedist of the paranormal; Loren Coleman, specialist in unidentified species, John Zaffis (host of SyFy's "Haunted Collector") and Chip Coffey, renowned spiritual counselor and medium, as well as Rabbi Sid Vineburg, historian Clarence Goodman, cultural anthropologist Scott Cashman, and more.
This annual, popular gathering is more than a think tank or a convention for "ghost hunters."  It's also a passionate time of charity, sharing and community outreach, raising funds for causes both local and international, both educational and physical.  A substantial food drive and a huge raffle for well known charities are always an important part of the event, as is community outreach to involve our local schools, businesses and organizations.  Student tickets are always free, as well as a block of tickets for veterans.  We are a tight-knit network of colleagues and friends of all ages and from all walks of life, all of us with an interest in the "survival question."  

What We Need & What You Get

Ticket sales are never enough to cover the costs of our event.  We keep our ticket prices low in order to make the event available to as many attendees as possible, and we give away many free tickets to those who could not otherwise attend.  In the past, excess costs have been covered by Chicago Hauntings, a  respected, 13-year-old Chicago-based history tour company specializing in field trips and educational events, founded by author and historian Ursula Bielski, one of the city's most recognized and respected researchers into the survival question.  Like many businesses, a difficult winter greatly reduced available funds to aid this year's event.  For the first time, we are asking for support from the community to ensure that the event continues to present the resources it has become known as respected for: quality, entertaining speakers from around the nation, accessible experts, and engaging events for all ages.  Our goal is simple:
-To help defray the cost of conference expenses, including speaker fees and travel needs, venue fees and events, in order to  keep our ticket prices low, and focus our ticket sale proceeds on getting the word out and providing low cost general tickets and free student tickets for all young people and veterans.

 

PERKS!

Individuals, businesses, and organizations who contribute $50 or more have the opportunity to see their name on our conference T-Shirts and websites.  Contributions of $125 or more will get your name on these and on our welcome banner at the event.  And every contribution of $25 will get a conference T-Shirt.    

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially.  If you can't,  please support us by sharing the link to our campaign, and by telling your friends about the exciting work we are doing in survival research, from exploring the rich history behind reportedly "haunted" sites, to building radios to speak to the dead!  Please also consider supporting and sharing about the charities and organizations we donate to, including Chicago Coalition for the Homeless, the Rhine Research Center and the Real Life Superheroes!
story_txt:
About the Chicago Ghost ConferenceFor 8 years, the Chicago Ghost Conference has brought together students, teachers, historians, artists, writers, philosophers, folklorists, scientists, inventors and others with one purpose: to share ideas about what happens to the human personality after physical death, and to study the potential of the human mind, both during life and after we die.  Our past speakers have included:Jeff Belanger: Host of PBS' The Hauntings of New England, founder of GhostVillage.com and writer for the Travel Channel's "Ghost Adventures."Josh Gates: Adventurer and television host.Andy Openlander: Designer of "radios to the dead."Ursula Bielski: Chicago cemetery historian and ghostloristMarian Cheatham: Young adult novelist and Eastland Disaster historianDeb and Tony Pickman: owners of the enigmatic "Sallie House"Robert Murch: Ouija board historian Lorraine Warren: world renowned American paranormal investigatorAdam Selzer: Chicago historian and geneaologistLen Miller and J.C. Rositas: Gary, Indiana historians and researchers.Jeff Mudgett: Author of "Bloodstains," a book about his lineage to serial killer H.H. HolmesScott Markus: Author of "Voices from the Chicago Grave" and documentarian of the Lacrosse Drownings.Mary Sutherland: Chronicler of the Burlington, Wisconsin Energy VortexDave Schrader: Host of Darkness Radio and author of "The Other Side: A Teen's Guide to Ghost Hunting."Stephen Braude: Philosopher and professor emeritus of the University of Maryland.Dan Melone: Archaeologist specializing story:
We are the Harding Family, we are a British family living on a little farm in the foothills of the central Appenines, Italy. It is a wonderfully pure environment and we are surrounded by fabulous wildlife. Our Mum is a Montessori Teacher who used to have a nursery school in London and we help her run a summer school.

Children from all over the world come and spend time in our woods playing in the river, messing about with clay, climbing trees,  making things with sticks and enjoying the freedom and the nature around them. It is the perfect antidote to living in an apartment in a city.  Now we want to extend this all year round and to include  adults, and school trips so that as many people as possible can come and have fun, creative, woodland adventures together.  But in order to this we need better facilities.

We have a barn that we would like to turn into a base camp and workshop but at the moment it is home to our horses so we need to build them a new stable. We are going to use a lot of reclaimed building materials but we do need to spend some money on the base and the roof. Once the horses are comfortable we can get to work clearing up the barn, putting in some lights, windows and a toilet. We know it will be hard work but we are sure we can do it by working together.

The real challenge of living here is to find a way to make a living and with your help we can do that in a fun and creative way that also benefits our visitors. Once upon a time this sort of activity would have been a normal part of childhood but is sadly a rare treat in the modern world.


We can do all this and more for E10 000. We have some really fun perks including a homemade bow carved from one piece of wood, and a weekend's Glamping in the woods. It would be great if you could contribute to our campaign but it would also help if you could share it with as many people as possible. Thank you.

Tom, Lucy, Gus, Albert, Honor, Noah and Sofia.

story:
Language Matters

5 billion people worldwide have no access to vital information - about healthcare, food, security, you name it - for one simple reason: the information isn't available in their language. Commercial translation companies don't meet their needs because too often the recipients can't pay or their markets are just not economically viable enough.


How We Are Helping

The Rosetta Foundation makes it possible for willing volunteer translators to collaborate with hundreds of non-profit organisations and charities worldwide to respond to unmet language needs in every imaginable subject: documenting children who face injustice, violence, and abuse; fostering sustainable development through environmental education; supporting special-needs athletes - and so much more!


Our growing corps of volunteer linguists donates their time and expertise so that crucial - often life-changing -  information can reach thousands of people around the world. To support this work, the Foundation has pioneered Trommons, the Translation Commons: a unique, collaborative software platform that directly links translators with those who need their help most.

Every day, Trommons actively supports the multilingual work of hundreds of charitable organisations. Here is what some of them have to say:

Crosscare

  • “With The Rosetta Foundation support we have been able to work with more people than we could have on our own. We’ve been able to make a real difference for the people we’re here to support.”

Special Olympics

  • “We constantly need to provide information, training, and support in as many languages as we can—providing everything in English alone is simply no longer an option.  Like many other non-profits, the problem is that we do not have the funds to meet our linguistic needs through normal commercial channels.”

ACNUR (UNHCR in Spain)

  • “The Rosetta Foundation help has enabled us, for example, to launch our emergency appeal in the aftermath of the devastation caused by Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines; and to raise awareness and funding for the second phase of the initiative set up by UNHCR to improve the quality of teaching and increase the number of child refugees receiving an education. Thank you so much for working alongside us for the cause of refugees.”

and so many more. All for free.

We Need Your Help!

The Rosetta Foundation Trommons now connects over 8,000 volunteers and 200 charitable partner organisations on every continent:

We need you! We need your donations to sustain this special collaborative platform managed by a small, but fiercely dedicated team, so our partners can expand their vital missions to more areas around the world. 

Everything you contribute goes directly to support The Rosetta Foundation's global work - we don't have a large staff, we don't have big budgets for marketing, and we don't spend lots of time fundraising. We rely on donations for everything we do.

Please help bridge the life-threatening language gap around the world by giving whatever you can today! 

Because translation changes lives.


* * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Join our volunteers!

Over 8,000 people around the world are donating their skills to help. Why not you? Hear what one volunteer says about working with The Rosetta Foundation:

story:
I am MaryElaine De Good-Wheatley.  Sixty four years experienced and working five years on creating a book that is culturally and developmentally diverse, plus utilizes activities for brain development. Cutting, gluing, two new games, observation, counting, imagination use, kindness activities and more.  I am the sole illustrator, writer, designer, developer, other than the faeries, naturally.

In the Mt. Baker Faerie Forest: A Photo Journal & Activity Book is includes twelve faeries all members of the International Woodland Faerie Nation located, secretly, in the forests surrounding the slumbering volcano, Mt. Baker.  Each faerie works with something that interests them in the environment or socially and part of the Happy Hearts for Humans Initiative.

Included in the twelve faeries is a Downs Syndrome faerie, but in the faerie world she is called UPS. Our UPS faerie Captains the White sided Dolphin Racing Team. A Black who takes care of the marshes. Hispanic faerie who protects tadpoles. Polynesian faerie who honors the Green Sea Turtles. A merfaerie  helping the Monk Seals. A Grandma that runs the Alpha Wolf Cub Camp and invented the Level 10 Happy Heart Power Faerie Wands. Little Person faerie opened and operates tree side acorn stands. A faerie with Alopecia who is in charge of the Happy Hearts Village Tall Dreams Library. A hearing challenged faerie who loves to fish and by golly, a Bigfoot faerie the prankster.  There is a faerie that cares for the butterflies and one for the honey bees.

The 13th faerie is the reader and the book is for boys and girls ages 4-12.

Check out the Faeries on the website: www.lainewheatley.com.

 What ever amount is raised is the number of books I will have printed for this first round. the greater number of books that can be printed helps bring the cost per book down.
 I am already scheduled for events and fairs to promote the book..

What ever amount is raised is the number of books I will have printed for this first round. the greater number of books that can be printed helps bring the cost per book down.

Launching party, book signing, book raffle on June 20th. Also scheduled for other summer events.

"This is a keepsake book" Audra from Garden Spot Nursery, Bellingham, WA.

"This is a book that is not read all at one time. My granddaughter is four years old and loved looking at the pictures and counting the faerie elements." Judith Culver, Grandmother

"This book is evergreen.  Like Monopoly the book spans the generations."  Eric Grimstead, Small Business Development Center, WWU

"My two boys, ages 8 and 10, liked there are boy faeries and hope for indivdual faerie stories in the future." Suzet Burgeron

story:
We are putting Chicago Booth MBAs on the road

We are four MBA students at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business who are starting a program that will allow the next generation of MBAs to help communities across America.

MBAs want to do social impact work; startups want them to help out 

Today’s MBA students are passionate and want to do socially focused work, however, many of them don’t follow this path. Instead, they pursue more traditional jobs in the corporate world without having had a chance to explore the social entrepreneurship perspective.

Meanwhile, there are many young, mission-driven startups that need additional sets of hands and would benefit greatly from the MBAs but don’t have access to them because they’re somewhere remote or simply can’t afford it.

Chicago Road Ventures program will match MBAs with startups

After MBAs finish their traditional summer internships, our program, Chicago Road Ventures, will offer teams of MBAs an actual opportunity to explore pro bono work over a short but very intense period of 2-3 weeks.

These teams will work with entrepreneurs in the more remote locations of our country – away from Chicago, New York, or San Francisco – to help them solve some of their most challenging business problems.

Our teams will work with entrepreneurs one week at a time. The goal is to dig deep and immerse ourselves in business problems that will help these companies grow.

The homework is done – the program operations are set in place

We have already found over 60 incoming Chicago Booth students who are excited to join the CRV program next year. Meanwhile, we have also received applications from a number of entrepreneurs eager to work with CRV teams. Entrepreneurs like a health-focused tech startup in Louisville, Kentucky looking to improve the patient experience and a construction payment platform in New Orleans looking to support small businesses.  And the school administration is willing to support this program next year, once we've shown that the program works. 

This is why we are setting up a pilot for this summer. The team will consist of the four of us – Chris, Emma, Kevin, and Simon. We met each other during our first year at Booth through our common interest in social impact.  All of us have been active contributors to the Chicagoland community throughout our first year at Chicago Booth and want to expand this impact through this program. We have worked together to create this program using our experiences from our careers. 

  • Chris's Finance and Sustainability strengths build on the restaurant business he founded and operated, as well as his 4 years as an equity analyst.
  • Emma's Marketing and Legal experience is the result of 4 years of marketing and business development work in three multinational corporate law firms.
  • Kevin's Technology and Business Development insights leverage his 5 years in tech consulting, as well as his own EdTech startup experience.
  • Simon's Strategy and Operations skills build on multiple years in international strategy consulting, as well as his engineering background.

We need your support to make this pilot reality 

The four of us are committed to this movement and have already sketched out plans to hit the road. But at this stage, we need your help. We need funding to drive across the country and put ourselves up when the entrepreneurs don’t have room for us. Any funding left over, we’ll put into the program for next year, along with the funding and support that the University of Chicago has indicated they'll provide.

But this initial pilot is on us. So please help us get this thing on the road!

As  the actual work is pro bono, we are looking to cover the travel expenses incurred through the four of us during the three-week pilot in September:

We expect the overall costs for the pilot trip to be $4,500

  • Accommodation 21 nights for 4 people :   $2,000
  • Incidentals & Contingencies                    :    $1,500
  • Car rental (with University discount)     :    $   500
  • Gas (assuming startups in KY, LA, TX)  :    $   500

Should the travel expenses in the end be more, we are willing to cover it out-of-pocket. But as we are asking the startups to help us with accommodation and other cost items, we are hoping to use less than what we've budgeted. Should we have some money leftover at the end of the pilot, it will directly go back into the program and will benefit the teams next year. 

The impact of your support goes beyond the pilot!

Our goal is to create a lasting impact at Chicago Booth that is sustained long after we graduate so classes after our own can participate, add their own ideas, and grow the program. We have seen from similar programs, such as MBAx, that the impact is impressive and now want to bring it to the University of Chicago community! 

Chicago Road Ventures will allow these MBA teams to learn the real life struggles of social businesses while having a meaningful impact and explore new places. As it is directed at 1st-years, it offers them an opportunity in the second half of their summer to explore the world of social entrepreneurship in addition to their full-time internships without forcing them to choose between the two, enabling more teams to go out and make a difference.

Entrepreneurs will each benefit from an intense week of pre-scoped, hands-on support from a dynamic team of former consultants, entrepreneurs, and business developers. We have a bias for action and want to get our hands dirty. Equally importantly, we want to continue having an impact – even after we leave town. We see this as an opportunity to build some lasting pro bono relationships with key entrepreneurs and will follow up throughout the year.

Not only would you be supporting the four of us to help three young U.S. startups this September, but your money will go to prove the success of the collaboration of MBAs and startups in the future. After all, through your support, we will be able to prove the success of the program and the will support the future teams. 

There are also other ways you can help!

The funds we are gathering are going directly to cover our travel expenses during the pilot, such as accommodation, car rental, gas for the car and incidental & emergency expenses for 3 weeks.

So you can help us out with any of the above directly in non-monetary form!

And if you know of someone who would be interested in helping small startups across the USA with MBAs, please spread the word and send them the link to our campaign through any of the Indiegogo share tools.

Thanks for reading this, and let us know if you've got any questions or want to help in some way.

Yours,

Chris, Emma, Kevin and Simon

expect the overall costs for the pilot trip to be $4,500


Accommodation 21 nights for 4 people :   $2,000


Incidentals & Contingencies                    :    $1,500 



Car rental (with University discount)     :    $   500

Gas (assuming startups in KY, LA, TX)  :    $   500

Should
the travel expenses in the end be more, we are willing to cover it
out-of-pocket. But as we are asking the startups to help us with accommodation
and other cost items, we are hoping to use less than what we've budgeted.
Should we have some money leftover at the end of the pilot, it will directly go
back into the program and will benefit the teams next year. 
The
impact of your support goes beyond the pilot!
Our
goal is to create a lasting impact at Chicago Booth that is sustained long
after we graduate so classes after our own can participate, add their own
ideas, and grow the program. We have seen from similar programs, such as MBAx,
that the impact is impressive and now want to bring it to the University of Chicago
community! 
Chicago Road Ventures will allow these MBA teams to learn the real life
struggles of social businesses while having a meaningful impact and explore new
places. As it is directed at 1st-years, it offers them an opportunity in the
second half of their summer to explore the world of social entrepreneurship in
addition to their full-time internships without forcing them to choose
between the two, enabling more teams to go out and make a difference.
Entrepreneurs
will each benefit from an intense week of pre-scoped, hands-on support from a
dynamic team of former consultants, entrepreneurs, and business developers. We
have a bias for action and want to get our hands dirty. Equally importantly, we
want to continue having an impact – even after we leave town. We see this as an
opportunity to build some lasting pro bono relationships with key entrepreneurs
and will follow up throughout the year.
Not
only would you be supporting the four of us to help three young U.S. startups this
September, but your money will go to prove the success of the collaboration of
MBAs and startups in the future. After all, through your support, we will be
able to prove the success of the program and the will
support the future teams. 
There
are also other ways you can help!
The
funds we are gathering are going directly to cover our travel expenses during
the pilot, such as accommodation, car rental, gas for the car and incidental & emergency expenses for 3
weeks.
So
you can help us out with any of the above directly in non-monetary form!
And
if you know of someone who would be interested in helping small startups across
the USA with MBAs, please spread the word and send them the link to our
campaign through any of the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks for reading this, and let us know if you've got any questions or want to help in some way.
Yours,
Chris,
Emma, Kevin and Simon

story:
Friends; Losing everything is not what you think it is; it's what you cannot imagine. Forgetting someone you once loved, is like trying to remember someone you never knew. Your help matters to make a positive difference in a friend's life. Contribute to the Nepal Earthquake Relief Program.


When disasters strike, it has a long term affect on the people and their lives. Life might never get back to normal, since the fear of earthquake will remain an uncertainty. Helping Hands Relief Program is to bring supplies and tools out locally to affected families.  

Read the story I received from Nepal just a few days after the devastating earthquake:  "We have already spent 7 days without anything from government body we have heard so many relief packages has been arrived around the world but we never get even single tent, mat, rice, water. We slept so many days without anything now we make some shelter our self to stop rain and wind but these is very weak can be leak water and wind very easily. Our small child already start to sick we don’t know we are able to live or not."

Supplies are distributed at the local level to those who lost their homes. We are supporting hard working men and women in the fields who are raising families while assisting with rebuilding homes. 

We are Helping Hands in awareness; aspire to greatness, to make meaningful activities, show enthusiasm for adventure and to compassion for the difficult lives. This concept is to manage funds locally and distribute supplies where needed.  

Friends; Your contribution and continuing support is critical to success and to give hope to those who need it now. Contribute today and share our Helping Hands Campaign with family and friends, and spread the great news.

story:
Tomorrow is a holiday


wonderful！

If…                                                                                                                                                     If all school days were holidays full of excitements.

That would be so great!




surprise


We hear you now.

We have a fascinating gift for you.  This year, we will build a dream school made up of kids only, no teacher at all

School is not a boring place anymore.  We make it a paradise so you want to rush into it every morning!





What is the best part about a school with no teacher?


No teacher here. Kids learn and teach all by themselves!                                                   Wow, Kids are teachers. Fantastic !

Kids study and check data seriously, work with each other and write textbooks on their own. Here, kids educate each other and respect each other.

Schooling is not boring anymore. Most importantly, kids learn better as they teach each other.

As soon as you walk into the school, you see all kids excited about the coming classes, talking with each other about who teaches better.




What are the roles of students?


This is the most exciting part！  School is made up of students. Why not give students a chance to handle their classes? This is the idea behind the dream school – giving students a chance to run their school.

Students run their school. Amazing!  Don’t be surprised to see it happen in a real world.

In this school, students can…

  • Teach. Design courses for other kids                                                                           Before, all courses were taught by teachers.                                                               Now, students design and teach all courses, mathematics, electronics, quantum mechanics, guitar, philosophy, and so on.You can teach whatever course you like.
  • Create student societies                                                                                   Students and their hobby friends can create all kinds of societies                         unfettered by the bounds of reality, such as watermelon eaters’ society, shy boys’ society, and integral study society, to name just a few.                                   All kinds of fascinating societies are waiting to be created.
  • Give speeches                                                                                                           Whats?  Now you can have your own speech. Unbelievable!                                       Students can choose all kinds of topics for their speeches.Yes, all kinds of topics, even the daily trifles, tips for daily life, book reviews, and the philosophy of life.
  • Organize events                                                                                                        Everyday is like a holiday. Students can arrange all kinds of events as they wish, such as hundred guitar players’ day, scientific fiction day, cosplay...           Students can also work with other schools to arrange whatever events they like, for example, computer program contest event, book launch, graffiti festival, etc.
  • Make your dream come true                                                                                           Do you want to create a computer game? Do you care to produce a  marvelous cartoon to catch everybody’s attention?                                                                         Here, you can find friends with same ideals and beliefs so you can work together to make your dreams come true.















What is the idea behind this dream school?


For one thing – happiness                                                                                                          Learning is important, but learning happily is more important than learning itself.

Imagine this: a dietician is promoting a nutrition plan in a school, encouraging students to eat apples.

This is a stereotyped approach – students are told to eat apples with each meal, three meals a day, apples are cooked with rice, with soup, and with every dish. Students are fed up with apples after they eat apples for three years. Eventually, all students lose their appetite for apples.

This is another approach – instead of giving students apples, dietitian produce videos to present the crumbly texture, the savor, and the mouth-melting taste of apples to the students. When students see people eating apples with relish and enjoyment, they simply cannot resist the temptation of apples.

After school all students rush homes and start looking for apples. They eat apples today, tomorrow, day after day. Eating apples becomes a hobby.

It’s the same for education. If kids are forced to learn something, they may learn it for a while but will lose their interest sooner or later.

But if we can motivate kids and inspire them to enjoy learning something, they will learn it initiatively for the rest of their lives.





What can students expect from the dream school?


Lots of confidence and motivation.

Here, you can study calculus, organic chemistry, fluid mechanics... although you are not yet a college student. With your burning desire, you can study whatever course you like, no matter how difficult it is.





Do you have elite class and low-grade class in the school?


This is the best part. In this school, everybody is valued; nobody is treated as a fool. No exam in this school. No exam means no ranking; no ranking means no fool.

Even if you cannot study well, you still can discuss the course with friends or lecture your classmates on the course.

Wait a minute; you are going to teach something you don’t really understand?

You’re right. Teaching is a powerful tool for learning. Everybody need it, no matter you are a quick learner or a slow learner. That’s so cool!





Why is it important for everybody to feel valued?


There are 7 billion people in this world. It makes no sense to count on the top people – only 1% of the world’s population – to change our world for us. Elite education does not serve our needs in this information-bursting era.

1% of the world’s population has changed our world by leaps and bounds. If 100% of the world’s population is respected and valued, it will be very difficult to imagine how much we can change our world.






What to do after study?


You don’t have to wait until you grow up. You can start your big dreams right here, right now!What, I can start my dream now? That’s unbelievable.

Here, you can study for your dreams, not for scores and exams.

Do you care to build a spaceship? Do you want to invent the greatest mathematical theorem in the history?

Here, you can make a team with friends and pursue the knowledge needed for your goals. Kids’ dreams start from now on! not 10 years later.





Who are eligible?


12-18 years old. We don’t care if one is a talent or a fool. With artless dreams and passions, everybody is welcome to join us.





Purpose of raising funds

We need land and school equipment to fulfill this exciting marvelous school.

This very first school will be established in Taiwan. Once there is the first school, there comes the second, the third and eventually it will spread all over the world which aims to make a great change to our education system.




Future prospect

Now we are focusing on the age range between 12~18 years old. However, our great ambition is aiming to launch into universities.

There will be all kinds of experiment rooms which the children will be the president.It's so exciting



Impact

We want to prove to the world that kids has ability!                                                         Let kids explore on their own. Be their own teacher. Then change the world!

Our kids will be able to solve the most critical global problems                                     Are you ready to make it all come true?                                                                                 Yes!

story:
We Rise By Lifting Others: Our Story

Thank you for taking time out of your day to read about our project.  We hope our story will inspire you to help us meet our goal to provide school supplies and spread Holiday cheer to over 500 Orphan children in the country of Benin this December....  And, you'll also get some unique and fantastic Perks for contributing!  

We are Little Angels Children's Charities; an American charitable organization, recently set up to provide direct financial and logistical support to Amour du Prochain Fondation, a Benin based NGO founded by the highly celebrated, award winning lyricist and traditional West African entertainer, Norberka.   The name of the NGO literally translates to "Love thy Neighbor" Foundation.  

For the past four years, Norberka has gone to great lengths to spread Holiday cheer to hundreds of Orphaned children who yearn to feel wanted and acknowledged, particularly during the holiday season.  Every December 25th, in her hometown of Sahoué Doutou, Benin---Norberka puts on a free Live music concert and also contributes a large portion of her yearly earnings to purchase food, gifts and school supplies for as many orphan children as her funds will support.   Furthermore, she expends a great deal of  energy to rally the town dignitaries, the local king, volunteers;  and insures that they not only commit to being present at the event; but also agree to give speeches to honor the children.  


In addition to its yearly Holiday obligations, the foundation also seeks to provide school supplies for each Orphan child during the fall & winter semesters.   Without parents to purchase backpacks, writing instruments, notebooks and even clothing for school, these children are often deprived of the tools that are minimally required, just to be considered a prepared student.  In some cases, students are 100% responsible for purchasing their own textbooks.   With your support, we are confident that we'll be able to meet their needs in this regard.  


On this side of the Atlantic, we've dug into deep into our pockets and did what we could on a personal level to help support Norberka's cause, over the past four years.   However, this year we decided to wise up, incorporate and file for a 501(c)3 non-profit, in order to attract support from a wider audience.  And by the end of 2015, we'll also be able to provide tax deductible receipts to our sponsors.    


Impact: A Child's Nourishment Defines His Capacity
For Orphan Children in the country of Benin, the year-end Holiday season is a time when deeply buried feelings of exclusion bubble up to the surface.  Non-Orphan children in West Africa are deeply tied to family, ancestry and cultural traditions. The absence of family influences and traditions in the life of an Orphan, often compels that Child to construct an inner reality that is rooted in feelings of abandonment.   And there's no time like Christmas and other family-centric holidays, to remind an orphan child that he/she is alone in the world.   A time in which their young adolescent hearts should be replete with joy and laughter, is instead filled with agony and dread.  After all, most of their caretakers will leave to go spend Christmas with their own families; and local children in the surrounding neighborhoods---who have parents, will be celebrating and showing off their new toys and gifts.  


We all know what its like to feel left out----- but to simultaneously feel "Left Out" and "Less Than" during Christmas,  is to experience an emotional trauma that unfolds in three acts:  discovery, distress; and, ultimately detachment.   The psychological impact to children who repeatedly experience this year after year, is akin to PTSD.   Norberka's efforts to introduce these children to the modern ceremonial practice of holiday-themed gift giving; encourages them to feel more acknowledged, loved and nurtured; resulting in a vitally cathartic experience that lovingly ushers each child towards a path of recovery from feelings of abandonment, harbored deep within their tender hearts.      


Nourishing Their Minds, Bodies and Souls: 


It's not just about the Holidays.  In keeping with a holistic approach to serving the overall needs of each orphan, the foundation will utilize some of the funds raised through this project, to purchase enough school supplies to last these kids an entire school year.   

You can make a real difference this year by Helping us pool enough resources to provide School Supplies, Food and Toys to over 500 Orphan children this year. Your support will go a long way to helping each and every child feel "included" and "acknowledged.".   Support our project.  Make a big impact today!   And do check out some of the unique and wonderful Perks that you will receive, as a show of appreciation!  

What We Need & How We'll Show YOU Appreciation:

Our goal is to raise $30,000 this year to provide school supplies, toys and 1 week worth of food to each of the 500 children!  But, if we can exceed the initial goal of this project, many more children beyond the expected 500 will be included in this years Holiday-themed charity event.   

Your donation will go towards the foundation's 2015 Holiday Orphan budget.   Last December 2014, Norberka's Amour Du Prochain Foundation provided toys and a few days worth of food for nearly 500 children.   This year, we hope to be able to provide them with food, toys along with school supplies.   We're asking you to Help us feed their minds, bodies and souls. 

Reciprocity is a strong feature of African society; it is, in fact, a feature of any well-meaning community of sentient beings.   In Benin,  a thank you is often demonstrated in the form of a reciprocal act, not just with words.   The young orphans who will benefit from your generosity,  yearn for the opportunity to demonstrate their thanks to you.   Therefore, you can also expect a personalized thank you note from them and, in addition, these children will also have some input into the selection of the Perk(s) that you will receive, with the full understanding that this is their way to show you gratitude and appreciation.  

The Perks:  A Glimpse into West African Reciprocity

If you look at the photos on this page or watch the music video above, you will see Norberka, her band members and dancers,  all adorned in various styles of Krobo bracelets and necklaces that are similar to the ones being offered as perks below.   These beaded bracelets and necklaces are handcrafted by Artisans who originate from the Krobo mountains of Ghana.    These people have been crafting beaded bracelets and necklaces since the stone age.  They are much sought after throughout West Africa for their exquisite level of craftsmanship and attention to detail.  

The Bracelets and Necklaces are made from Recycled glass bottles that are crushed into powder, then poured into molds in order to create the appealing shaped beads. Decorations on the beads are made with a paste consisting of colored glass powder and water, which is applied using a thin wooden stalk. They are baked twice to fix the decor.  Since ancient times, these artisans have always utilized Sustainable and Eco-friendly practices in the crafting of these beads.  

Each Bracelet and/or Necklace is unique and so you will not receive the exact same beads shown below, but something similar in craftsmanship.  Bracelets are adjustable to fit all Wrist sizes equally.   The perks will be sent to you sometime in late December 2015, so expect delivery around early January.  

When was the last time you did something Self-Less and got Rewarded for it? 

See The Perks Below, And Choose The One Appeals To You: 


Perk #1 - Get 1 Krobo Bracelet: Authentic Handmade by West African Artisans 



Perk #2 -  Get 1  Krobo Necklace:  Authentic Handmade by West African Artisan


Perk #3 - 1 Krobo Bracelet + 1 Krobo Necklace:Handmade by West African Artisans


Perk #4 - Get 3 Unique Krobo Bracelets + Digital Download of Norberka's Album  



Perk #5 - 2 Unique Krobo Necklaces + A Digital Download of Norberka's Album


Perk #6 - 1 Wrist-Full of African Krobo Bracelets:  Get 5 to 6 Beautiful Bracelets 



Perk #7 - For All Collectors: Get 2 Wrist-Full of Krobo Bracelets. 10 to 12 Total


Perk #8 - Get 7 Hand-made Artisanal Krobo Necklaces + Download Norberka's CD


Perk #9:  Cater To Your Inner Child-like Nature: Receive 9 Unique Krobo Necklaces


Perk #10 -You Are A Thousand Points of Light:    You will Receive Perk 7 + Perk 9, along with an autographed photo of Norberka and 1 download of Norberka's album.  In addition, you will also receive a special video thank you message from Norberka and the children, to be recorded at the December 25th event.    This is the ultimate Swag Bag.  You get two wrists full of bracelets and 5 Krobo Necklaces with this perk.  


Perk #11 - Attend A Bead Making Workshop in West Africa:   Come to West Africa and spend a day learning the art of Bead making from Artisanal masters of the craft.  Learn vital techniques and skills that date back to the stone age.   Leave with some wonderful parting gifts, marketable skills, a culturally immersive experience and some beautiful creations of your own making.  In addition, you will also have a chance to spend the day with Norberka and the Orphan children.  


Perk #12 -  An Evolved Soul Walks Among Us:   At this level, you will Receive non-duplicated items within Perks 7 & 11.  And, in addition, you also receive:
  • A special commemorative plaque thanking you, along with an invitation to attend the December 25th event as our guest of honor.  
  •  An opportunity to accompany Norberka and a few of the children on a special multi-hour air-conditioned cultural tour of the city of Cotonou, the capital of Benin.  This will provide you with a  wonderful opportunity to see and learn about the Ancient sites of Benin/Dahomey, its people and customs. 
  • A chance to Experience the local and traditional cuisines of Benin.
Perk #13 -  Behold! A Philanthropic SuperStar is Born:  You will Receive All non-duplicated items in Perks 7,9 & 11.   In addition: 
  • You will come to meet the Minister of Culture of Benin (rare opportunity). In a country where culture is at the forefront of society, meeting this minister of culture is comparable to meeting the secretary of State of the United States. 
  • Norberka and her musicians will Perform a Special Private Concert For You and with any other individual who donates at this level.   
  • Members of local TV, radio and print media will be invited to both the Charity event and to your private concert.  And you will have the  opportunity(should you desire) to be interviewed and recognized for your generous support and participation.  The TV viewing public of Benin will come to know you for your generous act of philanthropy. 
  • You will also Receive an autographed, authentic West African Djembe style DRUM from Norberka's personal collection!! 


We and the Children Sincerely Hope that You Find the Perks Above Appealing! 

Be Someone's Reason to Smile: Support our Effort


Does Shipping Cost Extra? 

Does shipping cost extra?

Yes. Indiegogo allows us to add any extra shipping to our special perks that need delivering, so please be mindful when you go through the checkout process that a small charge is added for shipping.   We want to make sure that close to 100% of your donation goes to the program and that is why shipping is added at checkout, to the suggested donation price on this page.


Please help spread the word to help make this possible

1. Share our campaign link with family and friends: www.igg.me/at/500orphans/
2.  If you prefer to make an offline cash (tax deductible) donation, please make a check payable to the "Little Angels Children's Charities" and ask us for the mailing address.  We will happily provide it to you via email or telephone: 

Your individual help can make a huge difference to the success of this project and is greatly appreciated. Thank you!

· Tell your friends, family & others why this should be supported

· Please share our story on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Google+, etc

· By all means, spread the word worldwide to any media source that might be interested!

· Please use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Thank you Kindly.
story_txt:
We Rise By Lifting Others: Our Story

Thank you for taking time out of your day to read about our project.  We hope our story will inspire you to help us meet our goal to provide school supplies and spread Holiday cheer to over 500 Orphan children in the country of Benin this December....  And, you'll also get some unique and fantastic Perks for contributing!  



We are Little Angels Children's Charities; an American charitable organization, recently set up to provide direct financial and logistical support to Amour du Prochain Fondation, a Benin based NGO founded by the highly celebrated, award winning lyricist and traditional West African entertainer, Norberka.   The name of the NGO literally translates to "Love thy Neighbor" Foundation.  




For the past four years, Norberka has gone to great lengths to spread Holiday cheer to hundreds of Orphaned children who yearn to feel wanted and acknowledged, particularly during the holiday season.  Every December 25th, in her hometown of Sahoué Doutou, Benin---Norberka puts on a free Live music concert and also contributes a large portion of her yearly earnings to purchase food, gifts and school supplies for as many orphan children as her funds will support.   Furthermore, she expends a great deal of  energy to rally the town dignitaries, the local king, volunteers;  and insures that they not only commit to being present at the event; but also agree to give speeches to honor the children.  



In addition to its yearly Holiday obligations, the foundation also seeks to provide school supplies for each Orphan child during the fall & winter semesters.   Without parents to purchase backpacks, writing instruments, notebooks and even clothing for school, these children are often deprived of the tools that are minimally required, just to be considered a prepared student.  In some cases, students are 100% responsible for purchasing their own textbooks.   With your support, we are confident that we'll be able to meet their needs in this regard.  


On this side of the Atlantic, we've dug into deep into our pockets and did what we could on a personal level to help support Norberka's cause, over the past four years.   However, this year we decided to wise up, incorporate and file for a 501(c)3 non-profit, in order to attract support from a wider audience.  And by the end of 2015, we'll also be able to provide tax deductible receipts to our sponsors.    






Impact: A Child's Nourishment Defines His Capacity


For Orphan Children in the country of Benin, the year-end Holiday season is a time when deeply buried feelings of exclusion bubble up to the surface.  Non-Orphan children in West Africa are deeply tied to family, ancestry and cultural traditions. The absence of family influences and traditions in the life of an Orphan, often compels that Child to construct an inner reality that is rooted in feelings of abandonment.   And there's no time like Christmas and other family-centric holidays, to remind an orphan child that he/she is alone in the world.   A time in which their young adolescent hearts should be replete with joy and laughter, is instead filled with agony and dread.  After all, most of their caretakers will leave to go spend Christmas with their own families; and local children in the surrounding neighborhoods---who have parents, will be celebrating and showing off their new toys and gifts.  





We all know what its like to feel left out----- but to simultaneously feel "Left Out" and "Less Than" during Christmas,  is to experience an emotional trauma that unfolds in three acts:  discovery, distress; and, ultimately detachment.   The psychological impact to children who repeatedly experience this year after year, is akin to PTSD.   Norberka's efforts to introduce these children to the modern ceremonial practice of holiday-themed gift giving; encourages them to feel more acknowledged, loved and nurtured; resulting in a vitally cathartic experience that lovingly ushers each child towards a path of recovery from feelings of abandonment, harbored deep within their tender hearts.      





Nourishing Their Minds, Bodies and Souls: 

It's not just about the Holidays.  In keeping with a holistic approach to serving the overall needs of each orphan, the foundation will utilize some of the funds raised through this project, to purchase enough school supplies to last these kids an entire school year.   

You can make a real difference this year by Helping us pool enough resources to provide School Supplies, Food and Toys to over 500 Orphan children this year. Your support will go a long way to helping each and every child feel "included" and "acknowledged.".   Support our project.  Make a big impact today!   And do check out some of the unique and wonderful Perks that you will receive, as a show of appreciation!  

   What We Need & How We'll Show YOU Appreciation:


Our goal is to raise $30,000 this year to provide school supplies, toys and 1 week worth of food to each of the 500 children!  But, if we can exceed the initial goal of this project, many more children beyond the expected 500 will be included in this years Holiday-themed charity event.   

Your donation will go towards the foundation's 2015 Holiday Orphan budget.   Last December 2014, Norberka's Amour Du Prochain Foundation provided toys and a few days worth of food for nearly 500 children.   This year, we hope to be able to provide them with food, toys along with school supplies.   We're asking you to Help us feed their minds, bodies and souls. 


Reciprocity is a strong feature of African society; it is, in fact, a feature of any well-meaning community of sentient beings.   In Benin,  a thank you is often demonstrated in the form of a reciprocal act, not just with words.   The young orphans who will benefit from your generosity,  yearn for the opportunity to demonstrate their thanks to you.   Therefore, you can also expect a personalized thank you note from them and, in addition, these children will also have some input into the selection of the Perk(s) that you will receive, with the full understanding that this is their way to show you gratitude and appreciation.     

The Perks:  A Glimpse into West African Reciprocity


If you look at the photos on this page or watch the music video above, you will see Norberka, her band members and dancers,  all adorned in various styles of Krobo bracelets and necklaces that are similar to the ones being offered as perks below.   These beaded bracelets and necklaces are handcrafted by Artisans who originate from the Krobo mountains of Ghana.    These people have been crafting beaded bracelets and necklaces since the stone age.  They are much sought after throughout West Africa for their exquisite level of craftsmanship and attention to detail.  
The Bracelets and Necklaces are made from Recycled glass bottles that are crushed into powder, then poured into molds in order to create the appealing shaped beads. Decorations on the beads are made with a paste consisting of colored glass powder and water, which is applied using a thin wooden stalk. They are baked twice to fix the decor.  Since ancient times, these artisans have always utilized Sustainable and Eco-friendly practices in the crafting of these beads.  
Each Bracelet and/or Necklace is unique and so you will not receive the exact same beads shown below, but something similar in craftsmanship.  Bracelets are adjustable to fit all Wrist sizes equally.   The perks will be sent to you sometime in late December 2015, so expect delivery around early January.  
When was the last time you did something Self-Less and got Rewarded for it? 
See The Perks Below, And Choose The One Appeals To You: 

Perk #1 - Get 1 Krobo Bracelet: Authentic Handmade by West African Artisans 





Perk #2 -  Get 1  Krobo Necklace:  Authentic Handmade by West African Artisan



Perk #3 - 1 Krobo Bracelet + 1 Krobo Necklace:Handmade by West African Artisans


Perk #4 - Get 3 Unique Krobo Bracelets + Digital Download of Norberka's Album  






Perk #5 - 2 Unique Krobo Necklaces + A Digital Download of Norberka's Album



Perk #6 - 1 Wrist-Full of African Krobo Bracelets:  Get 5 to 6 Beautiful Bracelets 






Perk #7 - For All Collectors: Get 2 Wrist-Full of Krobo Bracelets. 10 to 12 Total



Perk #8 - Get 7 Hand-made Artisanal Krobo Necklaces + Download Norberka's CD



Perk #9:  Cater To Your Inner Child-like Nature: Receive 9 Unique Krobo Necklaces



Perk #10 -You Are A Thousand Points of Light:    You will Receive Perk 7 + Perk 9, along with an autographed photo of Norberka and 1 download of Norberka's album.  In addition, you will also receive a special video thank you message from Norberka and the children, to be recorded at the December 25th event.    This is the ultimate Swag Bag.  You get two wrists full of bracelets and 5 Krobo Necklaces with this perk.  



Perk #11 - Attend A Bead Making Workshop in West Africa:   Come to West Africa and spend a day learning the art of Bead making from Artisanal masters of the craft.  Learn vital techniques and skills that date back to the stone age.   Leave with some wonderful parting gifts, marketable skills, a culturally immersive experience and some beautiful creations of your own making.  In addition, you will also have a chance to spend the day with Norberka and the Orphan children.  



Perk #12 -  An Evolved Soul Walks Among Us:   At this level, you will Receive non-duplicated items within Perks 7 & 11.  And, in addition, you also receive:

A special commemorative plaque thanking you, along with an invitation to attend the December 25th event as our guest of honor.  

 An opportunity to accompany Norberka and a few of the children on a special multi-hour air-conditioned cultural tour of the city of Cotonou, the capital of Benin.  This will provide you with a  wonderful opportunity to see and learn about the Ancient sites of Benin/Dahomey, its people and customs. 

A chance to Experience the local and traditional cuisines of Benin.

Perk #13 -  Behold! A Philanthropic SuperStar is Born:  You will Receive All non-duplicated items in Perks 7,9 & 11.   In addition: 
You will come to meet the Minister of Culture of Benin (rare opportunity). In a country where culture is at the forefront of society, meeting this minister of culture is comparable to meeting the secretary of State of the United States. 
Norberka and her musicians will Perform a Special Private Concert For You and with any other individual who donates at this level.   
Members of local TV, radio and print media will be invited to both the Charity event and to your private concert.  And you will have the  opportunity(should you desire) to be interviewed and recognized for your generous support and participation.  The TV viewing public of Benin will come to know you for your generous act of philanthropy. 
You will also Receive an autographed, authentic West African Djembe style DRUM from Norberka's personal collection!! 


We and the Children Sincerely Hope that You Find the Perks Above Appealing! 


Be Someone's Reason to Smile: Support our Effort



   


Does Shipping Cost Extra? 

Does shipping cost extra?
Yes. Indiegogo allows us to add any extra shipping to our special perks that need delivering, so please be mindful when you go through the checkout process that a small charge is added for shipping.   We want to make sure that close to 100% of your donation goes to the program and that is why shipping is added at checkout, to the suggested donation price on this page.

2.  If you prefer to make an offline cash (tax deductible) donation, please make a check payable to the "Little Angels Children's Charities" and ask us for the mailing address.  We will happily provide it to you via email or telephone: Your individual help can make a huge difference to the success of this project and is greatly appreciated. story:
Our Mission:

Tangible Hope Foundation protects and empowers young girls in Kofele, Ethiopia to break the cycle of poverty through education. 


The Girls of Tangible Hope:


You have the ability to end the cycle of poverty by giving the gift of education to young girls in Ethiopia. In developing countries, boys are sent for education while girls stay at home working and providing for their families. Without education, the girls are susceptible to early marriage, kidnapping, rape, and premature death secondary to early childbirth. Trends show that poverty can be eliminated within a single generation by educating the girls within that community. 


The story of Ubo ("beautiful" in the Oromo language, spoken in parts of Ethiopia) 

(Ubo in the early morning hours preparing charcoal mix to make local coffee)

Meet Ubo, one of the girls sponsored through the Tangible Hope Foundation. We met Ubo during housing construction in Kofele for a family of eight who were sleeping, cooking, and living with their livestock in a small, single-room mud hut. At seven years old, Ubo worked as though she were an adult; sweeping floors, churning milk into butter, cooking, and preparing charcoal to make coffee. One day Lily, founder of Tangible Hope, decided to chat with Ubo. Lily took a photo of Ubo and decided to show her what she looked like. Ubo having never seen her own image, exclaimed 

"I didn't know I was so beautiful." 

Lily knew she had to help these girls, she had to end this cycle of poverty and instill in them, the ability to realize their true potential through education. That day, Lily made the decision to ensure that no girl would grow up without knowing how beautiful she was, or without the opportunity of education. 

Upon returning to Ethiopia, Lily went in search of Ubo. After a few days of searching,  Lily discovered the terrible news -- Ubo had been raped. The rapist had been caught, but the damage was done. Despite her suffering, Ubo is now going to school  through Tangible Hope Foundation, and leading a normal life. Medical treatment provided for Ubo showed that she is healthy. 

Ubo's hard work, maturity, independence, and resilience make her the embodiment of the Tangible Hope Foundation . 

                   


Your donation will help in the following ways:

1.) Construction of the Adu Darara (Sun Seed) Educational Center — an educational compound that serves as a safe haven for the girls. This center will protect the girls from common kidnapping and rape, and for educating the girls through after school programs. We have the land and the blueprints are completed. Our next step is construction -- in October we will begin fencing and digging. 

  

2.) Provide nutrition for the girls and their families — This ensures families do not pull the girls out of school and put them to work as household workers. 

3.) Create sustainability programs for the girls to carry the next generation out of poverty.

4.) Sponsorship of girls — $1 dollar a day/$365 a year can sustain a girl educationally, medically, physically, and hygienically, and provide their families the means to ensure the girls continue their education. 

 5.) Transportation for our team to provide whatever means necessary to continue to educate and empower the next generation of young women, and alleviate poverty, common practice of rape, kidnapping, and early marriage in susceptible areas of Ethiopia. 


Who we are and what we do:

Tangible Hope is currently sponsoring 51 young girls in Kofele, Ethiopia. By continuing to grow our sponsorship base and forming new partnerships, our goal is to increase the number of girls by at least an additional 50 girls yearly so we can continue to provide and expand our after school programs as well as improve hygiene and provide daily nutritious meals for the girls. By engaging the girls' families socially and monetarily with suppling grains and cooking oils, the families are able to keep the girls in Tangible Hope Foundation’s sponsorship program instead of making their daughters abandon school to help support the family. In using this model, Tangible Hope strives to empower young girls in order to realize their full potential and to help put an end to poverty in Ethiopia.

Meet our Team:

Telile "Lily" Yoseph, (Founder)


Janet Dean, (Treasurer)


Marisa Ruth (Director of Interns, Volunteer basis)


Mima Geelani ( Development & Sustainability Coordinator, Volunteer basis)




Board Members

Dr. Brian Hertz


Dr. William Chase


Dove Vallender


Tom Warner


William Greineder


Dr. Ketema Shaffo

story:
We would like to get your attention for a new project, which you will hopefully be interested in. In 1972, the then mayor of Amsterdam, Ivo Samkalden started crowdfunding during The Vietnam War to make sure education would not suffer too much under those circumstances. In september 1985 these funds resulted in the founding of the Hanoi - Amsterdam High School, currently one of the most prestigious schools in Vietnam. The Barlaeus Gymnasium has always felt connected with the Hanoi - Amsterdam High School, and we hope to take important steps in keeping that connection alive for many more years to come. 

Last year 22 enthusiastic and motivated students have been selected to be part of a new chapter in the already long history of the bond between these two schools. The most important change is a new level of professionalism which we hope to bring to this trip, we hope to achieve a new level of sophisticated discussion and to enhance knowledge about the valuable presented topics. We have agreed upon a strict and demanding schedule to get the most out of our time there. We will have a 5-day debate on three different subjects; water, waist disposal and urban agriculture. We think these subjects are important parts of urban environmentalism. Both the Netherlands and Vietnam are very progressive when it comes to the environment, that's why we think these subjects will bear fruit for an interesting debate on the differences of how we deal with these issues. We hope to learn from them and they from us. The debates will be intertwined with excursions to companies and institutions involved in the subjects, which then can provide more information for the debates. We would also like to invite people with a certain level of expertise on our subjects to give workshops and lectures at the Hanoi - Amsterdam High School. When the week is finished we will present the result of the discussions, which can be in the form of aims for the future but also solutions for problems we are currently facing.

Our goal is to make this a yearly exchange to keep the relationship between our schools alive. The dream is to eventually turn it into platform in which schools from other countries can also participate. But for our dreams to become reality we need your help. We need funds out of which we can pay for transport, accommodation, lectures, workshops and the other activities we have planned. We hope to primarily achieve our goals via crowdfunding, and eagerly wish we have made you enthusiastic enough to become our partner in this project.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kyle Blase and I am an early education expert.  I have been working with children since 1996 and with preschool age children since 2005.  I have a Bachelors in Music and a Masters in Early Education and I am a passionate advocate for music education for all children. 

"Afunky's Uncle" is a hard hitting multi-cultural rhythm funk machine that children and adults alike love. All the music is tested and approved by the thousands of children that hear it on a weekly basis.  We never dilute the music and believe children are ready for complex rhythms and diverse styles with a fun educational component that will engage and get large and small motors moving.  

Take a listen to some of our tracks. https://soundcloud.com/afunkysuncle

Along with great music this campaign has another mission; to help the plight of orangutans in Borneo today. Orangutans are facing extinction due to factors like illegal logging, forest conversion, large scale palm oil cultivation, fires, border disputes with local people, and jurisdictional disputes among government departments.  So as a part of this campaign 50% of all t-shirt profits will go to orphaned orangutans in Borneo. After we sell the one thousandth t-shirt, 100% of profits will be sent to organizations like Orangutan Foundation International that helps assist in the fight for the safety of orangutans.   Our goal is to foster four orphaned orangutans.

The money that is raised with this campaign will be used to pay for studio time, musicians, art work, CD manufacturing,  promotion and distribution.  We've also created our own line of music instruments, starting with high quality Remo drums, kazoos and egg shakers.  All these instruments will have our logo and will be great for jamming along with the music. 

And when we reach our goal, we'll then have the funds to create a children's book about Afunky's first day at preschool.  The book will be an educational tool for teachers, parents and child care providers to help with children that may have trouble on their first day of school. It also will be a great book for children to read to aid in their literacy.  So please help us reach our goal.

When we reach 100% of our goal.

  • Finish Afunky's debut album.
  • Secure all promotional material t-shirts, buttons, stickers and flyers.
  • Secure all Afunky's Uncle signature musical instruments.
  • Create and reproduce Afunky's very first children's book.
  • Raise money for endangered orangutans 

When we reach 150% of our goal.

  • All the things listed above
  • Produce our very first music video of  "Freeze Dance"

When we reach 200% of our goal.

  • All the things listed above
  • Produce a second album of classical sleepy time music. Perfect for putting young ones to bed.
  • Reproduce our curriculum for the classroom.
The CD will take the largest portion of our budget;  just over half (55%) of what we raise.  That will pay for musicians, travel, studio time, mixing and CD manufacturing.
We have already secured a deal with Remo to have our own signature drums with our logo silk screened on the front. We are also going to have signature kazoos and shakers. Making these instruments will take a significant portion (20%) of our budget.  
Our logo was done by Terry Matsuoko and his Crunchy Sandwich team.  They will also be providing the CD artwork (approx. 15% of budget) and if we reach our goal they will illustrate our children's book.  
The remaining 10% of our budget will be reserved for our promotional materials, t-shirts, buttons and stickers, and for distribution of materials to our supporters.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Donate directly  to the Orangutan Foundation International facility in the village of Pasir Panjang, near the town of Pangkalan Bun, Central Kalimantan.  https://orangutan.org/
