Along with great music this campaign has another mission; to help the plight of orangutans in Borneo today. Orangutans are facing extinction due to factors like illegal logging, forest conversion, large scale palm oil cultivation, fires, border disputes with local people, and jurisdictional disputes among government departments.  So as a part of this campaign 50% of all t-shirt profits will go to orphaned orangutans in Borneo. After we sell the one thousandth t-shirt, 100% of profits will be sent to organizations like Orangutan Foundation International that helps assist in the fight for the safety of orangutans.   Our goal is to foster four orphaned orangutans.
The money that is raised with this campaign will be used to pay for studio time, musicians, art work, CD manufacturing,  promotion and distribution.  We've also created our own line of music instruments, starting with high quality Remo drums, kazoos and egg shakers.  All these instruments will have our logo and will be great for jamming along with the music. 
And when we reach our goal, we'll then have the funds to create a children's book about Afunky's first day at preschool.  The book will be an educational tool for teachers, parents and child care providers to help with children that may have trouble on their first day of school. It also will be a great book for children to read to aid in their literacy.  So please help us reach our goal.   When we reach 100% of our goal.


Finish Afunky's debut album.
Secure all promotional material t-shirts, buttons, stickers and flyers.
Secure all Afunky's Uncle signature musical instruments.
Create and reproduce Afunky's very first children's book.
Raise money for endangered orangutans 



When we reach 150% of our goal.



All the things listed above
Produce our very first music video of  "Freeze Dance"



When we reach 200% of our goal.



All the things listed above
Produce a second album of classical sleepy time music. Perfect for putting young ones to bed.
Reproduce our curriculum for the classroom.
The CD will take the largest portion of our budget;  just over half (55%) of what we raise.  That will pay for musicians, travel, studio time, mixing and CD manufacturing.We have already secured a deal with Remo to have our own signature drums with our logo silk screened on the front. We are also going to have signature kazoos and shakers. Making these instruments will take a significant portion (20%) of our budget.  
Our logo was done by Terry Matsuoko and his Crunchy Sandwich team.  They will also be providing the CD artwork (approx. 15% of budget) and if we reach our goal they will illustrate our children's book.  The remaining 10% of our budget will be reserved for our promotional materials, t-shirts, buttons and stickers, and for distribution of materials to our supporters.  
    Other Ways You Can Help 
Donate directly  to the Orangutan Foundation International facility in the village of Pasir Panjang, near the town of Pangkalan Bun, Central Kalimantan.  https://orangutan.org/

story:
WHAT IS UN-COOKING IN OUR RAW KITCHEN!

Launched in 2013, YUUGA Kemistri is all about passionate living and quality lifestyle which promotes good health and happy bodies. Following a plant-based lifestyle is great and enhances the real beauty within. Yuuga Kemistri was founded by Asa, the creator of a variety of different health programmes and meal plans. Most popular, apart from the raw food classes, being the ’Eating raw for Real Beauty’. YUUGA Kemistri’s aim is to help others to nurture the body, mind and spirit the natural way. Following a RAWLICIOUS plant-based lifestyle is super-sexy and enhances the real beauty within.

                     'It's not always about the money money money'

             'We just wanna promote raw lifestyle, forget about the cooking'

YUUGA Kemistri is the fastest growing raw food coach in the UK today and has held over 200 classes since February 2013, and more than 2,400 raw food enthusiasts have got to enjoy learning about the significance of eating healthy and taking care of their temple, i.e. their body. With a growing company we have a growing array of amazing and life changing products to offer you. Ranging from our 4 Weeks on Raw meal plan, gorgeous ‘One Day Blissfully Raw’ recipes and our UK renowned un-cookery chocolate, superfood and most recently GREENTOX and Italian classes for beginners and our super raw foodies to enjoy.

Due to high demand and increased interest in our classes and programmes we have decided to put together a crowdfunding page that will allow us to expand and cater for the overwhelming demand of current and future clients.

HOW HAS YUUGA KEMISTRI GROWN:

Yuuga Kemistri has grown quick over the past 2 years and with big events and opportunities arising we’d love to be able to expand further, or most importantly help you to grow with us, and therefore we look to you to help us with the funds to set aside for these exciting and opportunistic activities.

We have BIG plans for YK such as the Raw Food Festival this summer in London which we’re expecting to be a massive hit! Also allowing our products to enter the market requires a lot of time, money and effort!

Along with high demand we've happily added extra classes to the ever growing schedule. Equipment, time and space is shrinking so that is where you guys come in.

In return for helping us, we will reward you with some fantastic perks that you can keep for yourself or give as a gift.

Why we need YOUR help!

The goal is to reach minimum £5700 but to truly meet properly, as we have envisioned, the huge demand for our products we aim to raise £9800 to cover additional costs involved in the speedy growth.

This is how we will use the funds:

A. Buy equipment which will be set up permanently in our London Venue:

1.  Food Processors (including 2 MagiMix and Vitamix)

2.  Small dehydrator

3.  2 Spiralisers

4.  4 set of high quality ceramic knives

5.  All crockery needed for tasting and trying the food made during class

6.  Storing of Material needed for tasting and using in dishes made during class. Currently all material is being transported to and from venue, before and after class.

7.  Storing of equipment at the venue to make the classes a greater experience for all parties, as it will eliminate transporting heavy equipment to and from venue.

B. Marketing

We intend to use 1/3 of the fund raised to increase the awareness of the classes in public with marketing (indirect and direct):  

Direct approach will make the classes available to more people, skip the promotion companies, which have taken a huge proportion of the income so far, and allow YUUGA Kemistri to be the direct contact between the classes offered and the client and in that way be able to provide more flexible booking and cancelling experience.

If you can’t see yourself in helping us with contribution at this time, we would love to have your help in spreading the news of our campaign. Get the word out help us to make a change for the better of good health and spreading the seedlings of the benefits of raw food. 

Hashtag in your comments the tag below #rawfortherecord and use the indiegogo links in this campaign and our twitter account @YUUGAKemistri so that we can thank you too!

That's all there is to it now - Lets get UN-Cooking and RAWCKING in the kitchen

story:
Time for a change

It is time for a language revolution!! Our goal is to make everyone at least bilingual.

Learning languages can be hard; even harder if you try to learn them the traditional way of learning a new language. 

Our CEO was taking a video course on Udemy which had some extra material to watch.  This was a Youtube link to Benny Lewis' TedX talk. This talk was called Become fluent in three months. 

Benny talked about his experience trying to learn Spanish and how he finally did learn it. How we are designed to learn any language it to start speaking then go back and learn the grammar. 


This is how we all learn to speak our mother tongue. We learn to speak as children before studying the grammar. This is how children can learn even two languages at the same time making them bilingual by the age of three. 

Our CEO had his eureka moment after watching this video. Why not make it so everyone could download a mobile application that would be able to help people learn how to speak new languages. 

This app will allow you to speak with those whom already speak your target language. You would be able to have a video, audio or instant message chat conversations with real people in the language you wish to learn.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need from you is social outreach. The more people that wish to see this app become a reality the faster we can accomplish this goal. 

We will also be publishing a blog for the app that will give some tips and techniques to help you learn to speak any language. This blog will also include common words to help get you started. 

The app will be launched with a Alpha and Beta test. Everyone that contributes to the campaign will be part of the Beta test. So we will be able to get your feedback to make the app the best that we can. 

The Alpha test will be included with certain perks. If the campaign goal is reached by July 15th everyone will that contributes will receive one month free subscription after the Beta test is complete.  


If this campaign breaks Indiegogo all time records everyone in that has contributed to the campaign will receive one year subscription after the Beta test. If your perk includes free subscription this will be added on top of your perk.


EXTRA

Our CEO will be adding video content to the campaign to show how the app will work. These will be a couple of minutes of FREE Finnish lessons. Stay tuned for each video. We will also be announcing our social media launches and our blog launch as well. The each of them will be giving links to articles relating to learning languages and some tips to get a jump start on the language you wish to start learning. 



Now Let's Talk Facebook and Google+ pages is now live!!!!


The Impact

With your support you will be showing the world that we all wish to learn new languages and that you want to learn it the right way. You will be showing that it is time for a language revolution. 

With the contributions made to the campaign we will be able to get more programmers involved and better tools to complete this project. The more money contributed the faster we will be able to get the project finished and make the blog even better with less time as well. 

This project will be completed no mater what. This campaign is to create a strong community with those whom wish to learn new languages the right way. The only thing that happens if this campaign fails is that the app will take longer to complete. 

We wish to get this done a fast as possible so you can start learning a new language more efficient and more effective.  


Outreach 

If you believe in this campaign please share it with others on social media. You can follow us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and Google+.

story:
THE CAUSE
All across the country there are families that have either been enrolled in martial arts or gym programs and are dropping out because they cannot keep up with the cost, or they simply never even tried because they cannot afford to give it a try.

It is no secret that staying active helps promote a healthy lifestyle, so we have teamed up with professional mixed martial artists to help spread the word.

You can even submit your own story and tell us why you and your family may possibly be in need.

THE MISSION
As funds are raised we are going to pay tuition directly to the school to help keep that child or family enrolled.

With your contribution you will also receive one or more of our special perks sent to at the conclusion of this project.

We want to give a very special thanks to Ashlee Evans-Smith, Colton Smith, and Cody Bollinger for helping to get this project off the ground.

SUBMIT YOUR STORY

Below are some of the stories that we have received.  You can submit your stories by emailing to us at mmareporter@mymmanews.com and we will add them here.

Here is the story from Angela Rijos

story:
The Opportunity

Scotiabank CONCACAF Champions League gives Sounders FC the opportunity to become Champions of Champions on the field – but we’re looking to you, Sounders FC fans, to help us be champions off the field as well!

In close partnership with Seattle International Foundation (SIF), Sounders FC Director of Community Outreach, Roger Levesque, will travel to Tegucigalpa, Honduras for community events leading into the Sounders FC Champions League match vs. CD Olimpia on Wednesday, August 26th.

SIF and Sounders FC will join forces with USAID and Creative Associates International to support their Youth Alliance Program – a regional network of community-run, youth centers dedicated to reducing violence, creating safe spaces and generating opportunity for learning, recreation and job training.

Outreach efforts include a field-refurbishment project at a Tegucigalpa Youth Center (see field above), one of the only “safe” public spaces for kids in the neighborhood to play soccer. In addition, Sounders FC coaches will team up with traveling ECS Supporters to run a youth soccer clinic at Estadio Nacional prior to Wednesday night’s Champions League clash. An on-field meet & greet with SFC players will round out the experience for the youth participants.

Sounders FC is seeking passionate soccer fans and global citizens to support these efforts!

More Information

story:
Short Summary

Massive financial support is going to be needed if Chin State and Sagaing region, Myanmar is to rebuild from the devastating Torrential monsoon rains which started since 20th of July in western part of Myanmar (Burma) that battered by strong wind and rains, many houses have been damages or completely destroyed. Chin State is the poorest state in Myanmar according to UNDP statistic so without your help they will take years to rebuild their homeland.There are reports of damage to health facilities, loss of running water and power outrages. These people immediate needs include shelter, water, food, health, etc. Due to a lack of clean water, disease is a major concern.

What We Need 

We need funds to support the purchasing and distribution of supplies for medical, Materials for building, etc.

the money you donate will be spend directly on:

~Medical supplies

~Supplies for reconstruction 

~ Labors

~Clean water

~ Foods

~Light

~Roads/bridges

~houses 

We are happy to share more budget details upon request.

The Impact

As a nation capable of impacting the lives of an individual to an entire country, we as Americans should have enough empathy and urgency to support Chin State that was destroyed by Torrential monsoon rains which started since 20th of July in western part of Myanmar also known as Burma.  By providing monetary donations will fund the reconstruction of the houses and land in community. Thereby, saving and extending the lives of the Chin peoples. Additionally, spreading the word about this will also broaden the success of rebuilding Chin lands.

Risks & Challenges

The first biggest challenge is actually getting to achieve this amount. Donating what you can goes such a long way towards rebuilding Chin State. We encourage you all to donate some money, even a dollar is worth Burma (Myanmar) 1000 kyat.

The second biggest challenge is getting the word out. So PLEASE share!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people don't have money to contribute now but want to support this donating. 

Here are a few ways that you can do: 

~Share this donating website through social media, email, etc.

 ~ Tell your family, friends, co-worker and fellow community about this devastating new.

~ You can also use the Indiegogo share tools below!

TOGETHER we can help transform Chin State thereby saving more lives and bring back the joy to the people of Chin State . Once the deadline has been reached i will transfer the money to Burma (Falam) using Western Union and post a receipt on here as proof. Again, we thank you for your generosity and promise regular updates and transparency in this process. Please do not hesitate to contract us. Linda Aung: Linda.aung94@gamil.com (240)405-2995, Joseph Lian: Josephlianft@gmail.com (336)312-1655, Thang Hrim: Matinthang@gmail.com (813)965-7668

story:
The Council Meeting

We cordially invite you to be part of the 51st Council Meeting of the European Students of Industrial Engineering and Management (ESTIEM) and help us realize this great event.
ESTIEM has more than 60 000 members. 
The Council Meeting is the general assembly of the network and has the goal to enhance the international collaboration between all students of technical-economical studies.
The Council Meeting is also an event where cultures and people from all over Europe come together to spend a week full of workshops, exchanging ideas and experiences and building friendships without borders. 
Therefore more than 300 students 
from more than 31 countries 
from more than 80 universities 
all over Europe will participate in this event. 
In this context, the students will get in contact with the Vienna University of Technology and selected companies, will exchange experiences and collect knowledge. Through the substantial schedule, the Council Meeting acts as a platform for the participants to establish new contacts and foster existing ones.
Why is this event important?
It gathers students from all over Europe together, fosters relationships and establishes new ones. As the network does not know any borders, people who could have rarely been part of the European exchange systems have the possibility to experience this great opportunity to make new friends and work together.
So this event connects Europe and help students to create borderless relations.
How can you help us?
When you donate during this IndieGoGo campaign, you are guaranteed to get the advertised reward(s). They’re affordable, they’re cool, there’s no guesswork and it's worth it. 
5$ = Your name on our website


15$ = 1 x Badge

20$ = 2 x Badges


25$ = Advertisement on our website


50$ = Wall of appreciation

                         


60$ = T-Shirt


75$ = Your individual space

        


150$ = One day experience



200$ = One day experience + Gala Dinner



300$ = Your Working Group room name


500$ = Your Video!

500$ = Working group



THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!!!

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $12,000. This money will be used for three distinct purposes:

1. Accomodation
We gather the participants in Hostels. They are perfect for interaction and making new friends in short time. Hostels are cheap, but if 300 students are going to stay  7 nights in a hostel in Vienna, we need your support to  accomodate everyone and avoid cutting down costs for this aspect.
2. Food
In order to serve our participants during their stay in Vienna, we need your support. We want to give out meals 3 times a day for perfect conditions. Everyone knows that we can reach our potential with the right food. To retrieve the full potential of the students it is necessary to offer the right meal.
3. Materials
We are going to arrange working groups and seminars for the students, for which nametags, printed materials and handouts will be used. We all know that a good seminar needs the right materials such as flip charts, white boards or posters. The learning experience will be significantly different. To offer the right studying atmosphere, we need your support to buy all these materials. 

What you get

There are goods from basics to allround packages and even companies can sponsor us to make this event come true!
If you are going to get a perk which offers you to interact with students such as the "individual space", you have the possibility to send your message and interact with the participants.
We highly recommend you to come to Vienna and join our event and choose one of our perks to do so. We would be really happy to welcome you!

F.A.Q.

What do I do if I want more than one perk? 

Each purchase of a perk is a new transaction, so you click on the perk you want, fill in your info, and buy it. Then, go back and select the other perk you wanted, and repeat the process.

Are smaller perks included in higher priced onces?

Every perk stands for its own. So perks which are worth more than others, doesn't include the previous offer. But we are happy if you also want to support us with more than one perk.


Made a mistake with that earlier? No problem! Send us an email at info@cmaustria.at and we'll work it out with you.

The Council Meeting is the general assembly of the network and has the goal to enhance the international collaboration between all students of technical-economical studies.

The Council Meeting is also an event where cultures and people from all over Europe come together to spend a week full of workshops, exchanging ideas and experiences and building friendships without borders. 
Therefore more than 300 students from more than 31 countries from more than 80 universities 
all over Europe will participate in this event. In this context, the students will get in contact with the Vienna University of Technology and selected companies, will exchange experiences and collect knowledge. Through the substantial schedule, the Council Meeting acts as a platform for the participants to establish new contacts and foster existing ones.
Why is this event important?
It gathers students from all over Europe together, fosters relationships and establishes new ones. As the network does not know any borders, people who could have rarely been part of the European exchange systems have the possibility to experience this great opportunity to make new friends and work together.So this event connects Europe and help students to create borderless relations.
How can you help us?
When you donate during this IndieGoGo campaign, you are guaranteed to get the advertised reward(s). They’re affordable, they’re cool, there’s no guesswork and it's worth it. 

5$ = Your name on our website
15$ = 1 x Badge


20$ = 2 x Badges



25$ = Advertisement on our website





50$ = Wall of appreciation



                         

60$ = T-Shirt




75$ = Your individual space
        

150$ = One day experience


200$ = One day experience + Gala Dinner






300$ = Your Working Group room name




500$ = Your Video!





500$ = Working group




THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!!!

What We Need
Our goal is to raise $12,000. This money will be used for three distinct purposes:
1. AccomodationWe gather the participants in Hostels. They are perfect for interaction and making new friends in short time. Hostels are cheap, but if 300 students are going to stay  7 nights in a hostel in Vienna, we need your support to  accomodate everyone and avoid cutting down costs for this aspect.
2. FoodIn order to serve our participants during their stay in Vienna, we need your support. We want to give out meals 3 times a day for perfect conditions. Everyone knows that we can reach our potential with the right food. To retrieve the full potential of the students it is necessary to offer the right meal.
3. MaterialsWe are going to arrange working groups and seminars for the students, for which nametags, printed materials and handouts will be used. We all know that a good seminar needs the right materials such as flip charts, white boards or posters. The learning experience will be significantly different. To offer the right studying atmosphere, we need your support to buy all these materials. 
What you get
There are goods from basics to allround packages and even companies can sponsor us to make this event come true!If you are going to get a perk which offers you to interact with students such as the "individual space", you have the possibility to send your message and interact with the participants. We highly recommend you to come to Vienna and join our event and choose one of our perks to do so. We would be really happy to welcome you!


F.A.Q.
What do I do if I want more than one perk? 
Each purchase of a perk is a new transaction, so you click on the perk you want, fill in your info, and buy it. Then, go back and select the other perk you wanted, and repeat the process.
Are smaller perks included in higher priced onces?
Every perk stands for its own. So perks which are worth more than others, doesn't include the previous offer. But we are happy if you also want to support us with more than one perk.

Made a mistake with that earlier? No problem! Send us an email at info@cmaustria.at and we'll work it out with you.

story: Inspired by forest kindergartens around the world, this school is a dream come true. Located at Andrus-on-Hudson, a senior care facility, Little Leaf is a nature-immersion inter-generational nursery program located on 24 beautiful acres. My students, ages 2-6, will spend time in the forests and gardens everyday and engage in meaningful activities with the elders of the community in our indoor classroom in the center. I need to raise funds for everything: classroom furniture, art supplies, toys, outdoor play equipment - you name it. Please help bring this school to life.

story:
Hi, my name is Teanna Hutchison and I study International Studies, Spanish, and Theatre at the University of Alaska Anchorage. I will be participating in a study abroad program through Academic Programs International in Seville, Spain during the 2015/2016 academic year. While there, I will be taking a full course load ranging from international relations, politics, history, and the Spanish language and will take part in various service projects throughout Spain. 

There are many reasons why I have chosen to study abroad, one of them being the fact that studying abroad in Spain will finally allow me to fulfill my lifelong dream of an adventure abroad. On a more crucial note, however, studying abroad will provide me my first chance at culturally integrating with a country that not only has different customs and traditions, but speaks a different language entirely. This will add to my international worldview by providing an important opportunity for me to apply what I have already learned from my studies at UAA and further build onto this established foundation, thus transforming me into a cosmopolitan citizen of the world, a goal I greatly want to achieve. A well-rounded person is not simply someone who has read about different areas of the world, but who has visited and experienced them, and can truly see the world from the perspective of another. Spain has vast historical significance, therefore I would be able to gain a deeper understanding of events learned and not yet learned in my history courses with a different point of view. Doing so will thereby provide the insight needed to help build a better future and avoid repeating past mistakes. 

Moreover, a year in Spain will provide me with an experience that will fuel my next step towards an even bigger goal, my future career. By allowing me to examine global issues firsthand and practice finding solutions that will help improve the lives of those less fortunate, I will be better prepared for my career goals after I graduate, which include: joining the Peace Corps, beginning a career with the Foreign Services, and/or working for a non-profit organization in an impoverished nation. Life has taught me that I am happiest when taking part in creating the joy of others around me, therefore I will apply this desire towards each and every career decision I make. In sum, there is only so much you can read in books and learn in a classroom, and my program will provide a supplemental and real-life experience component to my formal knowledge base, opening the necessary doors towards a future of serving those in need and providing opportunity for greater success in my future endeavors. 

Growing up in a full household of seven siblings, I have long accepted the necessity to pave my own way if I wanted to receive a higher education. With academic success and numerous part-time and full-time jobs, I have been able to put myself through college thus far. Unfortunately, no matter the amount I have saved, the expense of my study abroad in Spain is inevitable. Choosing to not study abroad, however, is out of the question, no matter the cost. It has always been my dream and I am trying as hard as I can to make that dream come true. I have overcome many obstacles to get to where I am today and I am confident that my constant drive for success and academic achievements will aid in my study abroad endeavors. My humble roots coupled with my unending desire for knowledge have and will continue to motivate me in my pursuit of higher education and ultimately success, a pursuit that I hope will continue to inspire my family, both young and old, for generations to come.

story:
Summary

Kids who grow up in favelas are at an automatic disadvantage. They grow up in proximity to drugs, crime and violence and more often than not lack proper basic services like education, and cultural activities. The students in Tia Percilia, located in Babilonia, come from low income families where both parents work. They don’t have a place to go when they are not in school. This puts them at risk of getting involved in criminal activities at a very young age. 

Escholinha Tia Percilia is a non-profit organization in the favela Babilonia, Leme, Rio De Janeiro-RJ, that aims to prevent school evasion and the proximity of crime and drugs, favouring the relationship of children with their families, with other children and with the community. Because of Escolinha Tia Percilia, children in the favela have a place to go before and after school where they can play football, learn English, do homework, capoeira, ballet, computer class, chess and go on field trips. The school aims to teach children that there are other choices, good choices and that they too have opportunities. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sumário

As crianças que crescem nas favelas, estão automaticamente em desvantagem no sistema social. Elas crescem em proximidade às drogas, crime e violência, e frequentemente lhes faltam o básico, alimentação e muito mais como educação e atividades culturais. Os estudantes da Tia Percília, ONG localizada na Babilônia, vêm de família com baixa renda per capita, onde ambos os pais trabalham. Essas crianças e jovens não tem um lugar para ir quando não estão na escola, e isso os coloca sob o risco de se envolverem com atividades ilícitas quando ainda são bem novos.

A Escholinha Tia Percília é uma organização sem fins lucrativos na comunidade Babilonia, Leme, Rio de Janeiro-RJ, que tem como objetivo prevenir a evasão escolar ea proximidade do crime e das drogas, favorecendo a relação das crianças com as suas famílias, com outras crianças e com a comunidade. Na Escolinha Tia Percília, as crianças da comunidade têm um lugar para estaren antes e depois da escola onde elas podem ter aulas de dança, Inglês, capoeira, ballet, informatico, xadrez, violão e fazer os deveres de casa. Além de excurções e passeios culturais e educativos. A escola tem como objetivo ensinar as crianças que existem outras opções, boas escolhas e que eles também têm e oportunidades.


What We Need 

But Escolinha Tia Percilia currently has only one sponsor, Insamlingsstiftelsen Gatubarn, based in Sweden. Although they have kept the school alive and thriving, there is only so much they can do and they have no local sponsors or help from the state. 

Escolinha Tia Percilia needs funds for renovations, a computer teacher, transportation for field trips and keeping the organization alive. They are asking for donation of any kind, money, volunteers, school supplies, furniture and kitchen supplies. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

O Que Nós Precisamos

Mas Escolinha Tia Percília atualmente tem apenas um mantenedor a fundação, Insamlingsstiftelsen Gatubarn, com sede na Suécia. Apesar de terem mantido a escola viva e próspera, a falta de patrocinadores locais ou ajuda do estado limita em muito as suas atividades.

A Escolinha precisa de patrocínio para reformas, um professor de informática, transporte para passeios e o mais importante: para manter a organização viva. Necessitamos doação de qualquer espécie: dinheiro, voluntários, materiais escolares, móveis de cozinha e suprimentos.


Thank you!

We are so grateful for any help you can give us!

Thank you!

Obrigado!

Ficaremos muito agradecidos por qualquer forma de auxílio que puder nos proporcionar!

Obrigada!

Contact/Contato

Escolinha Tia Percilia

Ladeira Ary Barroso n. 66, rua São Francisco n. 5, Babilonia

Leme, Rio de Janeiro-RJ, Brasil.

Tel: 21 3820-6258 

Email: contato@escolinhatiapercilia.com.br

http://www.escolinhatiapercilia.com.br/

story:
THE STORY

Recently Peter Lampard and Abdul Yeung, two of the founders of DEFT Community, visited rural Nepal where a friend’s home village, Dhungkharka, was hammered by the April 2015 earthquakes. 


Following the destruction of many local buildings, the village elders reached out to us for help in urgently rebuilding the village community centre and primary school.


Please join us in rebuilding these two main buildings in Dhungkarhka by donating to our Indiegogo Campaign.



THE PROBLEM

While the vast majority of local buildings in Dhungkharka utilize vernacular materials such as earth and timber, shoddy construction techniques have resulted in severe damage or the destruction of nearly every village home and building.


THE STRATEGY

Our strategy is to improve upon historic building techniques and to teach these techniques to the local tradesmen. This will ensure safe, earthquake-resistant buildings can be independently repeated in the future using locally available resources.


Through a collaborative team of designers, engineers, village leaders, and local craftsmen, these structures will be sustainable, earthquake-resistant and cost-effective.


Scroll to the bottom for more detailed information on the designs.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

  • Join our community and donate to our Indiegogo Campaign

  • Share the campaign with your friends and family and organizations you are involved with

  • Promote the project on social media (tag us using #DEFTCommunity or @designeightfivetwo)


To rebuild the community centre and primary school, we need to raise US$50,000. As of August 1, 2015 we have raised US$5,000 through our Crowdrise platform and the villagers from Dhungkharka have pledged to personally contribute US$5,000.


We need your help and support to fund the remainder of the project (US$40,000) through this Indiegogo campaign so we can begin construction by mid-October, 2015.


THE PERKS

We are partnering with local Hong Kong studio The Makeries to bring you some amazing perks at heavy discounts, so more of the money you contribute can go towards rebuilding Dhungkharka.

DEFT community Pocket Tee

DEFT community tote bag


Dhungkharka Village Map Poster


THE IMPACT OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION

To build the just the community centre , we will need about 4,050 feet of treated bamboo, 120 bags of cement, and 3616 sq.ft. of corrugated metal. Material estimates for the primary school are still in progress.


THE TEAM


Organizer/Designer

DEFT Community is a Hong Kong-based non-profit organization dedicated to creating safe, sustainable, and cost-efficient community projects in developing countries in partnership with respected professionals in the fields of vernacular architecture and earthquake engineering.

DEFT Community aims to:

-rebuild in developing countries using safe and sustainable construction techniques.

-provide educational opportunities for overseas volunteers in sustainable construction techniques.

-educate local villagers on safe and sustainable construction techniques that can be repeated in the future.


DEFT Community was founded by Peter Lampard, Norman Ung, and Abdul Yeung, the partners of Hong Kong design studio Design Eight Five Two (DEFT).


Technical Advisor/Contractor

Rammed Earth Solutions, based in Kathmandu, is a team of people who have come together due to their interest and experience in the great potential offered by constructing buildings out of rammed earth, and the other techniques we employ, to create sustainable and eco-friendly structures.


Earthquake Engineering Advisor

Dr. Richard Sharpe of New Zealand has over 30 years of experience in earthquake engineering, and led the development of a national building code for Nepal.


Richard is a Past President and Life Member of the New Zealand Society for Earthquake Engineering and has been a keynote speaker at international earthquake conferences in Turkey, British Columbia, India and Nepal, as well as in New Zealand. In 2007, Richard was made a Distinguished Fellow of the Institution of Professional Engineers New Zealand in recognition of his earthquake engineering contributions.


THE DESIGN

The first project in Dhungkharka will be a community centre complex of three rammed earth buildings, connected by a single roof. The site is a 30.0m by 6.1m plot of land on the side of a sloping hill.


The first building houses three programs: a guest room for two beds, a small library, and a washroom/shower. The total building measures 5m by 13.6m, staying within the advised 1:3 width to length ratio. Rammed earth wall thickness at the retaining wall side is 900mm to and 450mm at all other locations. Wall height stays at 3.5m throughout the entire site.


The second building functions as a meeting hall for village meetings and other events. The south-east facing facade is mostly open to allow for sufficient natural light, and can be closed off with a series of heavy curtains. The building measures 5m by 10.4m and wall thickness follows the pattern of the first building.


The final building is a small shrine, formed by four L-shaped rammed earth columns at the corners. The building measures 2.8m by 3.6m.


A lightweight roof covers all three buildings. Corrugated metal panels are attached to a series of bamboo beams which cross in both directions. At the north-west wall, the roof touches down on bamboo poles which are embedded in the thicker (900mm) rammed earth wall. At the south-east wall, bamboo posts take the weight of the roof down to the ground.

Study Models of Bamboo Structure

Plan of Proposed Community Centre

Section of Proposed Community Centre


Rendering of Proposed Community Centre

Rendering of Proposed Community Centre

Rammed Earth Construction Basics

THE PROJECT SCHEDULE

In the following months a lot will be happening. DEFT Community will be going to make their second trip to Dhungkharka on September 3 to meet with the construction team, villagers and advisors to present the designs and coordinate the manpower and to set a timeframe for each phase of the project.

We pledge to use your contributions effectively to build these safe, sustainable, structures. We will post regular updates on the project’s progress and look forward to hearing feedback from you.

LEGAL DISCLAIMER

Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.

story:
About Us 

We are a diverse team of four business students from Colorado State University’s Global Social Enterprise MBA Program. With 25 years of combined experience in the government, private, and nonprofit sectors, we realize that tackling some of the world’s toughest problems requires innovation - and innovation happens when industries collaborate.

By aligning our abilities and passions we undoubtedly have the necessary skill-sets to create a social enterprise that will revolutionize how early childhood education is taught in urban slums.

JOLT

Our goal is to motivate and incentivize parents living in poverty to become their child’s primary educators.

Before the age of 6, a child’s brain develops at an exponential rate. Regular, intentional parent interaction has proven to be the most effective way to maximize a child’s potential later in life; making a child 20% more likely to graduate from high school and earn 30% more than she would otherwise.

Jolt aires weekly radio programs that enhance parent-child interaction through guided activities, arming parents with the knowledge to impact their child’s development. Our incentive model offers parents who listen to the program the potential to earn 2 days their normal wage in only hour by participating in market research on their mobile phone.

There are 800 million radios in the developing world. Likewise, 75% people around the world own a cell phone. The bottom of the pyramid spends 10% of their income on telecommunications. 

Thus, we are re-inventing how local assets are used to meet the growing global demand for data while ensuring children grow up to be healthy and successful.


What We Need

We want to further validate our incentive model by measuring response rates from future customers; parents in slums. To do so, we need $10,000 to travel to Guatemala in June and implement the model.  Your contributions, wether we reach our total funding goal or not, will help us launch our pilot, test our hypothesis with real customers, and measure our success. Our key activities of our minimum viable product include:

  1. Create localized ECE content for radio

  2. Establish transmitters in slums to broadcast radio program

  3. Establish a minimum viable cell phone response system

  4. Run market research survey

  5. Purchase rewards for respondents and test which incentives generate more responses

  6. Identify potential clients to participate in future mobile market research

  7. Identify local radio stations to broadcast program in future

We will base our success off of the number of listeners, respondents, and the number slum communities penetrated.

The Impact

Early childhood learning is critical to a child’s future success.

In Jamaica, the World Bank identified two groups of mothers with stunted children. Half of the mothers received a weekly intervention from volunteers reminding them of the importance of interacting with their child. Twenty-two year later, researchers followed up and discovered that the children who received the intervention earned 30% more than those that did not, and the amount of healthy children. But getting volunteers to go door to door, visiting parents is not scalable. Luckily, Jolt is.

Not only are you helping us launch our business, you are helping us get one step closer to winning $1 million. We are competing for the Hult Prize, a startup accelerator for social entrepreneurs.  If we generate enough support we may be selected as finalist to participate in an accelerator this summer with the top social entrepreneurs around the world before the final competition.  


Risks and Challenges

Global challenges pose countless risks and challenges. The pilot phase is the most integral step in ensuring sustainability of our business. Fortunately, we have formed partnerships with organizations in Guatemala that will guide us in establishing a relationship with the community and serve as our first market research client.

story:
Our Mission

Peace Love Plates is a non-profit organization providing free cooking and nutrition classes as well as the knowledge and tools necessary to cook healthy and affordable meals. We teach underprivileged individuals that cooking healthy and affordable meals doesn't have to be difficult or time consuming, and we encourage them to join around the dinner table more often with their families. It only takes a basic understanding of how to shop frugally, identify healthy and non-healthy ingredients, and how to prepare them into beautiful, nutritious meals at home to make the most of your budget and make healthier decisions.. 

Our Story

Peace Love Plates, founded in 2013, has conducted multiple cooking and nutrition classes, reaching over 200 people from varying socioeconomic, race, and cultural background – at no cost to their students. We have developed a hands-on, nutrition based class curriculum, an instructional program used to equip and teach future class instructors, and handout material used to teach basic nutrition education. After each class, we join around a dinner table together and enjoy the meals we just cooked. With this information, our students have left our classes feeling empowered to make more informed decisions in the grocery store and their kitchen as they take small steps toward improving their own personal health. 

How You Can Help

$10,000 - With these funds, Peace Love Plates would be able to conduct 75-100, directly impacting between 750-2,000 people. These free classes include our printed handout materials as well as any additional cookware, raw materials, and promotional expenses needed.

$60,000 – This funding will allow us to hire a full time Program Director for one year that would conduct daily operating tasks including logistically organizing and conducting cooking our free classes on a weekly basis, program research and development, fundraising and promotion, network expansion through mutual partnerships, brand management, and establishing Peace Love Plates as a highly recognized organization.

$100,000 - Our biggest stretch goal would allow us to conduct the 75-100 classes, hire a full-time Program Director, and hire part time employees and offer paid internship programs to young students interested in cooking, nutrition, and public outreach. 

Why We Need You

Peace Love Plates has been operating with only three executive officers performing all operations in their personal free time. With the help of full-time employees to develop our program, materials, and execute business plan milestones, we look to effectively achieve our mission on a much larger scale within a much shorter period of time. One-third of all premature deaths are from diet-related diseases, and by providing these free cooking and nutrition classes we can reduce that number drastically!

Although progress has been made, Peace Love Plates has reached the point where it needs a highly skilled and passionate employee, working full-time, to take the organization to the next level. Without this full-time employee, Peace Love Plates will continue to move forward at an incredibly slow rate. It is in our best interest to entrust the progression and development to someone spending each and every day developing our organization and creating influential networks within our local community. 

In Summary

Peace Love Plates, as a public benefit organization, owes it to their community to provide their life-changing classes on a more frequent schedule. Without someone working full-time, this cannot happen.

Join us in sharing the wonderful world of healthy cooking on a budget as we provide our free hands on cooking and nutrition classes to the community of Los Angeles and hopefully, in time, throughout the United States.

What Happens if We Don't Reach Our Goals?

That would be a bummer, but every little bit helps and we need any help you can provide! Even if we raise just $1,000, that would allow us to provide 10-15 free classes and impact the lives of 100-250 people! Each class requires approximately 20 hours of labor and between $50-$100 depending on the varying ingredients in each recipe.

I Want to Help, but I Don't Have Money!

Oh boy, do we still need you! You can still play a fundamental role in Peace Love Plates' mission by sharing the link to our campaign on your Facebook Wall, Twitter Timeline, emailing it to your friends and family, or even volunteering to help with our cooking classes! If you love cooking and want to help your community, come share your knowledge and recipes!

story:
OUR STORY

The idea started when our  5 year old kid asked us to create a game for Diamand, his 6 years old relative who has leukemia.

He was convinced that the game would help Diamand fight cancer. He felt so strongly of it, that we started  production. We were so close to finishing the game, but we were not fast enough, Diamand passed away.


We were shocked. Diamand was on her way to Italy to receive the additional care. Unfortunately her small body couldn’t handle anymore treatment. Because of this, we began to ask questions.

Why is it that modern treatment is so painful for kids? Why are donations so passive and slow? How can we communicate with these kids to empower them during treatment?

It took us some time to brainstorm solutions and ideas, and finally, we came up with our own solution, AURORA.

THE PROJECT                  

Aurora is a mobile gamified international platform to support kids with cancer. 

Aurora’s mission is to create a sustainable platform with three cores: 

Empowering kids with cancer:

Kids in cancer treatment will join the Aurora league of personalised super heroes side by side with kids from all over the world aged three to eleven to beat cancer. They will play games, read interactive books and engage in various educational, medical and social activities.


Aurora will host a thought system, where kids share their achievements and scores and send them towards a friend in treatment as thoughts. Thoughts are cumulative positive energies to empower their friends in treatment. Kids in treatment can use the thoughts to upgrade their super heroes avatars.

We will be partnering up with international writers and indie game developers to create the richest and most fun content for Aurora. 

                                   

Removing the passive donation model:

Kids in cancer treatment become alienated from social life due to the treatment nature and the exhausting effects of the treatment. Aurora will enable a social layer for kids in cancer treatment, where they interact and make friends with kids from all over the world. 
Every purchase of Aurora is a donation that will help a friend that you met on the platform get a personalised treatment that will enable him and her to get a normal life. 

       

Financially support cancer research centres:

With your support we will create Aurora. When Aurora will be released, the public would purchase it once for $1. Additionally, generous donors who subscribe for only $1 a month will significantly contribute to cancer research.

60% of Aurora’s revenue will go to active international cancer research centres while 40% will be used to create more games and books for the kids to enjoy and to help support and grow the platform.

We are creating a network with international organisations that support cancer research centres on the globe creating better personalised and optimised treatment for kids with cancer. 

                        

The platform will always be free for kids in Cancer treatment.  

                                   

Their journey is a tough one, but together, through Aurora, we can make it easier, filled with hope and fun. 

WHO WE ARE:

Wixel Studios is an independent gaming company based in Lebanon. Established in 2008, Wixel started developing fun and innovative video games based on original local and international intellectual property

With more than eight years in video games production, and international awards. Our mission today is  to create  a project that will inspire and empower children from all over the world.  

WHAT WE ARE ASKING FOR:

We are raising $120,000 to cover the first milestone that will enable to create Aurora and to publish it.

The first version of Aurora will be on IOS, Android and with a little push WM8 supported smart devices and it will have one game and five interactive books.

This is how we will use the money:

Tasks

Percantge

Platform Programming of both iOs and Android

45%

Backend programming

20%

Arts and animations

20%

PR and Marketing

15%

YOUR REWARDS 

You will be mentioned as cofounder
You will get life free access to the portal
You will get customised t-shirts and posters

You will get little heroes’ white figurine that you can custom paint with your kids.

The most valuable reward is the impact that Aurora will bring into these kids’ life.

WE CAN'T DO IT WITHOUT YOU

Every 3 minutes, a child is diagnosed with cancer . Two thirds of children treated for cancer will suffer long-term effects from this treatment.

But it doesn't have to be this way! We can solve the problem by funding research centres all over the world to improve the quality of life for patients and survivors.

We can't do it without you. Please consider being a part of the solution for our precious children by contributing the campaign.

If you can't support us financially, please help us share the campaign. 

Be part of it, NOW.

story:
Hi there, this is Erica Orosco Cruz, Director and Founder of Homeschool Garden, a small school (in the Los Angeles area) established in 2001. I'm here because I'm dedicated to revolutionizing education. I've worked with children and their families for over 20 years in a public school, corporate care, private schools, as a camp counselor, parent educator, and as a private nanny. I searched to find a program that brought children to the forefront, while providing clear boundaries for mutual respect, where children would be seen and heard and where adults would see with new eyes and listen for what was unsaid. Homeschool Garden is based on those values and we have developed a school model that provides an environment where children, families, and teachers can thrive and grow together on the foundation of mutual respect.

What has been created is 

A community of families and friendships that are long lasting even years after the families have graduated from the school program

A growing organic garden, that is harvested for our nutritious organic meals. Wholesome food that is cooked on site and provided for all the children and faculty

Small individualized group care for children during their foundational years 

Support for families through workshops, parent conferences, and community for the child’s developing transitions is all inclusive

This campaign is to bring Homeschool Garden's model to more families and provide an opportunity for more children to grow organically 
*Provide for our non profit application process
*Sustain the current program offerings: including scholarships to families, 
multi-language offerings, and specialty teachers
*Allow for growth as we transition and reach out to further spread the model and revolutionize the education status quo 
What I've witnessed over the years is the strength in the community. Children at school are like family, when you create the environment for it. They support, interact, and engage, it's what they observe from each other, the faculty, and their families.

How many lives do you want to touch with your donation?

We want to bring this kind of education revolution to more children and what we've seen is families transformed, communities developed, and a big desire to spread the word

We are raising the proverbial roof and need the tools to play BIGGER and HARDER than ever before 

AND we've got some special and ONE OF A KIND perks for your generous donations 

Gorgeous Horse Photography on Maplewood by Sarvey Tahmasebi Rector Photography

Handcrafted Dolls 

Handcrafted Healing Balms (for congestion, for bumps, and for dry skin) by Simply Yours

Humorous hand drawn piece by Art Director Michael Isaak of Dreamworks  


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share because You Care AND to get the Word Out and Make Some Noise about Our campaign.
  • Remember using the Indiegogo share tools makes it easy

And that's all there is to it... THANK YOU, ALREADY!


(Perk Images: also refer to Gallery for larger images)

story:
Hi, I'm Jo. I'm a marketing consultant from Shrewsbury (UK), no expert in the refugee crisis, crowdfunding or lifejackets!  I am a normal person who has been following the #refugeecrisis story on the news and in the papers and decided to take action and try to help. (You can find me on LinkedIn if you want to know more about me, just search for Joanna Seabright or on Twitter @JibberJabberJo)

We need to do something to help refugees crossing the sea, and prevent men, women and children dying in such sad circumstances. My mission is to raise money to supply life jackets and support to refugees.

Obviously, getting lifejackets to those who are risking their lives and prepared to go through traffickers is an impossible task, so we have agreed to send funds to MOAS (the Migrant Offshore Aid Station) - dedicated to preventing loss of life at sea by providing assistance to migrants who find themselves in distress while crossing the Mediterranean Sea in unsafe vessels. http://www.moas.eu/our-mission/

MOAS have informed us that each lifejacket costs around £15 and they try and use them more than once where possible, so each £15 we can raise will help save a number of lives

Can you help by donating to our cause? Contact us or donate today!

story:
The Problem:

There is an unemployment crisis for individuals with disabilities in the Commonwealth of Virginia and across our Nation:

·  21,000 students with disabilities graduate each year in the Commonwealth of Virginia.

·  About 2,500 students with disabilities graduate in the Greater Richmond Area each year.

·  An average of 69% of these students graduate from school and are unable to find or keep employment (Va DOE).

·  On a national level, 81% of adult with disabilities are unemployed, compared to only 32% of the general population (US Bureau of Labor).

Unfortunately, there are many students with disabilities in our community who cannot find or keep employment after graduation. To put it in simple terms, the status quo is not working. Shouldn’t all students get to be excited about the future?

The Solution:

Everyone deserves a chance to work, gain independence, and prove his or her value. At The Next Move Program, we believe that this also applies to graduating students with disabilities. With your help, we can provide both transferable work experiences and the supporting education to empower these high school students to reach their potential.

The Next Move Program is a year round internship program for graduating high school students with special needs. We can accommodate up to 18 students at one site in a year, over the course of three sessions. The program is managed and supervised by certified special education teachers. Students are placed as a group within a business in order to gain much-needed work experience. Students spend 50% of their day in a classroom learning work readiness skills, social skills, and life skills.

Proof Our Model Works:

Student Growth in Job Site Independence

Student Growth in Soft Skills Development

***Data shows averages collected over 5 sessions of students from our pilot programming in 2013-2015.

How You Can Help:

The annual budget for operating The Next Move Program at one host site is approximately $140,000. This amount allows for 18 high school students with special needs to participate, by covering the salaries of two certified special education teachers, classroom materials, program materials, and administrative expenses.

Host businesses provide the physical location where our students receive vocational education and training. They often do not provide full financial funding. Rather than burden the families we support, we turn to the crowdfunding community…$8,000 covers the full tuition expenses for one student to participate in a 12-week internship. Please donate today so that all young people, including students with special needs, can have a bright future.

$26,000.00

Please donate today and change a young person's future! Don't forget to share this campaign with others. Together, we can make a difference!

To learn more, find us on facebook or twitter (links are listed in our contact information). Also, visit our website at www.thenextmoveprogram.com
story_txt:
The Problem:
There is an
unemployment crisis for individuals with disabilities in the Commonwealth of
Virginia and across our Nation: 
· 
21,000 students with disabilities graduate each year in the
Commonwealth of Virginia.
· 
About
2,500 students with disabilities
graduate in the Greater Richmond Area each year.
· 
An average
of 69% of these students graduate
from school and are unable to find or keep employment (Va DOE).
· 
On a
national level, 81% of adult with
disabilities are unemployed, compared to only 32% of the general population (US Bureau of Labor).
Unfortunately,
there are many students with disabilities in our community who cannot find or
keep employment after graduation. To put it in simple terms, the status quo is
not working. Shouldn’t all students get to be excited about the future?
The Solution:
Everyone deserves
a chance to work, gain independence, and prove his or her value. At The Next
Move Program, we believe that this also applies to graduating students with
disabilities. With your help, we can provide both transferable work experiences
and the supporting education to empower these high school students to reach
their potential.
The Next Move Program is a year round internship program for
graduating high school students with special needs. We can accommodate up to 18
students at one site in a year, over the course of three sessions. The program is
managed and supervised by certified special education teachers. Students are
placed as a group within a business in order to gain much-needed work
experience. Students spend 50% of their day in a classroom learning work readiness
skills, social skills, and life skills.

Proof Our Model Works:Student Growth in Job
Site Independence
Student Growth in Soft
Skills Development



***Data shows averages
collected over 5 sessions of students from our pilot programming in 2013-2015.
How You Can Help:
The annual budget for operating The Next Move Program at one
host site is approximately $140,000. This amount allows for 18 high school
students with special needs to participate, by covering the salaries of two
certified special education teachers, classroom materials, program materials,
and administrative expenses.
Host businesses provide the physical location where our
students receive vocational education and training. They often do not provide
full financial funding. Rather than burden the families we support, we turn to
the crowdfunding community…$8,000 covers the full tuition expenses for one
student to participate in a 12-week internship. Please donate today so that all
young people, including students with special needs, can have a bright future.

story:
The Problem

Africa's image in the media is not very encouraging. It makes you feel as if all is lost with no glimpse of hope on the continent. 

I have found that to be a big FALSE. There is a new generation of African's who are pushing the boundaries.

I’m Musah, a young graduate from the University of Ghana and very passionate about Africa. I started a news magazine website this year aimed at telling the African success stories.    www.RisingAfrica.org

I believe we ought to change the narrative about Africa. It’s time we tell our own story.


Africa is Rising

Africa have had her fair share of challenges but despite going through so much, this generation still keeps the hope of a prosperous Africa alive for the unborn, against all odds. This generation is full of achievers, while some are household names; others are unsung or totally unknown. All these achievers are ordinary men and women who have risen above these challenges and are making impact and showing future promises at the same time.

At Rising Africa we seek to tell these inspiring success stories so as to generate and encourage the ‘CAN DO and believe in yourselves’ attitude in others and also give some publicity to these achievers and their efforts.

Our stories cover Africans at all age levels and in every sector of the economy - Our Wonder Kids section covers Africans from age 7 to 12, Super Teens section between age 13 to 19 years old and Young Achievers from 20 to 30 years old. We also have a special section for WOMEN in Africa and working on another section for the disable.


Rising Africa is more than a website

Rising Africa is more than just a website, it’s a cause we are championing to populate the media space (print, online, TV and radio) with these great stories. Starting from Ghana (host country) we will grow to all the African countries by forming strategic partnerships with various youth groups on the continent. We will be doing the following all aimed at spreading these stories and also building capacity to enable many more to rise - 

·  Radio and TV programs

·  Create short inspirational and capacity building videos and audios to be made viral on social media.

·  Seminars, workshops and Conferences

·  Create monthly newsletters / magazines (print and online) of great African stories and capacity building articles.

·  Build a network of progressive and forward thinking African’s called the Rising African Network (RAN Africa) in all African countries and for African’s in the diaspora.

·  Inspire innovation and entrepreneurship in Africa through

1.  Creating an online crowdfunding portal to provide funding opportunity for great African ideas

2.  Start an incubator to nurture and grow startups.

·  We plan to go into documentaries and movies as well all aimed at telling these success stories.


We need your support

With your support we will do the following as part of our core mandate of telling the African Success Story.

1.  Increase our hosting capacity for the website to be able to accommodate higher traffic.

2.  Build a mobile app (all platforms) for the work.

3.  Start online ad campaign to reach more people.

4.  Start our print magazine/newsletters with these great stories for non-online readers.

5.  Start our weekly radio program on the two major tertiary university campuses in Ghana (University of Ghana and Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and technology)

6.  Purchase cameras and other equipment to help us in the creation of inspiring videos for our YouTube channel and hopefully for TV.


The Impact

As we share these stories, articles and videos, we seek to inspire and equip others to rise. People will also be inspired to pick up great entrepreneurial / business ideas they can start in their various countries / towns from the website. Another key impact is the positive publicity this campaign will be giving to all these new ideas and startups springing up.

I believe this can go a long way to restrain our youth from dangerous ‘greener pastures’ journey to Europe and the America’s. Because now there will be self believe.


Challenges

The road ahead will not be easy and sometimes will prove impossible. We’ve had times we felt like giving up on this project but like everyone else, the stories we tell inspires us to carry on. We are the number one beneficiaries of our work. We are young and restless and above all we believe in Africa, so we will work hard to see Africa rising no matter what. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We definitely need money to make this happen, but even if you can't donate there are several other ways to help:

1. You can start by joining our team. Whether you are an individual or organization, there is always something for you to do. You can 
      (a) write for us - success stories, inspirational and capacity building articles /                     videos
      (b) Be a social media champion - Share our stories on Facebook, Twitter and                       other social media platforms
       (c) Join our network of rising Africans (RAN Africa - Rising African Network) -                      RAN Africa will launch in December. Do check our website for more                                      information. You can apply to be a member as well as become a curator to                    organize RAN events in your town / country.

2. We are seeking to start a studio and thus we will appreciate those who can support us in that way. Help can range from professional advice, training and even some media equipment we will need. Send us a note here. 


It’s an exciting journey ahead as we hope to play a key role in a new Africa. 

                            Let’s work together to achieve greatness.

                                                Africa is calling!

story:
#whenigrowup : Raising vital funds to help the kids of Baan Unrak Children's home ( baanunrak.org ) realise their dreams and goals. A different kid's story and dream every 48 hours and I ask you to share your childhood dreams using the #whenigrowup once you have donated! 

With more children than every attending higher, further of vocational education, its crucial to raise more funds to allow this to continue. The good news is, it really works...

Education is the cornerstone of development, and for those of you who like to see tangible results, I can assure you they are here in abundance! From watching grade 3 children learn to multiply and divide, to seeing young adults using the vocational skills they have learned such as mechanics and hairdressing to support the children’s home, to seeing adults that came to the home as children who studied Law and now help the children to fight for their rights.

 

Education also helps these stateless children to have a voice, beat challenges and grow in the confidence they need to face the obstacles and tasks of the future.

 

We all wanted to be ‘something’ when we were little, right?

Lets help these children be exactly that. 

 

Education will help these kids do just that.

story:
Hello! My name is Roy Rabotich.
Anyway,  I am a computer repair technician and for the last two years I work as a technical and customer support. In my free time, I've experimented with web development, more specifically ASP.NET and HTML5. Now, I'd like to switch careers and become a certified web developer.

My problem

The training and certification requires money and my trusty old laptop died it's final death. His memories continue to live on an external hard drive, but right now I don't have a laptop on which to practice.

So, to be clear this project's ultimate goal is: get an education to become a web developer.

To achieve this goal, your contributions will be used for the following purposes:


1) Get online and other courses of web programming and pass the following Microsoft exams:

Programming in HTML5 with JavaScript and CSS3 480
Developing ASP.NET MVC Web Applications 486
Developing Microsoft Azure and Web Services 487
which will cost around 1000$ (Pluralsight membership, exam costs, book costs etc).

2) Buy a laptop - 1450$
I'd like to buy Fujitsu Lifebook E554, which costs around 1450$ with sales tax and shipping.

3) Pay assorted costs to Indiegogo, bank, paypal shipping costs and suprise expenses: 550$ 

So, 1450+1000+550= 3000$. Anything above that amount will go towards continuing my education and costs of living.

Risks & Challenges

Even if I can not fund the entire amount, I need a laptop to continue my education a as web developer. So I will be purchasing one, one way or another. This fundraiser will help me get it quicker and will make an impact on what sort of laptop I'm going to get and what courses and exams I'm going to take. Again, even if we don't reach goal, ALL help ROCKS.

In any case, I will do everything in my power to deliver your rewards. Speaking of which...

What's in it for you?

The sense of accomplishment which you get from helping a fellow get up in the world. Also, these rewards below:

My appreciation!

Anyone who contributes anything will forever have my gratitude!

Thank you! (handwritten note)

Give $5  and you'll get handwritten Thank You note, scanned and sent to you by email!

Thank You Squared!

Give $10 and you'll get Handwritten Thank You note, scanned and sent to you by email + your name will be pubilished on my web site, which I will make during my training.

Postcard + Thank You Squared!

 Give  20$ and you'll get a lovely postcard from my country+ previous rewards!

Custom souvenir + previous!

Give 50$ Custom hand made souvenires from my country +previous rewards!

Fancy IT t-shirt! Limited :)

Give 95$ and you'll get IT themed t-shirt+ souvenir+postcard+Thank You squared! Limited number at lower price.

Bak Thanks you t-shirt Limited

That little doggy that smiles as one of the rewards is called Bak, my best friend and he volunteered* to put his likeness on one of the rewards .What a good boy!

*volunteered - was bribed with a treat

Give $95 Picture of my dog Bak as puppy on a T-shirt + souvenir+postcard+Thank You Squared!

My dog thanks you t-shirt!

The same as above, picture of my dog Bak as puppy on a T-shirt + souvenir+postcard+Thank You Squared but at full price of $100.

Fancy IT t-shirt (again)

IT themed t-shirt + souvenir+postcard+Thank You squared  but at full price of $100!

Other Ways You Can Help!

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help me out!

  • Spread the word! If you know anyone who might be interested in helping one man achieve his dream career, even outside of the scope of this project I would be more than willing to work with them.
  • You can easily share my Fundraiser with the awesome tools that Indiegogo created! 
Thanks again everyone for taking the time to read this, your friendship means a lot to me!
